Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: alicia18
Reviews.Content: What terribly rude hotel staff at reception - wouldn't know meaning of the word service. We asked for a Queen and got two singles. Phone was disconnected had to ask twice and wait ages for someone to fix it. We were part of a tour group and someone found underwear in their drawers and another couple found dirty room service dishes. Only good thing was the buffet breakfast and the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Do not deserve to have any customers”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: No point in telling you about the hotel, only about why there is no point in staying here, namely 3 reasons: 1. They do not answer the phone: tried calling reception, switchboard, room service and EMERGENCY from the room and there was no reply. Then tried calling them from my mobile as if it were an outside call: NO REPLY. This happened on day 1 and on day 2 so not an isolated event. 2. Asked for a shaving kit and toothbrush. It would be brought to the room - it never arrived. 3. As a platinum member I am entitled to free internet - they still charged me for it.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously in need of rennovations”
Reviews.Author: ask_mikey
Reviews.Content: This is not what I expected from a Sheraton or Starwood property; a low-end tourist class hotel would have been nicer. I moved rooms because I wanted a queen size bed, and both rooms were extremely dated, with old worn-out furniture. This furniture looks like something left over from the 90s. My second room (with the queen bed) didn't even have any doors on the wardrobe (they had been completedly removed!!). The manufacturing date on the TV is March 1992 (are you kidding me??). There are marks on the walls were paintings were once hanging (the hanging screws are still sticking out of the wall). The wood trim around the inside of the bathroom door was decaying at the bottom (due to years of contact with water on the floor and from the tub). It appears to be relatively clean, and the check-in staff seemed friendly. However, this place should have been renovated YEARS ago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property/ Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: khacy19
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here part of our honeymoon 9/2011 and it was a nice property for the rate we got on Expedia. During our stay, they had construction going on. We did not find it bothersome. The hotel outside near the pool was our favorite! The bartender was attentive and knowledgeable about the Rome area. We would recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “It’s a Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Julio B
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a real Sheraton. Do not be surprised by this comment, some Starwood hotels in Italy do not have the prestige to be called Starwood Hotel. The service was excellent. The hotel is nice, the buffet breakfast I wish I could have it every day. The safety in the hotel is great. You feel welcome. They take care of you. I have to tell you that when I booked this hotel I was a little nervous about the low reviews in Tripadvisor. After staying, I believe it is ranked too low. This hotel should be in the top 50 in Rome. If you are with a family, the second room could be 50% off. Internet is fast (paid). I love hotels with Vending machines and Ice machines in your room floor. They have paid automatic minibar which I do not like, but I was able to use it for my own refrigeration purposes with permission from the Front Desk. They are flexible, which I liked. You will be pleasantly surprised. It is not very close to the downtown, but a Taxi was between 10-15 euros to downtown. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous room service”
Reviews.Author: pee-dubleya
Reviews.Content: stayed here on our second visit to rome , partly chose the hotel due to the free shuttle into the city.The room service was second to none . only dowside was that we once got on the wrong shuttle ( nthey both say sheraton and are similaraly coloured the driver was very unhelp ful and refused to let us out as we passed by our hotel and proceeded to dump us a long taxi journey away from our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but rather tired”
Reviews.Author: ArgyleNick
Reviews.Content: A spacious hotel with good facilities and friendly staff. The wardrobe in my room was not wide enough to hang shirts unless twisted to an angle. The inside door of the wardrobe was dusty which then rubbbed off on the shirts. No tea/coffee facility and not allowed to use fridge in room for own drinks; rather mean spirited I thought. Room was hot and air conditioning didn't cool well. Acceptable and functional bbut not what you would expect from a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Raingod9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business and found everything to be just average. My room was clean and fault free though a little tired in places which was better than my colleagues rooms which suffered from electrical faults and broken wardrobe doors to name but two. The restaurant food was disappointing for a Sheraton and the service was, as others have mentioned, disinterested. However the service in the bar by the pool was much better and the club sandwiches there were excellent. The hotel is about 10 kilometers from the centre of Rome and in an area with no bars or restaurants within walking distance. There is however a decent hotel bus service which runs every couple of hours into the centre of Rome and costs 3 euros return. Overall it is not a place that I would choose to stay at again

Reviews.Title: “Average all the way”
Reviews.Author: nikolai69
Reviews.Content: very average business hotel. average rooms in an average building with an average disinterested service. breakfast in room hugely overpriced (20€ for a dry bun and an even dryer danish pastry with some machine generated powder coffee, and a little plastic pack of Nestlé Jam - for shame!) Very nice gym in the basement, and excellent clublounge with terrasse. Function rooms are mostly in the american style without windows or other access to daylight, so dont arrive here too jet-lagged or you will snooze off during your meeting. Location is excellent for the airport and 20 minutes away from Rome proper (or so the hotel says - actually it is more like an hour including various traffic jams on the accident prone tripple-parked access roads into the city) .

Reviews.Title: “An Aging Empress”
Reviews.Author: Limbers
Reviews.Content: How the mighty fall. Once, this would have been a fine hotel to stay in and enjoy the city. But these days, I would suggest you look elsewhere. The fittings are aging to say the least, the air conditioning is poor, and right next to major roads. You're still over 15 minutes ride from town, and not situated anywhere particularly convenient. I don't think they really maintain their business centre either. I tried checking in for my flight, but their IT was faulty.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - good value for vacations”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPeruzzi
Reviews.Content: Location outside ancient Roma, in front of a highway but not noisy (and in any case you can ask for a back room "lato tennis" and far from the elevators if you want a very quiet room). Hotel is a large building with many rooms, sheraton city-hotel style. Room are ok for a city Sheraton, a little bit "old". Hotel bus transport to Rome available; underground and other public transportation stuff not close. People of the hotel very nice and willing to help you. I stay there 5-6 times per year and sometimes I decided to change room because of A/C noice: they offered me more than one option and time to decide. No good if you want to walk outside at night because there is nothing to see around unless you walk to the EUR center, not so easily to reach and almost desert at night. Better to take a taxi to downtown Roma. Godd breakfast. Some restructuring works still in the completion phase, but no problems for staying nicely. Good value price. Better Club level, though price difference is too high. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Location not great but lovely pool and food”
Reviews.Author: Paulbo4
Reviews.Content: Location was a good bit out around 20 min's on the metro to the city centre but having said that the pool area was lovely and the food was dynamite! rooms were a little dated and Sheraton's are normally better. Better for a business trip or a pool relaxing holiday in summer. Not really to travel to and from.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but expected”
Reviews.Author: ajsm
Reviews.Content: I can't think of a good reason why anyone would stay here. We probably had the best possible reason - we were not able to get to the hotel until 10PM, we were scheduled to depart FCO early next morning, and we were using SPG points. It's small things that make you fall in love with a great hotel, and the small things that can make you hate a hotel. In this case, it's the big _and_ the small things that make you hate this hotel. Like its location, which is neither near the city nor the airport, the basic, depressing design, the run-down furnishings, the hot and stuffy room, the sad pillows that flatten completely when you lay your head on them such that you might as well lay your head directly on the bed, the CRT TV from the 90's, the small bathroom with its inconveniently placed toilet roll holders, its tub that wouldn't drain, leaving you standing in two inches of water as you shower, its small and thin towels, acceptable for that charming B&B near Campo dei Fiore, but unacceptable for a multi-national chain hotel in nowhere suburban Rome and worst of all, the slow internet (10's of kilobytes per second). As noted by others, the free airport shuttle has a limited schedule. As of this date, it departs the hotel for the airport seven times per day, at 0700, 0830, 1000, 1330 1515, 1645 and 1815. (The trips from FCO to the hotel are exactly 45 minutes after each of those times, and the departure location is in the "Polo Bus" area "a short walk from Terminal 3 Arrivals.") Note that you _must_ obtain tickets for the bus ahead of time from reception or the Bell Captain for the trip to the airport. Are there any positives for this hotel whatsoever? The room windows can be opened to let out the stuffiness and the mattresses were firm. I do feel for the manager assigned to respond to these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ClanMcLean
Reviews.Content: I know prices in rome are on the high side, but this place is monopolising on the fact that they are next door to the EUR business district. Central Rome, yes, suburbia, no. A beer in the bar will cost 7EUR, whereas in central rome, at places the locals will visit, you will pay 4EUR. The place generally looks run down and my room was very tired. Not very attractive although I have stayed in worse. It did seem to be clean, but as some of the rooms are smoking, I could still smell the smell of cigarettes in my non-smoking room. There was one bottle of water in the minibar, nothing else. Fine, but I could not find anywhere if it was free or to be paid for. My colleagues told me it was to be paid for which I thought was mean given that you can't drink the tap water. The gym is ok, but the pool was closed. Why? Not everyone finds a 15degC temp too cold. My room seemed to be above a function suite and at 0230 every monrning I awoke to a resounding solo vocal guitarist. Very good, but not at that time. My complaint was dismissed with a sorry, but nothing else. I would not stay at this place again. If you think that because it is a sheraton, it will be ok, then think again. I've stayed at Sheraton all over, but this was the worst given that it is supposed to be 4 or 5 star. Poor show Sheraton. Oh and the wi-fi is expensive. I've stayed in many places these days with free wi-fi - you got to pay at least 15EUR a day for it. Not even a free PC in the reception to just check for emails. And it is not even registered with iPass so you got to pay. Poor show Sheraton - obviously trying to liberate as many EURs from my pocket as possible, unashamedly

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Richard22b
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel currently, day 2 of 6 days. Day 1, Terrible. I had lunch and dinner in the hotel bar. That night I suffered with food poisoning. So I didnt sleep till 4 in the morning. My american neighbour didn't help with his loud conversation home either. Day 2, today. felt weak all day. Room was my only company. The room however is old and in great need of a refurb. The paint and wall paper is pealing. The furniture is old. Felt like an old american motel standards. Also the hotel hasn't turned on the AC yet so the room was baking meaning I have to open the window onto a dual carriageway. I have another 5 nights here. Not looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CarrieAnneSutton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as part of our cruise and let me just say- for the price we paid we were highly disappointed. The rooms were dated and had poor air circulation. The bathrooms were clean and quite beautiful though. The saving grace for this hotel were their cappucino's. The best I've ever had!! And the beautiful man at the restaurant even put hearts into the foam!! The breakfast provided was substantial, however my sister saw bugs on the bread table which prevented us from going anywhere near it. Overall, I'm sure there are much better hotels for far less money.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid rooms, good service, yet too far away from city center”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a conference I had in Rome. The hotel is directly located at a highway and taxis bring you straight to the city center. Yet, the hotel is off the center and not very suitable if you're here to visit the city. The hotel staff was very friendly, the rooms clean and large and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “good for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: zxxxx
Reviews.Content: first of all the hotel is far froam the city the rooms are very basic food is good attitude of the staff in not good

Reviews.Title: “Generic big Sheraton, a little tired, you could be anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: DKBNZTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: I love Rome. I was treat well for the night I stayed at this large heartless and a little tired Sheraton. I was there for pleasure, got in late so thought I would do a night there before hitting real rome. The shuttle service from the airport and into Rome is good, the fitness centre is very new. The rest of the hotel is tired. If you want a Rome experience this isnt the hotel for you. It's fine as a boring business type hotel. My rest of the stay was in the heart of room in a great little 3 star hotel Julia. Ive stayed there before and will go again

Reviews.Title: “Not a four/five star”
Reviews.Author: H K
Reviews.Content: Decor in standard rooms very poor Very far from mainland city Rome although the hotel has a shuttle service Not for families Nothing closeby Club rooms may be good Not for tourists Internet wifi is 16 euros per day

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: fima m
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit far out from the main part of town however ther hotel provides a shuttle bus service and station close by. The only downfall there are no taxis waiting at the station which made it inconvenient whilst waiting around with heavy luggage. The hotel has a nice restaurant offering a full buffet. Free Internet use for first time. The best hot chocolate too. We paid approx $150 aud per nite which was amazing price for the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eamonncourtney
Reviews.Content: i'm a little late on reviewing this hotel, but feel it deserves to be noted, this was our second stay at the romo, for 2 nights, as platinium spg members we were upgraded to a highter suite, unfortunately we faced the park where nightly concerts were held so was quite noisey, on our first stay we faced the pool and was completely noise free, the hotel changed our room to a corner suite which was a vast improvement,the spg club was great for morning breakfast and evening snacks and drinks complimary of course. The hotel was a little ways out but supplied a shuttle to the city and the airport cheaply, we did travel to the city by taxi costing 40 euro plus tip, i was shocked as i was told by reception that this trip would cost about 15 euro...on my way back fro city to hotel i noted that the taxi driver drove up and down the same streets zig zaged and generally tried to keep me confused. i took out my city map and confronted him as we drove, 40 mins later on a 10 min taxi ride we arrived back at the romo hotel, and was only charged 14 euro,,,and i refused to tip the driver...felt that riping off tourists is an acceptable way of life in Rome We were very happy with the service the hotel provided us and would certainly return again,,,

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan R
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, the Roma HOtel by SHeraton was pretty nice. After being in small, i mean tiny hotels in venice and florence with no A/C, the Sheraton Roma was quite the palace. Great pool, and pool bar. Good Food and great rooms, with very nice beds and the AC is cold ! It was a little out of the way from all the touist attractions, but a 8 minute walk to the train station got us into THE CENTER OF ROME IN JUST A FEW MINUTES... for the price, well worth it ! Thanks Sheraton !

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere but does the trick”
Reviews.Author: hgreen11
Reviews.Content: Booked this Sheraton on Starwoods points for our last night in Italy. Yes, it is far away from most things in Rome. All we did was spend a nice day at the pool and walked over to La Taverna Del Porto for dinner. The hotel was under construction at the time, but that didn't stop us from enjoying ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: This is the Sheraton closest to the airport and has a shuttle available, for a price, if you would like to go anywhere. The shuttle does not start until 7am, so if you need the airport earlier you will need to get a cab. This hotel is not near the city center and actually in the suburb, Eur, so if your plan is to see the city, stay somewhere closer, this place will not be convenient. If you have stayed at a Sheraton before, the room decor seems like it should have been updated 5 years ago. Everything in the rooms seemed a little dingy somehow from the bathrooms to the bedspreads, but the linens were clean and maintained. The rooms were dark and although other people in these reviews have said spacious, I felt that the rooms were an average Italian size. At first the desk assigned us to 2 twins, but we went back to get a regular bed and were accommodated. The main floor decor was more up to date and there are computers and printers available to print out itineraries for the airport, etc. We left early and got a bag breakfast from the desk. It was not good. Eat at the airport if you must choose this option. It was pear juice, an orange, and a said pre-packaged croissant. Also, the coffee was nothing special and tasted burnt as we left the hotel. But then again, at least the coffee was prepared. The front desk staff was okay, but seemed a little snotty to me. I must add a caveat to that: My husband is a n SPG reward member and we travel frequently and stay often in Sheraton hotels. We did not book as such and forgot our card at home. The desk refused or was unable to look him up in the computer. Usually, we stay on the club floor and receive other amenities associated with this membership. This definitely affected my overall impression of this Sheraton with others in which I have stayed. If you are thinking this will be like other Sheraton's, it will seem more "American" in some ways, but in other ways it is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “A True Sheraton Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dandiwala
Reviews.Content: Coming into Italy for the first time , we were glad that the hotel provided a shuttle pick up from the airport. The transfer was a great drive and the check in was quick. We were upgraded to a Higher Category and the Club Lounge access and complimentary Breakfast is always welcome for a traveller on a Budget. Ready shuttle pick up and drops to the city centre ensured that we didnt have to worry about the location of the hotel, which is slightly outside the city centre. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of nowhere...”
Reviews.Author: Mromnitel
Reviews.Content: Outside the city center, rooms are not very clean. furniture is old fashioned. Breakfast and restaurant ok. Accommodation is not cheap- at these prices, There are much better hotels nearer center of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jbps
Reviews.Content: Location is not very central and difficult to get there with public transport. Hotel could need some upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but far out from Rome”
Reviews.Author: politebat
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in july..it was pretty nice, but really far out. i was their during a remodel so they had some dust, but im sure it better now. my only problem was their was almost no lights in the room, they just had one working lamp...and when i plugged my computer into the wall in the lobby to get some juice...i blew out the whole wall...the socket was that old. other then that it was good...the room was clean and the bed was nice, and breakfast was good in the morning. internet was really pricey but its like that everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Rome”
Reviews.Author: rayd01
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located very near (only about 15-20 euro cab ride) Rome city center. From FCO airport the cab ride is about 30-40 Euro. If you don't have a car and don't want to take a taxi then this might not be the hotel for you as there isn't much in the way of public transit nearby. The hotel is very clean, the staff is great and the rooms are very nice and spacious. If you are a SPG Platinum member then the 6th floor lounge you will have access to is very nice. In the lounge there are plenty of complimentary adult beverages and a decent breakfast and a few hot snacks and desserts in the evening. If you want a good meal and don't want to eat in the hotel then ask the hotel staff for directions to "Antica Posta" restaurant. It is a short 5 minute walk and the food is great and 1/3 the price of the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sheraton Property”
Reviews.Author: Webchick1
Reviews.Content: I stay at SPG properties often. This sheraton didn't disappoint. Rooms were small (but most are in Italy) . They have a nice bar area and a restaurant, but I dounf the reaturant extremely overpriced. Downside is that there are no restaurants walking distance and the subway is a bit of walk. Plus, they offer a shuttle for 5 euros from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise, will come back !”
Reviews.Author: SpicyCinderella
Reviews.Content: 4-5 nights were spent in early Dec 2011 in this hotel. Like many travellers already mentionned, the location is not well connected to public transportations, so we ended up spending a lot on taxis to go for dinner or shopping in Rome city center, however I must admit that hotel staff were nice, polite and helpful at the reception desk. Staff from the restaurant and the bar were very friendly and kind with me, even offering me a drink as complimentary. The hotel room was quite large on the 2nd floor, with a nice view on the swimming pool. The bed was queen size, very comfortable. Cleai=ning was done on a daily basis, nothing to be reported. Bathroom was ok, nothing special, but a bit disappointing since there is a bathtube but no proper Italian shower, only a simple curtain. I spent a nice and lovely time in this hotel and I recommend it to who has to stay in EUR area, but if possible to add a rental car, so moving out will be easier. Too bad free internet wifi was not available in the room, only for 30-40 min per day on the public computers in the lobby where no privacy was possible.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out for my liking”
Reviews.Author: morrisjanita
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last leg of our tour and hotel was chosen because of it's close proximity to the airport. Hotel was fine, nice good sized rooms with comfortable beds. Wi-fi available but for some reason we found it difficult to connect. Breakfast was typical, but good. For me, the hotel is too far if you want to see Rome and I would not consider it if travelling to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, nice staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GabrielDrummond
Reviews.Content: We had found some bad reviews about the hotel, but we loved it. The room was great and we were very well received/helped by all staff. The down side is for sure getting in and out from downtown Rome. The bus works perfectly and the metro station is only 10min away (not a nice path), but the bus stop in Rome is not close to metro stations and, if it rains and you don't know how to call a cab, it's awful to come back from the metro station. In any case, I would go back P.S. I also got it through Hotwire, which gave me an excellent deal

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: wwwkrystellacom
Reviews.Content: I am writing this after order room service for the second night in a row. I ordered lasagne with antipasta starter, the antipasta was OK, the lasagne I found after eating was in fact spinach and ricotta ravioli topped with bolognese sauce. The bread was not served with any oils!! this was my second meal and the first meal was a €25 fillet steak that was more than well done and simply overcooked. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurb as i stayed here 4.5 years ago as it is walking distance to the office but nothing has changed. For a cheaper and more satisfying stay check out the sheraton golf resort. The club loung is mediocre to say the least, only wine, one hot snack and stale crisps. The bar charges €15 for a Gina and tonic and €25 for a double...the waiter for room service has just provided my free dessert and was very apologetic, it is not their fault but the chef is entirely to blame as the meal did look like lasagne. Overall my stay has been pleasant but the rooms need refurbing, the staff are helpful, the room service....see above and the breakfast is below average for a sheraton. Sheraton the brand should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: Biggsy72
Reviews.Content: Stayed only two nights in this hotel, but found the service mediocre. The location is poor, the rooms definitely not up to expected Sheraton standard. This hotel seems to be used as an adjunct to the airport for airline personnel and the overnight choice for pre-cruise passengers. I would not stay there again; the cruise lines could do better in their choices for their passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Ok and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mitchmadcat
Reviews.Content: Do not eat in this hotel food is poor and u pay €14 for soup coming out from a tin pizza bland tomatoes from a tin too burger €18 Mc Donald compare to the one they serve here is a gourmet burger

Reviews.Title: “Would probably not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. There was nothing remarkable about the experience. Although we were upgraded, the room was tiny. I'd hate to see what a regular room looks like. Concierge was rude and unhelpful. Hotel has 4 PCs in the lobby for guests' use. That's not enough for the size of the hotel, and there is a constant line; the wait is often 40+ minutes. The hotel is not situated well for sightseeing. Although it's only about 10 miles outside of Rome, we were told that getting there by car can take 1+ hours because of traffic. We were fine because we visited on a weekend. Overall, I'd probably look for a different hotel if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a typical conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachit R
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Roma, a big hotel but thats it. Time to renovate really. Carpets, decor, room interiors, bathrooms, restaurant all needs a transformation. Buffet is poor as per international standards, meant probably only fpr cheap travelling groups or bulk conferences. Your request for a bottle opener is refused, charged or recommended that the guest should himself go down to the bar, open bottle and go back to room !!!! what a service. Ice requirement has to be met by walking down to the service pantry on the floor, spend some time in knowing how to operate the machine and help yourself as you cant see anyone for long on the floors. What is the room selling? Is it just the room or some services as well. Bell captain was very kind though in explaining the route to the monuments. Free internet for an hour was also helpful. Pizza was quite terrible. Cannot recommend to leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate hotel in a wilderness”
Reviews.Author: palalb
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said the hotel is fairly near the airport. if you are arriving or departing when the shuttle bus goes then I would recommend it. Location – metro is 10 min walk away or a short taxi ride. However coming back late in the evening there is a lack of taxis and the walk back is risky due to the number of road crossing. The metro ride is approx 10 mins to centre of Rome. There is a lack of anything around the hotel so the only options for food and drink are a ‘ride’ away. Room - was ok needs some updating, biggest gripe was the lack of power near the desk, this means you have to unplug a light to get laptop power. Air con was on old thermostat and the effectiveness was dubious. Bar - service was good although a tad expensive Food - breakfast was a bit hit and miss first day food was hot and varied, second and third days the food was mediocre. Dinner at night - a la carte was reasonable but pork chop was not cooked enough. The second night we tried the buffet; cold selection was excellent, hot selection was uninspiring and appeared to have dried up. Overall – an ok hotel mainly suited to business travellers or people on tours as the location is poor. .

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Aunty_I
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were old looking and in need of a make-over and repairs. Service staff including reception and restaurant staff and concierge were polite and efficient but certainly not very friendly. I don't remember anyone actually smiling at me during my 5-day stay, let alone greeting me. We had meetings on level 2, which were converted from 2 hotel rooms. Very convenient as my room is just down the hallway. meeting package was expensive and food was way too much for 5 people. We would have been better off ordering individual room service food

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Sheraton Roma”
Reviews.Author: aussie-on-vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel..the rooms were large and the hotel shuttle from the airport was good,we walked 10 mins too the train station to go into Rome and caught the free Sheraton bus direct to the hotel in the afternoon,check in was a little slow,but the price thru hotwire was great..would stay again if in Rome

Reviews.Title: “No complaints but miles to go....”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad_pp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two little kids here for 3 days while visiting Rome. In general we have no complaints , they gave us a room by 12 PM since we reached the hotel fairly early from airport. The walk to the shuttle is a little long, can get tiring if you are lugging bags along. People were polite and all requests were promptly attended to as well. The shuttle to the city is convenient too. BUT the rooms are crying out for some renovation and upgrade. Things are either broken,torn or don't work at all. And to the staff polite is nice but smile is definitely better. Poker face look is not cool anymore!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: scqs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel recently. The hotel is about 30 minutes from the Fiumicino airport and is not near to the city centre. The good thing about the hotel is that they provide shuttle to the airport at 5 Euros and to the city centre at 3 Euros at various intervals. The rooms were big compared to other hotels in Rome. However, the front desk was not friendly, presumably due to the sheer volume of people checking in and out of the hotel. The hotel is considered big by Rome standards. The hotel provides a few computer terminals at the lobby for free internet use albeit the connection speed leaves much to be desired. We had the buffet at the main restaurant at the cost of 35 Euros per pax and did not think much of it. While service was excellent, the food was not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not great location (unless you want to be near the airport)”
Reviews.Author: Heidi K
Reviews.Content: This has some of the best facilities for an Italian hotel - including a massive gym!!! The only draw back is it is sort of in the middle of nowhere but very handy if you need to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great, location poor if you want to go to the major sights.”
Reviews.Author: KarenMac717
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ver clean. Service was very good. Besides location being poor (which we knew in advance but booked there for the value), my biggest complaint was Internet service. It was very expensive (6.00 euro per hour, 12.00 euro 24 hr), it only allowed one user per room. Each of us had our own iPad and each wanted to do our own thing. You could only register one email address per room. We ate dinner in the bar (I had risotto with shrimp) which was delicious. It took us 2 hours to get back at night because traffic is horrendous. Great location if you want to be fairly close to the airport. Hotel provides a shuttle for 5 euro pp.

Reviews.Title: “away from Rome and in bad conditions”
Reviews.Author: Jsgm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, needs a remodel. At night some of the lifts do not work, if you want to do a check out at night, may be you have to wait until they do a system back up. The bath rooms in the main areas are broken. If your room looks to the motorway will be noisy. For been a Sheraton does not stay at level.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Showdown”
Reviews.Author: Ralph N
Reviews.Content: If you do not have a car, do not stay here, if you spend most of your time in the heart of Rome. This Sheraton is in EUR, which was built by Mussolini back in the forties and it is about 20 minutes southwest from Piazza Venezia with traffic. Only in the club lounge you have free internet access, elsewhere you are whammed with charges. The hotel is definitely outdated and aged and does not even have flatscreen television in the rooms. It truly cries for rennovation. At least the conferrence area was now rennovated, so we can keep our fingers crossed, that they finally rennovate the rest of the hotel next year. No millions should be spared to bring this hotel up to snuff and correctly represent the proud name SHERATON. The windows are cheap 1960 slide style and do not insulate perfectly. The rooms are small and boxy like it was common in the 60ties. When they rennovate they have to enlarge the guestrooms. These smal rooms are not contemporary anymore. What is very strange for an american hotel is the fact that the rooms have NO coffeemakers or ironing boards, which are mandatory requirements these days. That, the umbrella and a descent soundsystem are necessary considerations for a rennovation. Also finally make internet FREEly available everywhere and do NOT charge for softdrinks. With these two easy complementary amenities a hotel in Milan could make it to NO. 1 on Trip Advisor. It is so easy to please your guests with little things. The pool is really great (even though unfortunately no spa with sauna). This is a great advantage of the hotel, but closed in October and November?, even though the current weather with over 25 degrees during the day would allow the use any time. How darn stupid is it to close it, though? You always have to adapt to the climate quickly. The staff is generally kind and helpful. English is spoken throughout the entire hotel. This Sheraton has a sweet 1960ish charme from the time when it was built, but it needs sprucing up big time. Any brandnew Holiday Inn is more appealing. The club lounge needs Airprint-compatible printers badly. Anyone has an Iphone nowadays and wants to print wirelessly right off his phone or Ipad. Other than this the hotel is quite recommandable by all means and I do hope to find it refurbished when I come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Take no notice of the bad reviews..”
Reviews.Author: drcarnie
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from Rome having stayed at this hotel and having read some of the reviews beforehand and finding a lot of them less than complimentary I was a little apprehensive to say the least. I needn't have worried however as the hotel was more than satisfactory. The staff were more than helpful and my room was excellently furnished and clean. Also I opted to take a taxi from the airport which was 35 euros but the hotel does run a shuttle service for around e8. The food (which is excellent) and drink is a little expensive (draught beer 7.80 euros, bottled beer 6.40 euros and most dishes on the menu are around the 15 euros mark) but this is Rome after all. I also ate out during the day and you can find good prices if you look. I had a two course lunch with a beer at 15 euros. I have to say I wasn't aware of having to pay a city tax for each day I stayed until I received my final bill, so be wary of this if you haven't already been told. It's 3 euros per day. I don't know if that's per person or per room. The internet was free for the first hour every day. More than enough for me at any rate. Hey, I'm on holiday after all. I don't want to be on the internet all day. The shuttle bus from the hotel to the city centre costs e3 per day including return and runs from 8.00 am until 11.30 pm running every hour or so. You'll find a time table at reception. It drops you off at a central location and then you just find your way around using one of the excellent maps you will get from reception before you leave. Don't be mis-lead by the map it really isn't that far to walk to most of the historical sites. I walked from our drop off point to the Vatican in about half an hour at a sprightly pace I might add. Similarly from the drop off point, the Trevi Fountain and the Colloseum are easily within walking distance. You can if you wish take a guided tour bus. This will take you to the various sites where you can get off the bus have a look round and then get on another bus and go to the next site and do the same. If you go to the Colloseum you might want to go pretty early if you want to go inside. I got there early afternoon and the queue to get in was about 300 yards long so I gave it a miss. Still a beautiful site though. A trip to the Vatican is well worth it. I arrived there only to be accosted by a guy asking if I spoke English and would I like to go on a guided tour. I was a bit apprehensive. You never know if you're being conned. I needn't have worried there were a few others like myself and at the end of the day I have to say it was well worth it. It cost 25 euros and our guide was a German guy called Karl who has been doing the tours for 61/2 years. (If you can find him he's your man). He was very knowledgeable about the whole of Rome and in particular the Vatican. We walked around the streets of the city stopping on the way for refreshments etc and then moved on to the Vatican Museum including the Sistine Chapel and the Basilica and take my word for it they're all breathtakingly beautiful and well worth seeing. Going back to the hotel. I enjoyed every minute of my stay here and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Ok it's a little off the beaten track but hey! you're on holiday, relax. I would certainly stay here again. Many thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: jamierod
Reviews.Content: Reception was really friendly, concierge service very helpful( they have maps that you can get for free!! for the city, I would recommend you do the tours yourself as they have a train station close to the hotel ( 20 min walk) and also a bus service during the day that takes you to the city near The Vittorio Emanuele II monument, and if you can walk a small distance and climb a few steps you can also see the Piazza Del Campidoglio, The Colosseum and The ancient Romanum Forum.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect preservation of the 1970s”
Reviews.Author: Medusa67
Reviews.Content: I am sure that in the 1970's this antiquated hotel was considered a luxury hotel, but by today's standards it is simply old fashioned and does not measure up with modern times. The hotel is by no means near the Centre of Rome and is a 40 Euro cab ride from the Fiumicino Airport. Upon entering the hotel, one is taken back to the grandeur of the 1970s with the dark brown decor and chocolate brown leather club chairs to the right of the lobby reception desk. The "Business Centre", also to the right, is located in the central lobby with computer screens facing the entrance for all and sundry to see what is on the user's screen; forget privacy. The rooms are average with dark carpet and prints of Roman themes on the wall, I would describe them as not bad not good--average. Bring your IPod/IPad for wake up calls as the "Guest Service" department is very sometime-ish and really inconsistent- sometimes calls to the Guest Service Centre are left unanswered. Wi-Fi is charged by the hour or 24hours--I will not comment on this gauche practice, which is seemingly now commonplace. I did notice a poster in one of the elevators that stated that the hotel underwent extensive renovations this year-- um...someone needs to fire the interior decorator!!! There is a shuttle into Rome which costs 3 Euros and it drops you off outside of the Coliseum. Overall the Sheraton Rome is not distinguished, simply an average, old fashioned hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila196
Reviews.Content: Add 50 euro per day for the cost of taxis to and from the hotel. If you choose the hotel shuttle it will not drop you at a central position not at the termini. Internet access costs 16 euro per day or 6 euro per hour and if like us you have trouble with it, the hotel staff will not help and refer you to the provider. There is a 1 hour per day free access in the lobby but this is inadequate to conduct business activities. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which was extremely disappointing. There is a small fridge in the room stocked with drinks which we removed to put in our water bottles and medication. Everything was replaced the day before we left. When we settled our bill we were charged for all of the drinks. We explained that we didn't use anything and the staff member shrugged and told us it often happens. Generally the staff were very stand-offish and unhelpful and gave the impression that we were pests not guests. Avoid this hotel unless you have a very generous company credit card. For a Sheraton hotel it was disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “US Traveler”
Reviews.Author: CMT60605
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for business but lacks the charm of many other hotels. Also, the staff is not very friendly. The concierge recommended a restaurant that was the worst meal we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Not to Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: Lindsandwens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and booked because of its proximity to the airport and were expecting a lot more from a Sheraton branded hotel. Hotel buses are infrequent and local transport is only available from the train station but not to it. Staff were unhelpful and unfriendly. There are no eating places reachable on foot so you are trapped into paying very high hotel prices for a limited menu. Breakfast is horrendously expensive! Whilst the Convention section has been renovated, this is little comfort to hotel users who have to put up with run down rooms and outdated facilities. Ancient TV's, expensive internet access in rooms and even disposable plastic glasses to use with the overpriced minibar items. There are a couple of free internet computers in the foyer but they are hopelessly inadequate for the queues of people trying to gain access. The bed and linen were all good but these did not make up for the dowdy nature of the rest of the hotel. The pool area was really faded and dirty and there is no way I would use the pool shower! The roadways immediately outside the hotel were deep with rubbish. This gave an even worse first impression. No way could we recommend this hotel at any price. Best stay somewhere that has better access, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Average quality, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: jkofman
Reviews.Content: Ver average, inconvenient for business in city center. Had to wait 20 minutes in taxi queue one morning. Only useful for airport proximity and meetings in the EUR area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: maros63
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in Rome, modern, clean with a perfect customer service. Right between the airport and the city center. The hotel has a bus for a nominal to fee take you there, running almost all day. The price is right . We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wardyp
Reviews.Content: After checking in we were given our room key only to find that our room had not been cleaned - a bad start. Twenty minutes later we were still waiting. Location is good for early morning flights as it is close to airport but some distance from Rome centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those easily upset”
Reviews.Author: LondonWinnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little off the main throw of Rome but has the advantage of having a good pool and is close to the metro (5 minute walk and 20 to the Colosseum). The staff in the pool bar area were all very friendly and made great efforts to ensure you were served in a timely fashion...That is where it finishes...Reception, very unhelpful, brash, rude and more interested in chatting to each other than answering queries etc... The conference centre had just been revamped at a cost of 0million euro...hope they spend some money on the rest of the hotel to bring it to the 21st century. This hotel is below average, old, worn and unwelcoming. The only gem is the pool and poolbar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property !!”
Reviews.Author: jaimin21
Reviews.Content: A decent but an expensive hotel...a little far from all the historical sites of Rome. The hotel has a shuttle running to downtown as well as the airport for 3 and 5 euros a person respectively, so it definitely helps...but the location is not great !! it is around a km away from the train station but there is nothing around the hotel. The pool is nice, but rooms have a outdated look and could definitely need some updating. The staff was very helpful in feedback and planning our itinerary in Rome. Overall, the hotel meets the standard for a decent price and definitely recommended if you have a flight due to its proximity and services to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST: Unfriendly, unsafe, just BAD”
Reviews.Author: Peterkorsten
Reviews.Content: Let me keep it as short as possible. Checking in (after waiting 15 minutes) took over 10(!) minutes. Key card given did not work, and when I came down took 3 minutes to replace. The replace card also did not work, and I had to go down again -REALLY!- I then had to ask for 2 keys, just in case the magnetic strip of the dysfunctioning card was wrong. After being in my room for about 20 minutes, the door was opened by other guests, who were angry to find me in 'their' room, and wanted me to leave. Internet did not work, and when I called the front staff, the call was not answered. Only calling 'emergency' led to an -angry- reply... and a pass through to a global help desk who could not help me after a 6 minute wait. Calls for wake up service were also not answered, and I have had to use the 'emergency' button again. No apologies were offered when I went down by the front office staff, and when I asked for the duty manager I had to wait for 5 minutes to be lectured. In total I spoke with her for over 45 minutes, promises of investigations were made, but upon check-out the next day there was no letter, nothing. Upon checking out at 7 am in the morning (peak check out time for a business hotel) only 2 of the visible 6 front office staff members were helping customers. When I asked one of the paper shuffling staff, I was whisked away in a very impolite manner. A promised apology e-mail from the 'resident hotel manager arrived one day later than promised and only responded to 3 of my 7 complaints. You can not be safe in your own room in this hotel, no guarantees that this can not happen again were offered in the apology letter, only an explanation of the 'mistake. All in all: if you want THE ultimate old-style Italian experience, visit this hotel. If you want the style and service of an international business hotel avoid this AT ALL COST. (If you have to stay here, take time and lock your room at all times internally, but still be worried that your room may be opened by other guests when you are out, dining or so...)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, felt comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Randy1964
Reviews.Content: Food was good, hotel was clean and staff was helpful. As an American, they made me feel very comfortable and safe. Part of my cruise extension package so not sure about the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Place & Price”
Reviews.Author: Disneynut84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it is in a great location to walk to the train station to get to the city. The beds and place is very comfortable and clean. As for the airport shuttle, it's not that far to walk..It might be at the other end of the airport, but it's only a 6 minute walk. I had a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here to use your points, or for nights before your flight”
Reviews.Author: Calibunga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel mainly because of our credit card points. If you are a traveler/tourist and are going to pay out of your own pocket, or if your company does not cover this hotel, don't stay here. This hotel would be a great option if your flight out of Rome was in the morning. They have an airport shuttle for only 5 euros a person - which is a GREAT deal. This hotel is in the EUR district, which is very far and inconvenient from the center. Don't even bother walking to the metro to get to the city - just pay the 3 euros for the shuttle bus, which takes you to the Colloseum area/plaza at the south end of Via del Corso. So if you're coming to Rome to HAVE FUN, tour around, and enjoy the city, DO NOT STAY HERE. But if you're coming to Rome for business, or like I said, staying here the night before your flight out of Rome, this is a great hotel. You should save your credit card points for another hotel, but if you MUST use it up because they're going to expire, might as well use them up here. With that said, here's my actual review about the hotel, not taking into account it's crap location and all. We loved how this was an "American" or "Sheraton" hotel, so the bathrooms, the entire room looked like an actual American hotel room...from the 1970's. It's obviously in dire need of remodeling - but compared to the other hotels in Rome (a VERY OLD city), it's pretty good. The staff of the hotel definitely aren't nice, but I don't blame them since they have to deal with tourists like us ALL the time who don't understand the language or ways of the area. The pool and lounge area is very clean - and the food isn't THAT expensive..taking into account that you are eating in a hotel. We really enjoyed our dinner in this hotel. The pasta was decent (hard to mess up in Italy), but I really enjoyed my dish with fish and vegetables (around 20 euros). Again, since this hotel isn't in the city, there's no laundrette here. Since Rome was our last stop in Italy before going back home to the States, we were exhausted and spent our last days in the room laying around watching TV. We ordered room service pizza which was EXTREMELY good - better than most of the pizzas we ate outside. If we were to come back to Rome to tour and enjoy the city, obviously we wouldn't stay here. But we definitely would stay here again (using our points of course - I don't know how much people actually pay to stay here) if we needed to (night before our flight) because this is a very comfortable hotel, it's clean, there's computers you can use, and the shuttle to the airport is ridiculously cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, more American than Italian.”
Reviews.Author: slmarotta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice with great ammenities. Out of all the hotels we stayed in in Italy this was the hotel with the best AC and most comfortable bed! It was unfortunate that the hotel wasn't closer to the main part of the city but we stayed here because of the convenience to the airport. The only downside was that the hotel seemed very American and while inside/on the grounds you would have had no idea you were in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Rome, try to get a good deal on one of the better hotel downtown…”
Reviews.Author: GLORIAGRAZZIOTIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights The hotel itself is nice, rooms are very outdated bathrooms dirty and the housekeeping service bad. TVs are horrible , there are no free English channels offering programs or movies like Sky movies or sky sport. They want you to buy the pay-per-view package at a high rate. The front desk staff is unfriendly ,un professional, not attentive,. They seem to be bored all the time and the concierge was rude and, information offered by him was vague and unwillingly. There are no restaurants or shops nearby and this hotel is far from in Rome's city center. The hotel offer a shuttle service, 3 euros each round trip , living the hotel lobby each 90 minutes to downtown , There is also an Airport Shuttle just to drop-of 5 Euros each The pool is very nice , fitness center is very well equipped and free of charge. The closest metro station is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel -be aware: the road's is littered with broken glass bottles, trash, no sidewalk no signs, in fact it is dangerous . If you plan to take a taxi from the hotel, I recommend you telephone one by calling 168 on your cell phone…The prices are more than 3 times that amount to start the meter. If you decide go till there, you will need to research the walking route as it isn't obvious once you leave the lobby. If you go to Rome, try to get a good deal on one of the better hotel downtown…

Reviews.Title: “Ancora Che Shivo! Another SPG disappointment...Che peccato!!”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed as how much standards have dropped at this starwood property. It pains me to write a bad review but feel that travelers need to hear the straight skinny especially from a seasoned traveler. I never experienced service problems at this property until now. I found that the maid never came several days in a row and we were not part of a green plan which the hotel does offer. I had to call room service for clean towels twice in a row or two days in a row. Unclear why a Starwood Platinum guest was treated so poorly unless platinum guests are truly not appreciated at Starwood properties. Starwood does franchise their licenses but it seems strange that the licensees do not treat frequent travelers well except that they truly do not care. I will first describe the restaurant. I love the restaurant and have always found Enrico and his staff attentive and the food very good. I typically tend to eat the antipasto since I am fat and enjoy salads...or it is all that my wife permits me to eat. Those married, know the value of keeping their spouses happy....When she is not looking, I tend to sneak in a few gelati during the day so we are even. Tonight, I visited the club lounge and will tell you more about it later. What I want to tell you is that I ran into many folks whom did eat the buffet that were disappointed. They paid 35E and said the choices were small. The majority of the buffet was for antipasto which is what I have tried and that the remainder was limited to two first course (pasta) choices, two main dishes and 2-3 vegetables as well as two soups. Some felt it was not worth the 35 Euro/person. You could order a portion of the buffet but will be limited to only one or two choices if you choose the first or second choice menu items. Both American and German guests said that the buffet was terrible. I have yet tried it this trip so cannot comment. Now on to the club. The usual folks are still on their August vacation and I hope they arrive soon. I need Paola, Alessandra, and Saeed to quickly return. I have fopiund the help currently filling in at the club lounge to be vastly insuperior and lacking the various basic hospitality skills. Tonight, I was yelled at for steaming a cappuccino. The capuccino arrived cold (temp) without the usual steamed milk (foam) ("La Sciuma in Italian) or the color of "la crema" from the espresso that will yield the Cappuchin brown color that the beverage was named after. The attendant explained to me that the Francis/Francis illy coffee maker was only used for espresso and quickly inItalian, I asked why there were cappuccino cups on the machine if they did not want folks to make cappuccino. I also explained that cappuccino is expected to be served hot and when it arrived lukewarm, I attempted to do the basic. The real question is why did the attendant serve such an insuperior beverage in Italy. Clearly, she would not have served it at home nor drink it herself. What I found to be odd was that I had to reject two cups of cappuccino before I saw one with foam. What surprised me to begin with is earlier in the day, I asked for a cafe macchiato (espresso coffee stained with milk ) and a latte macchiato (steamed milk stained with espresso) and received neither but two cappuccinos. I guess the Italian staff at this hotel thought that italo-americanos (Americans of Italian descent) would not know the difference. What they don't know is that we are fluent in not the official language but the dialect and tend to understand the official language not to mention parolacci (bad words). We did know the difference from a latte macchiato served typically in a glass throughout Italia and an espresso macchiato served in an espresso cup. The club lounge is the same as it has been in the past ten years. You will find two computers with one shared printer and will need to make sure the printer is mounted to your workstation in order to print. They do not charge you to print out things by the page. Throughout the day, they have Pejo sparkling and natural mineral water, coca cola, coca-cola light, sprite, prosecco (Italian sparkling wine JEIO brand...same one you find at most Starwood Italai properties), red wine (Chianti) and a white wine. They also have large bowls of potato chips, corn chips and hard toast as well as a tray of normal cookies (nothing special and not amaretti) during the day. At night, the cookies are replaced with small cubes of average marguerita pizza. I say average since the crust is not "crocante" or crisp like the italians like and the cheese is sparse on the pizza. In the morning, they have continental breakfast with really hard cresent rolls (cornetti) and are among the worst I have sampled or tried in all of Italy during the past 40 years. This was mybiggest disappointment since the large amount of butter in the cornetti usually leave them flaky and good. I tend to gravitate to the cornetti but not this time. In fact, when I see them, I run in the opposite direction as fast as I can and head for a real Italian bar to have a cappuccino and cornetti. If this were my first experience, I would not have ever tried them. Since I like walking at night or early in the morning to take sunrise photos, I have found a baker off of Via Tiburtina that makes them and sells them before he loads them in his truck and they are to die for good. It is a shame that a large hotel would not have a pastry chef. For those seeking out sweets, I recommend you try sfogliatelle (clamshell like pastry made with lots of butter and filled with ricotta and candied fruit) over cannolis. The cannoli shells here are fried in vegetable oil and not in lard like they used to be. Carlo's Bakery in Hoboken NJ still fries their cannoli shells in lard and this is why they are the best. Too many health conscience folks want zero trans fats....If youa re eating a cannoli, are you really worried about the fat content? ...Really? I had to call room service twice in two days to get maid service or towels. You would think that maid service was on strike (sciopero) as does alot of things in Italy. It is amazing at how hard it is to get clean towels not to mention a bar of soap. The hotel does not have wash cloths so if you are inclined to using the bidet, you may need to crab and clean the family jewels Arab style using the left hand. I do not know how you use the bidet without a cloth to clean your backside and family jewels except with your hand. If youa re left handed, I guess you can use your right hand. :) The rooms are very very small. They are very small. I did get to see what an executive suite looks like. I met another couple that also complained that their bedroom was small. It was the same size. They had a large dining/living room that was approx double the size of the bedroom which meant that the executive suite was equivalent in size to three rooms, You may want to ask yourself if it is really worth you staying here in a suite given the small size of the bedroom. The bedroom will be the same size as a normal room. Service in general.....not good throughout the hotel. It seems that the staff would prefer to not engage a guest nor do they recognize that if it were not for guests that they would have an empty hotel. I wanted to see the 10M restoration to the conference center but it was still under construction. Platinum amenities are a minibar credit, bottle of wine or a T-shirt....Some club members get a small bottle of orange liquer. I did not get one so it must not be for platinum guests. It must be for special guests of the hotel for which the hotel wants to acknowledge their patronage. Not clear who gets it but I had a hard enough time trying to get my room cleaned or the trash taken out. I did not sign up for the green program but still found it difficult to seek the basics. If you plan to take a taxi from the hotel, I recommend you telephone one by calling 168 on your cell phone. The taxi drivers the hotel uses tend to overcharge guests and are very expensive. The prices are posted in the cab but yet when you sit down, you can expect the driver to charge you more than 3 times that amount to start the meter. Taxis when ordered either from the St. Regis Grand or the Westin Excelsior do not have this problem. I ran into many guests that felt they were ripped off by the taxi driver and I agree that they were as so was I. The taxi that the Bell Captain telephoned for me must have been his "brother-in-law" or partner in crime since once we sat down, we were charged 7E. The price should have been 2.5E so unclear why we were charged 7E. Others experienced a wide difference but not that high. Some were charged between 3-5E. It is unclear why this hotel does not try to control this since i do not recommend anyone use the hotel bell captain to call a taxi. I recommend you radio a taxi directly. You may back a little more for the taxi to arrive since he will typically start the meter once he gets a call but it is not like 7E. The 7E was not the radio charge since the taxi arrived within 30 seconds of being called. Unclear why so many experience difficulties in taxis from the hotel. The other thing is the metro. If you walk to the metro, you will take a walk that is not pretty. I do not recommend it. The walk is along a road littered with trash and I mean alot of trash. There are glass bottles, paper, used condoms, etc along the side of the road not to mention overgrown plants crowding the narrow walk way. I have never seen so much trash lying along side of the road and if I did not know where I was, I would have thought that I was in Naples during the trash strike. Also, the cars tend to take the curves pretty fast so do not walk in the streets. I have given this property another try and once again disappointed. I never would have thought that the property would have declined from last year but it is several magnitudes worse. I highly recommend Starwood management send a mystery shopper to inspect this hotel. I found it to be a serious lapse in basic standards and would hardly classify it as a one star property. It used to be very good with innovative programs and conveniences and now is just blah. Also, there are no free English channels offering programs or movies like Sky movies or sky sport. They want you to buy the pay-per-view package at a high rate. The Airport shuttle is 5E/per each way and the city shuttle is 3E from the hotel only. To catch the airport shuttle, you exit the arrival area and immediately proceed all the way down tot he right to the end of the terminal (T3) and then go outside and continue down on the right under the freeway where buses are parked and look for the Sheraton sign at bus stall # 14. Their schedule is posted there. If you are int he city center, the stop is near the mouth of truth (famous from Roman Holiday when Cary Grant scared Audrey Hepburn that he had his hand eatened by the mouth.) The street is Via Luigi Petroselli No 52/54. It is also close to the Tempio di Vesta and down from Teatro Marcello. The bus runs approx every 90 minutes. If you want to stay here, please keep in mind that you are closer to their freeway and not the ancient city center. It pains me to see a property go downhill so much. I used to enjoy staying here and lately, i seem to be disappointed more and more. This is the first SPG property in Italy that I have stayed at that did not yield an excellent review. The Excelsior and the St. Regis are excellent properties as is the Eden Hotel. I found them exceptional and I recommend you look at the Golf de Medici or the 4 Points. The 4Points Roma West has an indoor pool and is excellent as well. The Sheraton Rome reminds me of a very very old person on life support.

Reviews.Title: “Still terrible. Previously poor but much more worse this time”
Reviews.Author: Cocomero A
Reviews.Content: If you are loyal to Starwood, please stay at any other Starwood property. There is a Sheraton Golf hotel not far away and they have ample free parking. Service in this hotel is worse and is much more worse this year than last year. Last year, I voted this property poor, this year it receives the score of terrible since I found very little good to write about. To start, the reception is under a renovation as are the meeting rooms. As a meeting planner, I decided to evaluate the property to see if it is a candidate and once again, it falls below standard for other properties in the area. There is a shuttle that will take you into town for 3E and the metro is a ten minute walk. If you do walk, be careful since the road is littered with broken glass bottles, trash, no sidewalk for a portion of the walk and no signs so you may make a wrong turn if you are unfamiliar with the area. I have walked it several times but do not recommend it unless you know what to expect since Italians tend to take curves in their cars very closely. I also recommend that you bring towels. We found that the maid did not come one day until close to 16:00 and we had to call for maid service several times earlier in the day and noone picked up the guest services line when called. As a frequent traveler (platinum in Starwood, Gold in Marriott and double diamond in Hilton) I rarely find a property that has good appearance and poor service. Reception checkin was not speedy. Alofts now have a keyless checkin where you can checkin using an Aloft card similar to a Starwood card. This property tended to be slow and queues long for checkin/out. If you are in a hurry, I recommend giving yourself more time. This hotel has a club lounge which has 2 personal computers with printers and a variety of drinks including wine (red and white) for consumption and offers continental breakfast in the mornings. The lounge is a nice size unlike the rooms which are quite small and if you are an Elite member, you can almost guarantee yourself no upgrade to a suite. I have never been upgraded during the five previous stays. In fact, the hotel did not have any record of me staying here in previous years which is quite odd since I know the Starwood systems record the total number of stays that one stays at. The rooms have automatic beverage bars are are not nice about it if you were to accidentally remove an item. They tell you if you remove an item, that you will be charged and they will not remove the charge from the bill when you check in. They have made this quite clear especially since I only removed an item to read the label. Please do not make this mistake. The small can cost nearly 10Euro. The area is in the EUR district which was created by Mussolini and the rooms are probably small keeping with his fascist style. I returned to this property only after colleagues recommended I try it since it has been renovated and once again, I see that not much has changed for the better but a great deal for the worst. I do not understand Starwood. I would have thought that they had re-engineered their image in spending Billions in renovating properties but it appears that service is declining and becoming worse and worse. I am surprised at how little is being placed on customer service and when confronting an employee with a simple "Buon Giornio", you will most likely be given a returned stare vice a similar greeting. When I state this on the street or in the stores, it is promptly repeated back so why not in the hotel? The property has great potential but clearly the management is poor or otherwise why is it that the Guest Service Center telephone is not manned. The only item of value I found was the restaurant still managed by Enrico and his staff and that aspect is superb as always.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in bad condition/Bad location”
Reviews.Author: Tobyyy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located in Rome's city center, but in the district of EUR. Therefore, you either have to take the hotel's shuttle, which runs every 90 minutes to downtown (at a cost of 3 Euros per person) or the metro. The closest metro station is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel (be aware: the road's condition is very poor!). There is also an Airport Shuttle for 5 Euros per person. The hotel itself is ok. Rooms are very outdated and by any means not in the best condition (even though better than most other hotels in Rome!). TVs are horrible! The floor is dirty and there are stains everywhere in the bathroom. The pool is very nice and quiet, so you can relax and enjoy the sun after a long day in the city. The fitness center is very well equipped and free of charge. There are no restaurants or shops nearby, so you have to go to the city center for essentially everything! Housekeeping was very unreliable and the front desk staff is extremely unfriendly. They seem to be annoyed by everything and are not helpful at all (couldn't even provide us with stamps or band aid after I stepped onto a bee). I didn't even get an apology for billing me the room upon check out (it was prepaid) and was signed up to their loyalty program without any notice. If you don't decline, you will also be charged 1 Euro to donate to some charity organization, so be careful when checking your bill. If you go to Rome, try to get a good deal on one of the better hotel downtown. For the price they charge for a room, this hotel is fine however.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Conrad0509
Reviews.Content: The Hotel does not have a convenient location but the staff made up for that. We had the best customer service experience while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel/lousy location for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: In fairness, if I were to rate the hotel only, I would probably give it an above average. This is very much a North American style hotel with nice sized well appointed rooms. The hotel amenities are also very nice with a pool, workout room, large bank of computers for guest use as well as a regular hotel lounge. That said, if you are here to see central Rome than the location is a bit of an issue. The hotel does provide a bus for a nominal fee but this ties you into a schedule which may or may not work for you. The alternative is to use the Metro which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel-you will need to research the walking route as it isn't obvious once you leave the lobby. Though we never encountered any problems on our walks to the Metro-which we used every day for our 3 night stay. it should be noted that you will have to pass by a few deserted areas and likely will feel mildly uncomfortable especially if walking at night or alone. The upside to the hotel is the airport shuttle bus which again is for a nominal fee but is well worth it in comparison to toting your luggage to and through Termini. I would stay here again if I couldn't find any comprably priced options closer to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Zuzana K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. Being regular to Sheraton hotels worldwide I have to say that this is the worst Sheraton hotel I have ever been to. It deserve maximum 2 star rating. Staff are very unfriendly, unprofessional, not attentive, from Receptionist to F&B staff. Cleanliness in the hotel public areas is very poor, toilets in the lobby were always very dirty and the whole area smelled badly of urine. TV sets in the room are acient and picture is not clean at all. I would advise everyone to stay away from this property. It's overpriced, in terms of quality and service. Property is old, neglected. The last drop was when we received during check-out inaccurate bill. Overall it's not up to Sheraton world wide standards.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker717AU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a well outside of Rome, but not particularly close to the Airports either. There is nothing at all to do or see within walking distance, and they take full advantage of this, everything other then the rooms is overpriced. The nearby entertainment venue plays music until 3AM, and it is so loud it shakes the walls. Not entirely the fault of the hotel, but not a trivial issue either. The pool is very nice and service is fine as well, but the lobby is often full with groups checking in, causing extensive delays. The rooms are smaller then what you usually get in central Rome, and very old and worn, not really good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: WorsleyManchester
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Sheraton Roma in Aug 2011 after a previous great holiday in Aug 2009. We were not disappointed. Amazing service and attention to detail from the staff. Renovation work was being carried out which did not impact on our holiday in any negative way. Great hotel to visit Rome during the day with a Coach service for only euro s then returning to a delightful pool to relax and chill and dine with delicious food. I celebrated my 50th birthday at the Sheraton Rome and the staff arranged a surprise cake and champaign in my room. Fantastic breakfasts available and great evening meals. Fabulous location just out of Rome centre. Air conditioning wonderful in the rooms as 37c temp. The staff were very accommodating. Please do not listen to negative feedback about the Sheraton. It is a great place to relax and with close links to a fabulous city. Just get up and enjoy the adventure of a beautiful place. Thank you Sheraton Rome and your fantastic staff who made our holiday so wonderful.. Club Lounge service outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Aiport Hotel Okay for Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: Leighlittleton
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this airport hotel at the end of a tour for convenience to the airport. That is about the only thing this hotel is good for. Getting to town is expensive and not convenient. The service was okay. The hotel needs a lot of updating. The restaurant was okay. Nothing memorable about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: zaza68
Reviews.Content: Please look out for Massimo in the bar, and Giorgio - the Maitre'D in the restaurant, as these employee are superb. I do not understand what the complaints are about - as this was the best value in Italy. Sure - it is a 15 minute walk on a busy and unpaved sidewalk tpo the Metro stop (EUR Magliana) - but still accessible. The restaurany has a cold buffet 9part of a larger buffet) for only 13 euros - beat that in Rome. The rooms need upgrading - but the hotel is well underway in the renovations. The pricepoint and services are well worth the minor inconvenience of the location. Stay there -and enjoy their service.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Sheraton hotel that I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous A
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8-night stay (and two rooms) at the Sheraton Roma hotel in Rome Italy. I have never been so disappointed in a Starwood hotel before. Here is a partial list of the problems we encountered: 1. The wallpaper in our room was peeling and there were cracks in the walls. 2. There was a loud dance/music complex next to the hotel that plays music until 3 AM. It was so loud that we couldn’t sleep without earplugs until the music stopped. 3. Although we purchased the club lounge upgrade that supposedly provided snacks and drinks until 11:00 PM, the staff would put everything away and setup for breakfast by 10:30 PM. 4. Although the hotels website and email clearly said that Internet access in our room was included in the club lounge upgrade, they still added a charge for internet access at checkout and we had to argue until a manager finally removed the charge. 5. The ATM never had any cash in it. 6. Although the staff kept saying that we could buy Roma Passes at the front desk, they never showed up. One time I went down to the front desk at 6:45 AM, they said they said the passes would be there at 7:30 AM. Even though I sat in front of the desk for 45 minutes, when I asked about them at 7:30 AM, they said they were all gone. 7. We tried to eat dinner at the restaurant one night but the waiter only brought two out of four meals. After that, he kept bringing random meals and asked us if that was what we ordered. We noticed the same problem was happening at several other tables. Finally, after complaining to the manager, they didn’t charge us for any meals.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay with a family!”
