Reviews.Author: mum2521
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add a positive review for Sheraton Roma as I had read several recent negative reviews, and we had an entirely positive experience. The pool was fabulous for the kids (5 and 8) - perfect after a hot day of sightseeing. We often had dinner and a drink by the pool while the kids were swimming. I found all the staff to be extremely helpful and pleasant. The courtesy buses to the city run every 1 1/2 hours and it was easy enough to plan our day to coincide with the bus schedule (certainly cheaper than taking a taxi). We also made use of the courtesy bus to the airport. The room was clean and the breakfast was excellent. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “That's what I call business travelling ;)”
Reviews.Author: Dorotka_BS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for business travellers as it provides all you need (comfortable room, filling breakfast of many options, Internet only an hour in the room but free in the lobby) and at the same time relaxation opportunities: outdoor swimming pool under the palms and very extensively equipped gym. Worth rememberring: there is a very cheap bus shuttle to the city and to the airport and coming to the hotel from those places is for free. Staff not very attentive but you can just about sort things out efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “OverCharged for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: jojo34Cork
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quiet average and the staff at reception have no concept of customer service and are overall quite rude and unhelpful. The hotel also overcharges for all food and beverages in comparison to the prices that can be found in the city of Rome itself. The pool and outdoor area are the only redeeming qualities the hotel possess's.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and yes there are Renovations”
Reviews.Author: midlandtourist
Reviews.Content: We have just finished a three day stay. And we have had a fine time. We stay in hotels more than 50 days a year and we often stay in Stawood properties. There are lots of unfavourable reviews but read before you go and you know what you are getting. We got our rate right from the Sheraton site and it was 33% off when we booked last spring- We payed less than 100 Euro a night and our rate included a full American breakfast buffet. And this is Rome, It is at the high point of the tourist time and this is a bargain. This hotel in not in the Centre of Rome in fact it is not easy to walk anywhere but there is a public bus stop at the end of the driveway. But the hotel provides a bus that takes you right into town. The ride takes 20 to 30 minutes and is 3 Euro. Can not beat that. Hint You must get your bus tickets at the front desk with the concierge before you get on the bus. The bus takes 53 people and law does not permit standing. The bus picks you up from the same place and the ride back is no charge. We found it easy and convenient. Right on the Starwood site it says the hotel is undergoing renovations. So if you are a platinum member you will not right now be getting a club room. But we have been here three days. We are on the fourth floor and we have not heard any construction sounds. There is no dust in the air. The hotel is dated and they are doing something about it. The staff have been very helpful, in the dining room at the breakfast buffet, at the desk and in the Club lounge. In fact I have a food intollerance and they provided me with safe alternatives. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as long as you know some tips before you go”
Reviews.Author: jcbVisalia
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel, but without having read some of the tips on TripAdvisor it may not have been as good. First of all if you book this hotel make sure you book the upgrade to the Club Level. We were able to bypass the check-in line and go directly to the Club Level to check-in while sitting down. The Club Level is open for breakfast, cold foods only but there was plenty to eat for a full day of site seeing. It is open until 11pm and always has food and drink available. It was so nice at the end of the day to have a glass of Prosecco and snacks. There is also free Internet access and a printer available if needed. We used our laptop there each day, but there are computers there if you don't have a laptop with you. Beware of the disco off property that has blaring music all night long. After two sleepless nights I talked to Maria in the Club lounge and asked for a room change. She was very helpful and got us moved immediately. I would suggest you request a room in the back of the hotel upon check-in so it won't be a problem. Once we were moved, the noise was no longer a problem. Thank you Maria, she made our stay very pleasant! The room was spacious and comfortable. Any request was well received. We were only in the room to sleep so we did not need anything fancy. Taxis were always available. We used the shuttle from the airport, we had to wait a while since the timing wasn't the best, but it was fine and resonably priced. We used the shuttle to the city center (3 euros round trip) which worked well, but the times were not frequent enough and once it was full upon the return to the hotel in the evening. Be sure you are there and in line so you will get a ride. We did do the walk to the train, not the best walk, but it was doable if you are willing to give it a try. We would stay here again and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, relaxing, amazing”
Reviews.Author: AMinhas88
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very relaxing. Great service, excellent staff. A warm welcome when we arrived there. The rooms were big and very comfortable, bathrooms excellent. Cleanliness excellent. The hotel was easy to get about. Great pool and sun bathing area, nice restaurant and bar, with excellent food. Very very friendly and helpful staff, who helped with planning your day and booking trains and getting the local and national public services timetable downloaded. Regular bus service to the city and airport and not far from either. Had a excellent relaxing time, would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel, I would definitely return. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay, made the holiday experience even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't have any problems”
Reviews.Author: ActRegular_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 3 nights in June and overall it was a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. Our first night was included as the last night of a tour and we had separately booked a further 2 nights ourselves via the website. We had sent an email to the hotel explaining, but were a little apprehensive about possible stuff-ups - but no, on arrival they had us booked for the same room for the 3 nights. Price for the extra 2 nights was very reasonable by Rome standards. Our room (1081) was large and very comfortable, although a long hike from the lobby. The standard of fit-out was fine. The bed was a bit soft for my liking as were the pillows, but they provided extras of those. There was a safe provided and an old-style TV. Minibar was locked. The room was very dim - we never did figure out how to turn on the standard lamp. The shower was in the bath - used a curtain. 1 hour Internet for free (per day) was available in the lobby on their PCs - this was very slow. The hotel is situated roughly halfway between the city & the airport so is a fair way from anything - we were a little worried about being a captive audience, but we were pleasantly surprised to find the buffet dinner to be good and reasonable value. Wine prices were not outrageous either and coffees were very reasonably priced. Breakfast was very good and included with a good range - even bread for toast! (Something of a novelty for us after 2 weeks in Italy.) They provide a regular shuttle bus to/from the city for 3 Euro each which was good value however we discovered the shuttle doesn't run Saturdays - and presumably Sundays either. (This wasn't anywhere on the brochure provided by reception.) When it came time to go to the airport at 5.30am, there was no problem with getting a taxi - several were outside at all times. Maybe we were lucky, but based on our experience we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outright terrible”
Reviews.Author: aobtron
Reviews.Content: Hi Folks, Stayed here recently on a business trip. Whole experience was outright terrible. Rude staff, long queues at reception, terrible internet access, room decor old, stale and smelly. Went for dinner in the outside court yard on the night I arrived. Both the food and service was terrible. Very rude and ignorant staff. When it came to settling my bill the bar man short changed me. Incredibly dishonest. Besides all of the above, this hotel is in a poor location just off a busy motorway in the middle of no where.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting cocktail that worked for us”
Reviews.Author: shivaji_dasgupta
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time figuring out a place to stay in the most expensive hotel market in Europe and picked on the Sheraton Roma for a good reason and honestly were not disappointed. I know that some of the reviews on this site are damaging but let me explain why we liked the place. Firstly, the price - at less than 100 euros a night for a Sheraton, rundown and four star though it may be, is a good deal. The quality is good - great beds, good loos, good airconditioning, great free breakfast and a decent price room service ( 12 euros for a pasta). Surely, the place needs revamp but would that not take up the rates by a lot? The airport shuttle was bang on time giving us a ride to hotel for 5 euros each. The city centro storico shuttle was great value and superbly punctual which meant that we had no taxi cost or metro hassle, three euros return for each trip per head. It dropped us right next to the Capitoline Museum. Considering the quality we would get for the money we spent, we are totally thrilled. Breakfast, I mentioned earlier, was awesome with enough meats and cheese and eggs to get you going all day. If the above defines your value experience, Sheraton Roma is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We won't return to this property”
Reviews.Author: tmarq
Reviews.Content: We generally book most if not all of our family vacation accommodations with either Sheraton or the Westin and are more often than not very pleased with the properties we've visited. However, our visit to the Sheraton Rome was extremely disappointing. Starting with the non-existent hotel shuttle that was not available to pick up our party from the airport forcing us to pay taxi fare of 15 euros per person. Once arrived we discovered that the hotel was completing construction of the lobby (we weren't made aware of is prior to our arrival) we had to wait 30 minutes to check-in because the front desk staff consisted of just two people. We were further disappointed when we exited the elevator on our floor and found the smell of stale cigarette smoke that also filtered onto our non-smoking rooms. The disappointment continued when we entered the rooms to find that rooms were extremely outdated with old, worn carpet, bedspreads and televisions. The bathrooms showed excessive wear, cracks in the floors, outdated inefficient sink and shower fixtures and mold in the tub. Service from the housekeeping staff was far below standard, when we asked for extra towels we were told the hotel was OUT! During the 5 nights we had Internet access for only two nights because the hotel continually lost their service. Don't look for any concierge to assist you with directions, tours or transportation ideas because this person was never present during our entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “"Everything was too much trouble ... !"”
Reviews.Author: guildz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our choice but the final night's stay [+ an extra night on our own] of a beautiful Insight holiday touring the country roads of Southern Italy ... and sadly this was our lasting impression of Italy. Firstly it was in the middle of nowhere with regards to the touristy places ... admittedly there was a shuttle bus but it was a case of the quick and the dead as to who was lucky enough to secure seats. There was a major renovation in process with workmen and building apparatus here there and everywhere ... one had to be careful not to stumble over obstacles. The beds were very comfortable but there was a general shabbiness and the bathroom looked slightly grubby ... certainly not in keeping with a supposed 4 star hotel. The mini bar was locked and the concierge demanded a credit card be lodged at the front desk before they would even open it. There was a constant queue at the front desk so checking out took quite a while and our arranged lift to the airport was held up. The staff on duty at the front desk was generally rude and arrogant, and every request was too much trouble ... a course on customer service with a smile would certainly not go amiss ... ! By contrast, the staff on duty at breakfast were the exact opposite ... they were cheerful and friendly and provided lots of customer service ... perhaps they should give the crew at the front desk some tips ... !

Reviews.Title: “Very bad location, cockroaches in breakfast buffet, not the most friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rashroush
Reviews.Content: To start with: 1) Location: the hotel is located middle of nowhere, no nearby restaurants cafes or bars or convenient stores, you have to take a taxi, the metro or the bus to "somewhere" where they could possibly sell beer. So if you decided to walk to the metro station Eur Magliana ( about 10-12 min. walk) you are gonna walk on a dumped under bridge road where some cars park and lots of empty broken beer and wine bottles scattered along the way, then you walk on the tiny tiny walking side by the highway which is not at all convenient for pulling luggage from/to the hotel... beside the reception told us its not "safe" to walk that way after 9 PM... !!! And if you decided to take the taxi to the metro station, you will most probably get an angry pissed off reaction from the driver, since it "not so far" and he "wont" be able to rip you off as he wishes.. So if you are in Rome for tourism , DONT stay here !! if you are here for business, I have no idea if this is good location or not. However, the hotel provides shuttle bus from/to the center, it cost 3 Euro per person. 2) Hygiene: In general we encountered no issues about the room cleanness, however I saw 2 cockroaches on the breakfast buffet table (not inside the kitchen, but outside on the buffet table visible to customers!!!), I pointed one of them to the waiter who happened to be standing right next to me, he acted immediately. the second cockroach was a tiny one getting in and out of the coffee machine.. !!! I am sure if there was a proper food/health organization that checks the hygiene standards in restaurants , Sheraton wont stand a chance ! 3) Service: like many reviews, the staff are not the most friendly, specially when compered to other staff in other hotels I have been to in Italy, however we encountered an incident, as we had a double room and when we were checking in we informed that reception that a third guest will be checking in the morning, so we expected them to give us a room with a possible extra bed fitting in, so we went to the room and there was a bed/sofa and we thought everything is okey, and the next morning the third guest checked in without any problems, however when the housekeeping was supposed to prepare the extra bed they suddenly realized that the sofa bed is broken, and we had to change the room late at night , which was totally inconvenient... The safe box in the new room was broken and the lightning was very little in the room.. the only good thing about the room was the double bed and the pillows , the sofa bed was not that comfortable though.. we wont come back to this hotel, and it does not stand up to other Sheraton hotel standards...

Reviews.Title: “Peeling wallpaper and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Jonpaul806
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days at the beginning of July. The photographer they used for the website is a magician! It is nothing like the photos. The building either needs to be demolished or closed and totally refurbished. We had peeling wallpaper and mould on our bedroom walls. It was a club room - supposedly their best! Service was appalling. We were seen as a nuisance if we asked for help or service. The motorway runs directly opposite the hotel and at night a very loud nightclub booms out across the hotel. It is miles from Rome and costs a lot to get in and out. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Un happy workers”
Reviews.Author: Zivijo8
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 5 nights. We got a really good price assuming because of the renovations. Can definitely relate to the comments regarding poor service. There were a few individual staff members who were friendly, however most seemed to be hating life and not interested in being at work or assisting you. Room was nice and bed comfortable. The restaurant is very expensive compared to ones outside. At least double the price so worth venturing out of the grounds. The pool area was lovely but you need to get in early as people tend to 'bags' a chair by putting their stuff on it then not use it for hours. Overall was okay but big disappointment with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: davidlewis1
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews we were a little concerned as to whether we had made a mistake in booking this hotel.Upon arrival we noticed renovation work was taking place but this did not effect our stay in any way what so ever.We found all the staff to be helpful and friendly,the bedrooms very clean and comfortable,the breakfast excellent,the pool very relaxing but very cold.The shuttle bus was excellent,about 20 mins from the centre,but we knew this prior to booking.All in all we had a fantastic stay,it was lovely to be able to relax by the pool away from the city after a long day sightseeing and couldn't of asked for anymore from the hotel or staff,when visiting Rome again we would definitely book this hotel and would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities, but far for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: BevyPoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel pool and pool restaurant were nice and relaxing, however the pool closes very early at around 7 I think. There is a shuttle to get downtown and to the airport for a fee. I found the drive far and there is not a guaranteed seat on the way home. Friends and I got on the last shuttle at the end of the night and some were almost forced to be stranded downtown around a 11 or 1130 at night. So it was a battle getting onto the shuttle, and then we shared seats so that a poor girl by herself would not be forced to stay behind. As with most Sheratons, I find the extra amenities to be quite expensive, including the food. The laundry service was so expensive I decided it would be cheaper to buy new clothes. But the room was nice, large, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Business - Not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Boulderite32
Reviews.Content: Very corporate hotel in the middle of nowhere. Fine for someone who's flying out the next day or wanting a place close to the airport to sleep off jetlag. Would not stay here if I wanted to see Rome. Can't walk anywhere from the hotel. Very expensive bar / restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than most of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: whitemountainman
Reviews.Content: I was here for 3 nights on business. The hotel is a bit shabby on the outside but the interior is fine with some minor renovations off the main lobby going on. The rooms are clean and up to the usual Sheraton standard. Overall, not too bad. Check-in: The front desk is terribly designed. You have to wind your way through unorganized throngs to get to the elevator when you come and go. It sticks right out in the way of traffic. The Concierge is among the check-in staff and I was told by him to go to them to check in. While there I heard the same thing a half a dozen times. This could be remedied in the short term by a simple sign that says "Concierge" but apparently the management never thinks like this. The check in staff were incredibly helpful and friendly however (as was the Concierge). There aren't enough of them and they work way too hard because some suit couldn't be bothered to analyze the design of the check in area. It's embarrasing. Luggage Storage: I checked a bag since I arrived in the early morning. Instead of a secure room there is just a corner of the lobby divided by a velvet rope. When I went to get my bag there was no one around so I just took it. Not secure and actually quite irresponsible of the hotel management. Shuttle: It runs reliably and will bring you downtown for 3 Euro. Not a bad service. Takes about 1/2 hour each way. Be aware that you will be outside town if you choose this hotel. There is also a dependable airport shuttle for a few Euro. It worked for us. Breakfast: OK buffet but there were no fewer than 10 waiters standing around doing next to nothing. Their only apparent function was clearing plates and pouring coffee and they ignored me 3 mornings in a row while congregating around my table. I did notice that attractive women were given coffee. This didn't help me much. Noise: I was given a room next too a cleaning crew utility room and there was a heck of a lot of noise coming from there all day and most of the night. I slept OK due to jet lag but the hotel should never have sold that room. Check-Out: After observing the constant chaotic crowds at the desk at all hours my colleagues and I asked if we could check out the night before. The staff willingly accomodated our request. Nice people. Otherwise we probably would have missed the airport shuttle. Good staff (other than those idiotic waiters) but an really thoughtless general management and perhaps corporate management. This place could be so much better if someone in charge actually cared.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: We booked this with a name your price deal and got about what we expected. The room was reasonably priced but far from the city center. We figured we were trading a bit of convenience to save on cost-which was fine. Check-in was brutally slow. The room itself was nice and pretty spacious by Rome standards. We didn't use the pool but it looked pretty decent. The metro is about a 15 minute walk, but wouldn't recommend it for those with children or mobility issues since sidewalks are narrow and Rome drivers are very aggressive. Some more internet terminals in the lobby would be a plus since they were almost always full. Checkout was a bit smoother when leaving. Overall not bad, but room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Service is terrible. Do not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: LlaniRay
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff is rude, slow and unhelpful. The only good service we received during our stay was in the restaurant. Facilities are fair but the service is terrible. Also, if you have the misfortune to have to stay there for business (as we did) make sure you get your ticket for the bus to the City Centre early because it call be full and no they won't let you make reservations ahead of time. Also, if you want to work out in the gym make sure that you tell the front desk when you check in because you must sign a release form first before you can get access to the gym. Otherwise, you will have to wait in line forever to speak with the oh so friendly (not) Front Desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice transportation options”
Reviews.Author: pip1950
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel after I landed in Roma. I used both the shuttle from the airport and to downtown. Both are very convenient, except the shuttle from the airport does not operate between 10:45 am and 2:15 pm. Long lunch hour. It so happen that was the time I landed in Roma and the time my return flight leave also. I loved the shuttle to downtown and especially the last return buss is 11:00pm. That means we can have a good supper in town. We did try to walk from the Metro, it is OK if you are not lugging your luggage and during daylight hours. it goes over some rough pavement and under a fly-over. Restaurant is not bad and reasonable as there is no other choices around the hotel. The front desk staffs were not very friendly. I have not met one friendly/helpful staff . It seems that if you do not speak Italian, they are not interested, very impatience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay for couples - will not be back”
Reviews.Author: hrajguru
Reviews.Content: This hotel's primary customers are business people - I would label this as an average 3* hotel compared to others we have stayed at. Our last visit to a Sheraton was the Sheraton Voyager, Antalya which was excellent by comparison, and so we thought we would try another Sheraton branded hotel. The grounds are basic, the hotel is undergoing buildings work probably until the end of the year - which causes a lot of dust in and around the lobby area - avoid if you have allergies! The service was very average - there was a 2 hour wait when we arrived due to lack of unavailable rooms - this I believe was an oversight of Expedia! Check-in took a long time and the staff seemed very casual. We had a Starwood Preferred Guest Room, which is meant to be a far superior room than the standard. The room itself was very dusty - there was just a smell stale dust in the air, which caused my wife to react quite badly, due to her dust allergy. Regardless we stayed the first night in the room, only to our peril! We asked to move rooms the next day and the hotel moved us a few doors down, this room was slightly less dusty and had obviously been sprayed with air freshener. Despite the room being a little cleaner my wife got much worse to the point where she had a fever and so we had to cancel the rest of the trip and come back home early - which was an obvious disappointment. Check-out took an age - approx 25min! The hotel refused to refund us but offered us other rooms - by which time we were sick of the cleanliness. We've taken some photos of dust actually clinging onto the walls of the room! To add to this, there was an open-air disco across the road from the hotel, the bass from which vibrated the windows! The music went on until approx 2-3am up until we left. The hotel didn't do much about it other than call the police, who didn't do much either. The grounds are pretty average, and the hotel is approx 15min walk from the closest metro station, this is a nice(ish) walk in the day time but is a little dodgy after dark. It is in the middle of what seemed a pretty run down area. The food once again is nothing compared to the Sheraton Voyager - and incredibly over priced. The service in the restaurant was far better. Only when we stated that we were cutting the holiday short did anyone show some sympathy and offered a room without carpets as some help - however by this time we were sick of the hotel and had already changed our flights. The hotel also decided to charge the credit card additional nights worth of stays for Rome City tax - this will be disputed as we weren't even in the Country during this! I guess it adds to their (lack of) professionalism. In short - do not stay at this hotel if you want luxury or a decent service; its probably fine as a quick stopover for business but not for couples or family. It gives Sheraton (and Starwood Hotels) a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly, not convenient, too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: MomSheila
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend. Staff does only the minimum necessary. Conflicting information from concierge regarding shuttle services available. Concierge also behaved, consistently, like they didn't want to be bothered, thus I always felt the blow-off (like not being listened to, so I think misinformation was always being given). Inconvenient to get to Metro (downright dangerous walk!) but my family of 5 did it with our New York City know-how! This made our stay in Rome difficult. Restaurant waiter spilled wine on my white blouse, no offer to have it cleaned on hotel's bill. Took cab to Termini Rail station, and was made to feel like luggage was too much of a hassle. We are 5 people! Travellers! There is luggage, and not excessive either! The phone in my room did not work properly, and I couldn't get ANYONE to listen to me about that either....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room- bad service.”
Reviews.Author: SR0279
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not near the sites, but it has shuttle bus for a fee and the metro is a short cab ride away. The room was large and comfortable, but the service was awful. No one was rude, but just oftentimes unresponsive and disorganized. We had to make several calls to Guest Services to get a drain stopper for our tub and to get working light bulbs for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but location is not near the city center.”
Reviews.Author: email4Sujit
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt about the brand name and their facilities. They provide free internet machines. But no free WiFi. Only problem is the metro station is about 1 KM and not walking friendly roads. Bus timings are not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe it's Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeH524
Reviews.Content: Writing this review in the hotel room now after being harassed by mosquitos all night... Pro: Convenient shuttle connection to City Center and Airport; Shuttles are on time and affordable; Seems like remodeling are taking place and should be much better in the future. Nice staff that check us in early so that we can get some rest. Quick response time in delivering items requested. Cons: non-smoking room that smells like cigarettes; groups of mosquitos that will fly near your face in the middle of the night every 2 hours (killed 2, still counting...); wall paper pealing off the wall; internet price are a bit high (12 Euro for wired, 16 Euro for wireless after using the initial 3 hours); waiter tends to favor European customers, slow service to others, especially if you "look" different. Last but not least, the hotel cannot provided changes in the middle of the night yet the vending machine here only takes coins, if you are still on a jet lag, keeps this in mind. Overall, as a gold member of Starwood who have stayed at over 100+ Starwood properties, this one definitely ranks near the bottom. Imaging a typical Day's Inn or Travelodge (I'm talking about the room, not the lobby, which is fine). Exterior looks more like an outdated apartment than a hotel from a distance, but does get better once you approach the building.

Reviews.Title: “Below avarage Hotel, Poor customer service and expensive”
Reviews.Author: meco42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at this Hotel and found it very average. On check in we found the staff unfriendly. The reception desk was ALWAYS busy and understaffed. Our first night was greated with a very expensive bill for 1 drink each and what can only be described as a chicken burger and chips (65 EUROS). When we booked our stay we were told we could not pre book breakfast so we enquired about it at check in and were told it would be 25 EUROS EACH!!!!!!! hence we went into the city centre where we found more friendly people and the prices more reasonable. The rooms were clean and comfortable although our room had loud music playing nearby every night until at least midnight. We found the shuttle bus to and from the city very good and reliable and only 3 EUROS each for a return. I wouldn't recomend this Hotel nor would I return to it, but Rome as a city more than made up for our stay, it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel, staff and location - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: arem
Reviews.Content: we checked in for one night at this hotel and we are so glad it was only one night! we tried to check in and after waiting ten minutes while the staff were on the telephone, we were eventually checked in with very little grace and certainly no favour! After receiving our room keycards, we received no information about the hotel, directions to our bedroom etc, we found the way ourselves, only to find we had entered a bedroom which was obviously still occupied! When pointing this out when we went back to reception we were told it was our family's room??? Eventually we received the correct bedroom which was shabby, dirty and very unwelcoming. We found the staff to be most unhelpful and very rude - the breakfast was the only ray of sunshine in our one night fiasco and it was good with a nice selection. Summary - pay more and stay downtown where the sights are much nearer and hopefully the hotel a lot friendlier!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for tourists in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Zan11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. To start, the service was amazing! Travelling with seven people could prove a challenge to bellhops hailing you a cab in italy, where all cars are tiny, but they always did! the room was very nice. In our peticular room though, we had an obstructed view out the window. Your best bet for window views is the rooms overlooking the pool area. The rooms can only hold three people max. To fit three, you must ask for a cot, which in Italy, are pretty comfortable. The hotel was a little off centre, a 15 euro cab ride to city centre, in the hotel you have a massive pool with a bar closeby (not swim-up) and a pool side restaurant with american food...advise: DON'T EAT THERE FOR HAMBURGERS! Driving from Calabria to Rome took us a long time. The poolside restaurant was our only option... you also have 6 public sony vaio computers with unlimited wifi. the entire hotel has wifi too! there is also a nice real italian restaurant on site that we didnt use. This is a great hotel for families and businessmen alike. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but poor.”
Reviews.Author: Vacation2SanAntonio
Reviews.Content: A cold and old business hotel. Personal is cranky and not willing to help with tourist information. They act like you are disturbing them with very dumb questions but the truth is they don't even understand what you are saying. Room service is overly expensive and of mediocre quality. They charge for everything, from internet to the airport shuttle. There is nothing in the neighborhood and finding a convenience store is a challenge. The best transportation is the subway, it’s about a 10 minute walk from the hotel and by far the fastest way to get to the hotspots. If you are looking for a decent bed and cold AC after a hard day of sightseeing this place is okay, otherwise look further. Make sure to check your bill, not only in this hotel but anywhere in Rome. See pictures for room service prices… and a movie is only 19 euro's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely reccomend it!!”
Reviews.Author: mmyesq
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 27. The staff was great, especially Alesandro and Said. They were just helpful from beginning to end. Although the hotel is not in the city center, the hotel shuttel definitely makes up for it. The room was spacious and service was excellent. The restaurant was surprisingly the best food we had in Rome. Definitely dont miss a meal there, especially there pizzas. If it was one thing which was a draw back, was the pool was open during limited hours, but in Rome you wont have time to use it. The hotel definitely made our stay in Rome enjoyable! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: kmx888
Reviews.Content: Check in was great (Platinum member). The breakfast was world class. The food at other meals was great as well. Bar food was good. Rooms were a bit dated but acceptable. The bad point was that the air conditioning did not work ( it was stiflingly hot in Rome as well). Repeated attempts over two days to contact hotel staff by phone went unanswered. Not guest services, not housekeeping and not the front desk. Must be hotel policy not to bother.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, to far from city, internet not working”
Reviews.Author: rondonna1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Sheratons, and this was below average. Employee's were not friendly at all. They did not have any internet working while we were there either. The buses were hot and over-crowded. We are Starwood Members and did not even get on a starwood floor. It was a big letdown. It was middle of May and temps were in the 80's yet pool was not opened yet.

Reviews.Title: “Simply - the best”
Reviews.Author: Donny1828
Reviews.Content: First - Let's get the "bad" out of the way. My only complaints are the parking situation. There are two free parking areas. the one closest to the hotel tests your driving skills as the spaces are small and limited. On the other side of the hotel, you certainly feel vaulnerable as it's few feet from the street and wide open, inviting trouble. Put some type of barrier or security and problem solved. Now that's out of the way, the good stuff... We've been visiting Italy now on a yearly basis for the past ten years. We've never had a problem at this hotel, the staff is very accomodating and friendly. The Club Lounge is wonderful, very relaxing and the view on teh terrace is great. The bus schedule is convenient, although recently there has been a 3 Euro charge. Sheraton is lucky to have this staff represent them. Starting with the Supervisor, Pamela and her staff. We would not stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good and the bad... up at 2AM”
Reviews.Author: timzerofive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Rome for the 8th day on our honeymoon trip from France, 1st night in Italy. I am up at 2 AM on our 1st night here writing this review which should tell you something. Lets start with the good. The good: Decently clean room. Standard 3 star business hotel (like a hampton inn). Upgraded us to Superior room (made us wonder how bad standard rooms would have been) due to telling them its our honeymoon. Surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne plus bottles of water! Pretty good staff although appeared overworked. Bus to city center (next to Capitol Hill) was convenient. Could use a few more stops in Rome. Next, the bad: OLD and DATED room. Needs renovation in a bad way! One light bulb was out. Called to the front desk asking to replace plus bringing some more towels. Towels came, but no one ever showed to fix the light. Overcrowded lobby/check in area due to constant arrival of large tour bus and tour groups. "Gated" paid parking feel just as vulnerable to break-ins as the free parking on the other side of the "gate", which is just a arm that lowers at the entrance. Anyone could walk in and break into your car. Thin walls where conversations in the hallway was a disturbance. Location is as bad as it gets with it being FAR FAR away from the city center or anything else for that matters. Feels like it is trapped by highways on all sides, and sounds like it too in the room. You won't be able to walk anywhere, even the metro station, so thank goodness for the bus service they offer. Lobby area is undergoing renovation so you have the constant chaos of 5 tour buses trying to back out of the check in drive way, which fits 2 small cars at most. Not attractive at all. Now, lets talk about the worst part, and the reason I'm up at 2 AM. A "new" disco opened up across the street, as the staff informed me. Tonight being the first time this has happened. Loud, obnoxious club music blasting the entire hotel. I mean loud to the point I can hear what the idiotic DJ is shouting to the crowds. I was woken up by this at 1AM and called down to the lobby. The staff told me it is a new disco down the street. When I ask what time will the music stop, he said its the first time this has happened so he doesn't know. Well, it appears Rome clubs usually go on until sunrise. Thats another 3 hours that we will have to endure this!!!! This is something completely unacceptable and is absolutely ruining our trip. This is also a hotel we will not be booking again ever. Despite the staffs' attempts to keep it a 4 star level hotel and the special treatment we received, there are just too many bad things going against it for us to consider this place again. Concluding analysis: Not a 4 star hotel in terms of quality, even though the amenities are there. A solid but dated 3 star hotel IMO. Too far from city center and there are other nicer and newer "boutique" hotels that are on the outskirts as well. I would pay more next time just to stay closer to the city or look for a newer hotel thats more on the outskirt.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location, unfriendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: dabearsfan007
Reviews.Content: pros - spacious rooms and bathroom, clean cons - not a friendly staff at all (during check-in or asking for assistance). Internet is not free. They have 4 computers that are always being used. The worst part of this hotel is its location. If you do not take a taxi, you have to walk a 10-15 minute walk to the train station across 2 freeways and poor road conditions. The internet was 15 euro a day. If you want to use the free computers, you will have to wait because they are always busy. The staff was not friendly during checkin (approx 30 minutes) and didn't offer any advice for travel. We found out the last day before we were going to the airport via taxi, the hotel has a bus that goes to the airport for 5 euro per person. The rooms are roomy and bathroom is spacious. Do not put anything in the fridge or it might be charged as it is measured by weight. During our checkout, our bill was incorrect as well so double check that when leaving.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleaset stay, Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Camilleri
Reviews.Content: Arrival I would recommend booking a taxi to find the hotel as the Sheraton is quite a trek from Fumicino Airport. On arrival we were greeted with a very pleasent receptionist, who spoke very good English (all staff were helpful, kind and pleasent). The Hotel offered a Bed and Breakfast deal which was very good, however, we booked a club room on the 5th Floor, this meant we were able to access the Club Lounge (Located on the 6th Floor), we were treated with complimentary Wine, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, tea etc from 6am - 11pm. The hotel resturant was very good, offered some lovely meals, however, a little pricey. Pizza's around 10 Euros, Pasta around 13 Euros. Hotel room was extremely clean and tidy with T.V/ mini bar (Quite pricey, however very useful if desperate) telephone and wi-fi (Wi-fi was 12 Euro's per 24hours, altough a deal was offered for your stay). The Hotel is situated in the EUR district, which is about 20mins from the city centre (by bus). The hotel offers a coach service into the centre several times a day (always on time). If you'd rather, the metro train station is about a 5-10 mintue walk from the hotel). Again, Staff were more than willing to help direct you to the station. Surrounding Area Walking distance to several churches/monuments. A lovely pool and decking area - the pool was unfortunately closed during our stay as a flim crew was using it for a couple of their shots, however, the decking area was open almost 24hours a day. The hotel also has a shop (situated in the lobby) which sells, mints, chewing gums, chocolate, cigerettes, magazines and other 'gift shop' items such as magnets, keyrings, book marks, T-Shirts etc. The shop does not sell drinks. Overall an extremely pleasent stay and would reccomned to anyone whose looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of thieves.”
Reviews.Author: SimHur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton as part of our organised tour of Italy. The room was quite spacious and satisfactory, and breakfast was excellent. However, we had the unfortunate incident of having my handbag stolen in the lobby computer centre. It is a very busy hotel and just before departure I was using the computer; I was only there for about 5 minutes to check in my next flight and my bag was right next to my chair. There was no security; the area is essentially open to anyone (ie. access should be regulated by room keys). The security officer in the hotel was helpful in allowing me to use his phone to cancel my credit cards, although I feel that they should have facilitated the police to come and take my statement (this was difficult for me to arrange at the airport just before my flight). I would also question their stance that the hotel lobby is a public area and therefore is not covered by the hotel's insurance. Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel - as long as you are prepared to walk about 15 minutes to the nearest train station (note: the shuttle is very infrequent - only every 90 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: samiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Roma over the Easter and did find it pretty much the way we expected. Couple of surprises were there and maybe if we had read the other reviews we would have known also about those facts. Location is quite far from the centre but I suppose anyone should be able to tell that from the map before making reservations. Therefore I dont understand why people complain about the location.. What you most probably wont see from the map is the fact that the two metro stations (Marconi and EUR Magliana) are not very easily reachable by foot even though they appear close on the map. The hotel is next to a busy freeway and you either have to cross some busy lanes or walk on the side of the road to get to the metro station. Once you get the hang of it, I guess it is pretty ok. But be careful, Italians drive like crazy and don't care about pedestrians.. The hotel itself is in pretty good condition from inside, but you can see that it has already seen the best of her days. There is refurbishing going on so it might be that the hotel looks very different after a year or two. The elevators are brand new and we also liked the gym downstairs which had new equipment. The bad thing was the water machine in the gym was always empty in the morning and rarely they had clean towels. There is wifi in the lobby are but in the rooms it's only the old fashioned cable connection. Therefore an iPad was worthless in the room and wifi was stunning 7€ for the first 1/2h. They had a deal for 16€ for the full day but I didn't see it very useful since the signal didn't reach the rooms. There are four computers downstairs which were always very crowded, so take your time if you want to use the internet. The breakfast was ok, but for Sheraton I would have expected that the staff would even know what an omelette is. But yes, there is scrambled eggs and bacon, sausages and all the basic stuff. Since the hotel is pretty far away from the centre and there are no restaurants nearby, we mostly ate dinner at the hotel. The selection and the food is good, go ahead and try it. The atmosphere isnt very romantic and paying 100€ for two person's buffet and drinks is quite much to be honest. But as a tip I would suggest the following: it is possible to get just part of the buffet, for instance only the salads from the table. Or you can only have the meat or the pasta part of the buffet to get you around 10-15€ for the dinner. There is a car park outside of the hotel, so I would especially recommend the hotel if you're driving through Rome and need a place to stay in. All-in-all, semi-ok experience. Would have waited to get a little bit more from a Sheraton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel - needs work!”
Reviews.Author: AmyZ_Seattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of our 2 week trip to Italy in April 2011. There is no way this is a 4 star hotel. It is in need of some major work. The double room we stayed in had a view of a dirty court of some sort, stains on the bedspread covers, a safe that didn't work, majorly dinged up walls/corners and chipped paint. Not the standards I am used to from the Sheraton brand. We had booked a connecting room when making the reservation, but that accomodation was not made upon check-in and only adjacent rooms were available. There was also an error of additional charges on our bill that we had to get corrected upon check out. Not a great hotel experience from Sheraton. One positive was the female concierge (sorry, cannot remember her name) - she was very helpful in explaining how to use the train and getting us a dinner reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel away from the heart of the action.”
Reviews.Author: azzfromSB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day/night break in Rome staying at the Sheraton Roma. The hotel itself is of a decent standard, the bar is a pleasant place to spend an hour or two, the restaurant offers up a decent selection of dishes, and the reception area was a hive of activity (offering up free internet use). There was also a pool which looked very nice but we didn't try to use it and a wealth of other activities we never had chance to sample. We stayed in the cheapest room type after booking for a very reasonable rate online and the room size was very good, with a large queen size bed, and seperate sofa. The room was clean the air con was good and the maids turned down the room whenever we turned the do not disturb light off, can't ask for more. All the staff we encountered were polite and helpful. The shuttle bus service to the city was useful, and also to the airport. I'd recommend this hotel if you don't mind having to travel into the city proper on a daily basis and want a decent quality hotel for your money. Quick tip : the shuttle buses back from the city were full every time we caught them so when you are waiting try to stand close to where you think the doors will end up and get on first or you'll be left waiting for the next one! Food and drink is very very expensive in this hotel and all of Rome it seems, try the wine in the Piano bar for €6.40 you get a huge glass full (equiv to at least a 'large' glass in UK) and it's lovely. Compare this to ~€8 beer, €4.50 for a CAN of coke, or €10 for a vodka(!)

Reviews.Title: “outdated, overrated, not close to airport or town”
Reviews.Author: kris2108
Reviews.Content: this was an ugly, outdated hotel we stayed the night before we had to fly out thinking it would be close to the airport which is advertised, however this wasn't the case breakfast buffet was awful

Reviews.Title: “If you ask for hot water, they charge 8 euros!”
Reviews.Author: Irvine92606
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using SPG points. Before I summarize what's wrong with this hotel, let me say that the room is quiet and appears clean, and bed is comfortable. The positives end here. The location is neutral. The hotel shuttle costs 3 euros per person and goes to Piazza Venezia. The trip took about 20 minutes, which was OK. These are the things I'm not happy about: 1. The hotel interior: furnishings very old, decorated in a 1960's Las Vegas low price casino fashion. There is renovation going on, so walking from the lobby to the elevator, you walk through a "construction zone". TV in the room is not a flat screen. The model is at least 15 years old. 2. Front reception: very busy. My room key cards did not work so I had to go back and stand in line again. There were 4 people in front of me. It took about 10-15 minutes to take care of 1 person, as each time there were some kind of problems to sort out. The staff don't smile and appear unfriendly. 3. Service poor and they charge high prices for everything. The hotel is stuck in the middle of nowhere off a freeway ramp. No coffeemaker in the room. I asked for some hot water, and they told me they charge 8 euros. The lady sounded embarrassed after she said 8 euros and apologized, she said I'm sorry but that's the hotel policy. I almost wanted to laugh. What was that??!! I would not rate this a 4-star hotel. The hotel obviously made a decision to cater to very large tourist groups, and the value and services are very poor for individual travellers. The interior was last updated at least 15-20 years ago, and the hotel is of the poorest quality comparing to other hotels we stayed at in Italy. You can find 3-star hotels in Rome for much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: JBlunt
Reviews.Content: Room fine and reption excellent. The walk to EUR Magliana is not for the infirm of faint-hearted. But it is only 20 minutes to Termini from there and it is possible to get a bus back to the hotel from the Metro station. It is a pity that you cannot avail of a bus going the other way. The coach from Fuimicino is good as is the way the hotel collects the 5 euro by adding onto your bill so you dont have to pay cash. It is excellent value. The free internet connection in the lobby is good but wifi is too expensive. The cost of coca cola in the bar is expensive so drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PkWanderer
Reviews.Content: Thought Sheraton would stand out but sorry its just an average Hotel. No free wifi is really hard to understand !! Lobby looks small when hordes of flight crews drop in and flight load of tourists come.

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzenjammy
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed, comfortable room within easy striking distance of Fiumicino airport (10 minute pay-shuttle ride). The free bus from the city center was welcome, as you'd be hard-pressed to get here via transit - it's basically in a business park off the freeway, with nothing in easy walking distance. But for an early morning flight, it's just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth paying the extra 3 euro per person Rome new hotel tax!”
Reviews.Author: AShergill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 6 nights at the end of March 2011... for a 4 star hotel we were very disappointed in what we found. The hotel was being renovated, we found our room to be pretty basic,the air conditioning was a noisy unit and did not work,the staff at reception were not very friendly, the cost of bar food/drinks was ridiculous a soft drink priced at 4.50 euros !! The pool was not accessible despite the weather being hot. It was impossible to prebook their shuttle bus to the hotel on arrival to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Service very poor.. No awareness of their customer”
Reviews.Author: Daithi99
Reviews.Content: Any opportunity to get more money of of you they will get. No wifi, no free shuttle to airport, bus was unpredictable to the city centre, service at the desk was so poor- they didn't communicate any delays issues to you- room was fine, clean no problems there but won't be staying at that hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Marg
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Sheraton, Rome. We had a great time and enjoyed our selves immensely. The hotel is about 20 mins from the city centre and was easily accessed by the shuttle bus which was great value and ran every 90 mins. Our room was on the club floor and was worth the extra cost giving us access to a very peaceful lounge with complimentary drinks and snacks. The reastaurant and bar prices are a little expensive but the food was delicious and the service great. All the staff were pleasant and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, american style hotel. Plan for time getting into the city center”
Reviews.Author: Sherryl60
Reviews.Content: Pros - Staying on the club floor, which included breakfast, snacks, and drinks in the evening made this hotel worth the drawback of the distance from everything. With the exchange rate being awful and the cost of things in Italy it was a plus to have breakfast everyday in the club lounge and on those evenings were we got in late - a snack or drink and bed made life easier. The staff in the club lounge were very friendly and helpful, especially Said and Mara. We had turn down service in our room, my daughter especially loved the chocolates. One night we came home to find fresh fruit, another a bottle of Chianti. The shuttle from the airport for 5 euros per person is a great deal. The shuttle into the city for 3 euros also a great deal - although it could have run more often. There are 3 city buses that pick up right in front of the hotel - when the timing of the shuttle didn't work well. All and all, the location was not great but the options for getting into the city work well. Cons - It's on a freeway ramp. We were there in the in between season, heat off, AC not on so the rooms were warm and when we opened windows - noise from the freeway. The staff at the front desk - not so helpful. We found they gave us incorrect information or just did not know the answers to many things. Getting into the city was pretty easy but plan for more time than you think you'll need - it takes a while to get everywhere. Traffic is horrendous so factor that in. Free Internet if on a club floor - very handy. Overall, a good choice for seeing Rome if you are on a budget and are not daunted by the thought of trying out the public transit systems. Rooms are roomy and clean, staying on the club floors (SPG) a must. Nice bar and good food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4* hotel + comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: We found the Airport shuttle service convenient. They are very prompt and each way from the airport or vice versa cost 5 euro per person. The Hotel is far from the centre but the hotel has provided shuttle to the city (cost 3 euro- check with the hotel for timetable). Another option is to take the Metro (EUR Magliana) which is a 8-10 min walk from the hotel. It is not recommended if you carry heavy luggage. Our room was comfortable and clean. The Bed is very comfortable after a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: sadaffi
Reviews.Content: Overall nice stay. We found the Airport shuttle service convenient. Far from centre but hotel shuttle to city is adequate. Picks and drops to Piazza Venezia (city Centre). The bus stop (stop: Agriculturo) is at the hotel door step, take 31 to vatican or 780 to Piazza Venezia via Trastrevere. Metro (EUR Magliana) is a 8-10 min walk away but the walk has hardly any footpath so dangerous with luggage and a baby buggy. Ok for grown ups. connects direct to Termini (main rail station). Has a lift/elevator. Our room was comfortable and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was wholesome and had good few choices, so no complaints there. Hotel restaurant a bit on the pricey side but whatever we ordered was alright, not extraordinary though.

Reviews.Title: “Average quality hotel @ reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: paneraitraveller
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG platinum member. I really didn't like this hotel much. They made lots of mistakes with my check in, and it was quite frustrating. The hotel and room are oldish, not much an executive lounge. But it was cheaper vs the Westin (i.e. about EUR100+ vs EUR200+ for Westin). On hindsight, I should have booked one of the better hotels in the city centre and paid the EUR200+ as I really didn't enjoy my 2 nights in Rome at Sheraton. It motivate me to leave Rome earlier to drive into Tuscany. It's location near the EUR is nice and it is not far from city, a reasonable cab ride away. I did enjoy walking around the EUR area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside of town”
Reviews.Author: tk1780
Reviews.Content: Was looking for an American sized room in Rome that would have comfortable beds, nice bathroom and amenities. This fit the bill nicely. It was located in the EUR suburb which was 15 mins from a subway station which was 20 mins from the Termini Station in Rome. Granted it was not as convenient as walking out of your hotel and being there, but we have had some nightmare stays in old European cities and was willing to trade the inconvenience for having a nice place to stay. If you can get free internet and breakfast thrown in it is a great deal. The train station has cappuccino and chocolate croissants in the morning for 1.80 Euros and it is fantastic! The shuttle bus is convenient, especially to the airport 15 mins. Note that the airport bus is located all the way to the right when you exit Terminal 3 and it is across the street with all of the other buses. It has its own assigned parking place.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Roma”
Reviews.Author: DennisvdMolen
Reviews.Content: As a platinu member you can check in at the 6th floor, which gives you a welcome feeling. The rooms are ok, not very special,. sometimes a little old. The service is nice, and the surroundings are ok. PRice wise the hotel is not very expensice, but then again, the location is not an 'A' location. If you come for a weekend, you can use the bus from the Sheraton, which brings you at the rim of the city centre, and from there you can walk to the city. This is very convenient and not expensive. The rooms are quite, however sometimes the cleaning ladies don't pay attention to the ' do not disturb' signs and come just waliing into your room, which sometimes can result in awkward moments :-)

Reviews.Title: “A true hotel...”
Reviews.Author: cazyfaith
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I went to Rome for the Italy vs. Ireland Six Nations match and stayed at the Sheraton Roma. All the staff speak perfect English and are efficient and professional. We were upgraded to a Superior Room and I was extremely impressed with the size of the room and the furnishings. On the first evening we were very tired and ate in the hotel bar which was lovely. We initially thought it was a bit expensive but it is on par with the rest of Rome. The staff in the bar are great fun, made us two females feel at ease and helped us out with a few Italian phrases. On the Saturday morning we were woken quite early by what sounded like dustbin lorries emptying their loads but we were at the back of the hotel and we had the window ajar. We ordered room service on the Sunday morning and despite the size of the hotel it came straight away. The hotel is quite far from the centre and you can't walk to the metro as there is no footpath (not one we could find anyway) so the hotel put on a free shuttle bus which drops you right in the centre. The only problem was that it wasn't frequent enough - in the morning it was either 9.30 or 11.00 so we were either rushing or hanging around! But that is a minor point on what has been a great break at an impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal”
Reviews.Author: ilovedgreece
Reviews.Content: Writing a review on this hotel is difficult because there are quite a few pro's and cons. I got a phenominal deal for this hotel on Travel Zoo (I think it was something like $90 CAD/night and it included so many extras) Some of the extras were free shuttle service into town, free breakfast, free internet, 10% off of hotel food and I think free shuttle service to the airport. The main downfall of this place was it's location. It was not close at all to "downtown" Rome i.e the Colloseum, the Spanish Steps etc. BUT they had a shuttle service that took care of getting you to and from the main part of town. Once you got to the one drop off point, you had to find your way to the tourist attractions. My mom and I got one of those hop-on/hop-off bus packages (I do not recommend the green one that we took as their weekend scheduled altered dramatically). The downfall of this shuttle service was that it had scheduled times that it would pick up and drop off at- the night time you were lucky if you could get a spot on the bus and if you didn't, you would have to wait an hour plus to catch the next one. A suggestion would be to offer more times to take the shuttle, especially later in the evening. No tourist wants to hang around on a street corner at night in Rome waiting for a bus and the cabs are not cheap! The room itself was probably the smallest we encountered in Italy but it was still very nice as was the bathroom. I think the highlight of this place was it's pool and the poolside bar. It was beautiful and a fun place to hang out at night. Not too sure what to say about the food- food is very important to my mother and I and because this place literally does not have any restaurants or bars by it in the area, you relay entirely on their restaurants which are pricy and not that good. I remember some guy next to us getting a barely cooked hamburger, I got a club sandwich and it showed up with eggs and uncooked bacon on it and breakfast was just alright in the morning. I felt like it was trying to hard to cater to the "North American" crowd as the majority of the guests were business men. I would have preferred them sticking to traditional Italian meals and specialties. When in Rome right? All-in all my reviews are mixed- if you don't get an amazing deal, I would suggest picking something closer to the main hussle and bussle. If you are just in town for one night, this hotel is sufficient and closer to the airport. It also has a pool which is great for those hot Italian summers! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Functional and clean”
Reviews.Author: aitenshi
Reviews.Content: Positives: Airport pick up Allowed early check in (8am in my case with no extra charge) Very clean hotel room Free internet with computer terminals (I did not bring my laptop so this service was useful) Execellent selection on breakfast buffet Free shuttle bus on return trip from the city Negatives: A little far out from city centre about 20mins but has shuttle buses running. Shuttle bus to city is not free but it's free to use upon return from city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: coldsteel2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while doing some business for the US. It's about a twenty minute ride from the airport and about 15 minutes from the city center. The rooms are typical european. The bed was firm but comfortable. Breakfast was included in the rate and consisted of eggs, bacon, lots of bread and pastries. I ate breakfast just after checking in and was in a hurry to eat and grab some sleep. I made the mistake of not leaving a tip (I wasn't aware of Roman customary 10% for dining). I definitely knew it the next day when I couldn't get a single server to wait on me. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: anand_biyani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Roma for two nights (11 & 12 Dec) on my honeymoon. It all went well except for the night when there were two cockroaches in the room. My wife got terrified and refused to sleep. The management didn't have any insect spray or anything but offered us another room to sleep. My wife couldn't sleep the entire night. It was a bad start to my honeymoon. The hotel is far away from the city centre, though the hotel had bus services every 90 minutes. Having stayed in Sheraton and other hotels before, I do not think it is worth the money, especially if you have to live with cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “Old but good value”
Reviews.Author: Panda998
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 20 mins from the city, but they got regular shuttle bus going to the city every 1.5 hours. There was a problem upon our arrival at the Rome railway station, lots of taxi drivers at the taxi stand was asking you to take their taxi, at a very high rate, being a first time visitor to this city, we are not sure to take them or not, eventually, I called the hotel concierge and who suggested me to wait for ordinary taxi there. The check in was one of the worst I had ever experienced. Although the staffs are nice, I waited for half an hour before I managed to check in and get into my room. The hotel room is old, in fact, a bit worn out, however, bed is clean and comfortable. After all, the rate is great that I would still recommend you to stay. One thing very good is their ”Save Resource Program”, as long as you hang the tag outside the door, they will not clean and change the bedding for you the day, in return, we earn ourselves either 500 SPG points or a e5 voucher, and also save their resources as well as helping the environment. I think that this is a very good program that other hotel should follow.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure nice touch”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneRI
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for a conference he attended nearby. Myself & 8 year old daughter also stayed for 1 week. The rooms are clean and neat. The breakfast is huge, fresh croissants, fruit, coffee, etc. The waiters were nice and approachable. Shuttle bus and airport bus from hotel are a great deal. 3/5 Euro. The Metro is a 10 minute walk, and busstop is right in front of the hotel. You can get everywhere on the Metro. You have to be a little travel savy and bring your map. We always felt safe by ourselves. The price is right compared to other hotels. Lounge is fun, music Friday nights & nice staff. I would recommend if you think you can get around using transport. After all, this is Rome! Once you get there, you can walk around easily.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Reception Staff-Far from city center”
Reviews.Author: bernlil
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Rome.The hotel is far from city center.The nearest metro station is 8 minutes walk from hotel.The hotel reception staff is rude.They are always in a hurry.The berakfeast is really very ordinary.The rooms have been decorated before,so the hotel has to be renovated.I think most rooms have not carpets so I have to heard the footsteps of the landlady at 7:00.The rooms are well cleaned but furniture are old.Also the beds are comfortable.But the hotel has to renovate its rooms and reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “last night in italy”
Reviews.Author: brownfootedboobie
Reviews.Content: based on most sheratons i have stayed in i would say it is average .compared to the other 5hotels i stayed at in italy, i would give it my highest approval.nice comfortable room and shower. thank god a comfortable bed with believe it or not a boxspring.i couldnt even here the people in the other rooms.actually had a pool and fitness area.breakfast was good.if all the hotels had been like this i would have enjoyed the trip a lot more since i would have been awake.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a week. Booked it before...”
Reviews.Author: Paddyw17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Booked it before viewing trip advisor and was disappointed by the reviews. However it was too late to cancel so we stayed anyway. Let me say that the bad reviews were not founded in truth. This hotel was clean and well laid out, with fantastically friendly and very helpful staff. The pool and sports facilities were superb. Yes, the location is a bit out of the way but the shuttle buses ran frequently and were never too busy to get a seat, and this was in june/ july. Add all this with a cheap price (which includes the best and most varied breakfast buffet I have ever experienced) and you are in for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Defined”
Reviews.Author: dorielsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Roma for four nights for their "Sweet Sleeper" bed, which was heavenly, however it was the full breakfast in the mornings that was the highlight of our stay. Breakfast at the Sheraton Roma was quite an event not to be missed, with cooked to order eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, potatoes, fresh cut fruits and even cooked veggies, fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh baked rolls and fresh coffee. The service was flawless and even though the hotel was not in the center of Rome, the hotel shuttle and short walk to the Metro were very convenient. Their shuttle picked us up at the airport and took us to the hotel for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: NZJaneAuckland
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in every respect. Absolute bargain through Wotif Europe - mystery hotel. Out of city centre but regular bus service throughout day into city and return - 3 Euro! Metro 5 minutes away as well and very cheap. Fabulous room and facilities though no coffee or tea available in room. Excellent service from reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel friendly staff lovely pool area”
Reviews.Author: aliknight1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights,lovely comfortable room overlooking pool .The breakfasts were great plenty of choice in spacious dining room Hotel a fair distance from city centre but good bus service.After a days sightseeing,the pool was very welcome for a refreshing dip drink & snacks.Staff very polite,waiters Fabrezio and Simone served us very well indeed! ps there is a tiny grey kitten in the garden near the pool he appears to be on his own so if you stay at this hotel please feed him!! Thankyou to all for a pleasant stay Ali & Chris Bournemouth

Reviews.Title: “Great value for our group, u must be o.k. with shuttlebus/taxi/public trans into Rome itself”
Reviews.Author: travel_is_gr8
Reviews.Content: This location worked perfectly for our group, because group members were coming into Rome on different flights/airlines/times/days. Early arrivers easily picked up the hotel shuttle from the FCO Rome airport for I believe 5Euro and thus got to the hotel easily on their own. One group member sat at the pool all day and relaxed. Each member was able to use points to stay here, so the focus was saving money vs. being "right" in Rome. (the sheraton in rome is many, many more points, understandably) We were also able to call in advance and get adjoining rooms on the same floor. The first day we had a little confusion about the hotel shuttle (its a large bus, actually) to Rome (schedule at the conceirge desk) we knew we had to pay 3 EURO, but didn't realize at first that we had to pay the concierge, get a paper receipt, and give that paper receipt to the driver. Check the schedule when you get there,: TO TOWN: 8.30 9:00 9.30 10.00 11.00 12.30 14.00 15.30 17.00 18.30 20.00 21.30 23.00. FROM ROME back to hotel 8.30 9:30 10.00 10.30 11.30 13.00 14.30 16.00 17.30 19.00 20.30 22.00 22.30 23.15 23.30. This did not happen to us, but other guests warned us if you wait for the last bus back to the hotel at night, you can risk the bus filling up, and then you have to take a taxi back on your own. Their advice was take the 10 or 10:30 back to the hotel to factor in a full bus. (again, this did not happen to us) BE PROMPT the bus does not wait around, it is in and out quickly. TIP: Address for Pickup/Drop off Shuttle to/from Rome is: Via del Teatro Marchello (use google maps street view) to look at this area, to become familiar. Especially after a glass of wine/in the dark.Landmark close by is the (huge) Victor Emmanuel monument…you walk up from the drop off point, kinda on the right side of it http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monument_to_Vittorio_Emanuele_II Our group started our day with the "Rome from the Sky" elevator to its rooftop to enjoy a grand 360-degree view….and get a lay of the land. We did not have to wait to go up in the elevator, but did have to wait to go down. Some of our travel group (embarrasingly) overpacked, and the hotel conceirge was kind enough to keep bags in the bag room for them (gave them claim tickets) while we travelled on to other parts of italy, and eventually came back to this Sheraton location. - Safes in room were easy to use. - One group member that arrived a day early, said the continental breakfast and regular breakfast were 20 - 30 euros (not included in our package) Needless to say they went into town to eat. - A group member reported that internet in your room had a charge, but if travelling with your computer, in the lobby it would be free wireless. - A group of 5 took a taxi with lots of luggage to the Termini main train station. it was 40 euros for all the people and baggage charges - Another day, 2 people took a taxi from Rome Termini taxi sign area to this hotel, We bargained for 25 euros vs. other unmarked young taxi drivers were trying to say 50e. The younger men were aggressive and would take hold of your rolling luggage, and start rolling toward their car, we just yanked it away, and found an older calmer taxi driver. The subway was only 1 euro per person, but since one person had a ton of luggage, so we did not think a 10 minute walk to the actual hotel off the metro was wise, just to try to save $. I was glad we took the taxi, especially b/c who knew if the subway station had stairs only (likely so). Last tip someone else wrote: be sure to turn down your AC at night, i woke up freezing :) and hauled out the extra blanket. Also review the light controls...weren't easy to navigate once in the dark. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJMAMAT
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the last 8 nights. Hotel is pleasant with a nice outdoor swimming pool. The Spa area offers good massage too. I recommend the Shiatsu. Hotel is far from city centre but there is a useful euros shuttle service and taxi should cost no more than 15 euro one way.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but too far from centre”
Reviews.Author: penny097
Reviews.Content: we went for 4 nights on a special offer, so value was excellent. We couldn't fault the hotel,the breakfast was excellent and enough to keep you going until the evening! We had one meal in the bar which was a little disappointing and pricey. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room, which was a "superior" was clean and comfortable. The shuttle bus to and from the airport was very helpful, although we had a long wait as they dont run over lunch time. There is also a shuttle into town, which you need as its so far out, which is bookable going into town, but not for the return journey, which is what ruins it. The later buses returning to the hotel are full and there's an undignified scrabble to get onto the bus, with a lot of pushing and shoving! We found it much easier to use the local buses to get back, although the journey was much longer and the drop off point a bit grim!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but p”
Reviews.Author: rd4boy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adequate, but not at all memorable. The whole complex is slightly dated including the standard room I had. The pool complex is nice. The principal drawbacks of the hotel have been well discussed in other reviews: (1) location is far from ideal for tourist activities or eating out, and (2) the prices, especially for drinks, were close to unbelievable (8 Euro for a draft beer in a plastic cup is just not OK). I would not choose to stay here again, and the only reason for doing so is if you are at a conference there or business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fhs02
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel, I would visit again. Nice rooms, nice beds, most of the time a really nice staff and great facilities, a shame it was impossible to get a sunbed and it was a bit annoying having to wait for a table at breakfast in a line 4 mornings, but besides that it was a really nice stay. The busshuttle to the citycenter was okay - it stops in a very central place, but one night we waited for 1,5 hour, because a bus never came and the drivers are not especialle friendly. We prefered taking a taxi ;).

Reviews.Title: “Functional, anonymous but location not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: wirralitalytrip
Reviews.Content: We found a good deal for our stay here - the rooms were comfortable (esp the beds). Efficient shuttle service into city and to airport. Breakfast excellent as was the swimming pool - with space/chairs available.
