Our main issue was the cost of the drinks/food at the hotel coupled with the fact that the location of the hotel is such that its not easy to walk anywhere as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: susanchadda
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to get to city use hotel shuttle bus, staff friendly breakfast was good value for money hotel clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value some surprises.”
Reviews.Author: Mike71Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Good rate for a Sheraton.but on arrival found dozens of fellow guest were young teenagers on school trips. Panic. However they were out of the hotel most of the time leaving the large pool free for those adults who were not traipsing around daytime rome at 90F. The poolside food and service was very good and good value. Well done team. One niggle, I had booked a club room in advance but learned on arrival, area was closed for upgrading. They had sent me a text 2 days earlier, but I was travelling and missed it. And how long ahead had the management planned to close the club area. Poor show. Restaurant recommendations from the staff were not too well informed. Try TA contributions. I would return to this hotel but outside of school holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: carpetking5432
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel to stay with friendly staff, but bear in mind that they are Italian and won't do things for you unless you ask. The hotel is about 20mins outside the city and they have a shuttle bus (cost 3euros) to take you into the city and ring you back shorter route of about 10mins however the return journey is a free for all and survival of the fitness first on first served so be prepared to push and barge your way on board. (this does need addressing) The room was a club room and of an acceptable standard downside no club lounge so queue at breakfast time the staff were Ok but won't go out your way to help you unless you ask. Food was OK and plentiful if your got there early enough (prior to 9am) Pool was large but pool area small and not enough seats so ended up bathing on the grass at the back. The gym was of a good standard with modern equipment. Would I recommend it yes. Would it be my first choice not necessarily The hotel is undergoing a large amount of modernisation that was ongoing during stay but it didn't impact that much Bar food good

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid room was charged to us again at end of our stay there...”
Reviews.Author: goofy73
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, cool and quite quiet. View was of tents, trucks and the other hotel roof at the back of hotel. Hotel bus did not stop at E.U.R. district every time so we waited to be picked up by hotel bus in vain - had to use Metro instead. Thought that breakfast was included in room rate but found out it was not included for us! Make sure the hotel does not try to charge you for hotel room twice!!

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed-Not up to Starwood standards”
Reviews.Author: canalskater
Reviews.Content: We are in day 2 of a four day stay and wish we had booked elsewhere. Pros: Price is good, got a deal for €79 including breakfast and free shuttle, which is otherwise €3. Room is reasonably clean, and has good AC. There is a nice big pool but is impossible to get a chair. The concierge staff is really nice and helpful. Check-in was fast and efficient, and as an SPG Platinum member, we were upgraded to a suite. Cons: 1. Location: It is in the middle of nowwhere...have to take a 30 min shuttle into down which is not frequent enough amd does not have enough capacity. Last night, we came back from downtonw on the 10 pm bus, and half of the people were not allowed on. There was no lineup procedure, and it was a free for all as everone pushed their way on. Then we had to wait as they seperated families as they would not let people stand, or share seats. The early morning driver, Nazeroni , is extremely rude and unhelpful. He refused to tell me and other people when the shuttle returned to the hotel. 2. The hotel needs updating. The security lock on my door was broken and it took 3 calls and a trip to the front desk to get it repaired. My teenage son got stuck in the bathroom because the door didnt work properly. The hotels response was "dont close the door all the way". The pullout sofa broke as soon as I layed on it. I am staying in the club suite, which I imagine is the best room in the whole hotel. I would hate to think what it is like in the other rooms. 3. The club lounge is closed for the month of August, with no advance warning. I chose this hotel because we would get club benefits (free food and drinks throughout the day). As a "replacement" the hotel gives one drink coupon per day. When I raised this with the manager, his response "was you were lucky to even get the drink coupon as w edont have to do anything when the lounge is closed." 4. Breakfast is very poor. There is a big selection, howver it is very hit and miss. They dont replenish food very often, ran out of fruit and the hot food was inedible (extremely undercooked eggs and bacon). I stay at a lot of Starwood properties, and by far this is the worst I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel - exceeded our expectations in many ways”
Reviews.Author: MorrisChronicler
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is a little far from the city center, but as a tradeoff, you get larger, more comfortable rooms than you would find in much more expensive hotels in central Rome. The hotel also has a beautiful pool area which we enjoyed immensely after a long day of touring the hot city (only complaint is that it closes too early at 7:30PM); friends of ours stayed in a 5-star hotel downtown that had no such amenity. We took advantage of the large hotel shuttle bus to the city center; it runs every 90 minutes in each direction throughout the day and was very convenient and a bargain at 3 Euros per person roundtrip. Shuttle bus to Fiumicino Airport was also very convenient and inexpensive compared to a taxi. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, staff was courteous (although bell captain was a bit gruff) and the very nice Club Lounge for Starwood members is open until 11PM every day. Overall, my family and I enjoyed staying at this hotel and I would recommend it as long as you are aware upfront that you won't have the tourist sites right outside your doorstep and some planning is required to get to them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Andrea63
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel and caters to a number of tour groups. The rooms are spacious and clean.The front desk staff are not very friendly but the servers in the restaurant (poolside and inside) are very efficient and quick to provide service. The best service was provided by the house keepers and room service folks. Room service was quick (15 mins. or less) and the rooms are cleaned very well with fresh towels and toiletries provided every day. The hotel is located about 20 minutes from downtown but the hotel shuttle to downtown (cost 3 euros RT) and the airport shuttle ( 6 euros) was great.The shuttle drops us at Piazza Venezia and can easily walk to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Capitol Monument, etc. The hop on hop hop off bus is right by the shuttle bus stop.There is also a bus stop right infront of the hotel that goes to the Vatican. There is free internet and use of computers in the lobby but was always packed. I wish the hotel would provide some guidelines or monitor the length of time guests use the computers. Have to wait in line to print boarding pass because of children (ages 8-12) playing games on the computer or others checking Facebook, etc. There is live music in the poolside restaurant which was wonderful to listen to and unwind after a long day of sightseeing. My husband enjoyed using the fitness center. It has ample towels and machines to use to work out. So far, the best one in any Starwood hotels in Europe.Stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and overall had a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quiet Hotel. Good Staff!”
Reviews.Author: alwayssuperstylin
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Club Room by the very efficient and friendly Reception staff. The rooms are very clean and cosy. The breakfast spread is absolutely great, we loaded on breakfast before we set out for the day. Rooms are well appointed and very clean. My only complaint is that the concierge didn’t want to help us establish contact with one of our tour operators. When I told the reception of this, they promptly helped me out and made all the arrangements for us. The hotel is located in between the airport central Rome the city. It takes around 20-25 minutes to get to the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “worst stay”
Reviews.Author: sanjayabudhabi
Reviews.Content: very far from the city centre ,staff too arrogant ,airconditioning does not work and the rooms smell ,even the housekeeping is very bad not at all recommended for people with young children ,buffet was fine but they close exactly at 10am and even if few minutes late they dont allow you in for the price you can always get something better

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel but it's a little ways from the city center”
Reviews.Author: onegaucho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip b/c it was recommended by my company. I brought my wife and 6 month old baby along as well. Definitely ask ahead if you need a crib - we just used the other double bed for our baby - and ask to be placed in the "quieter" part of the hotel. As the other reviews state, it's a little far from the city center but we managed just fine. The metro is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel - and not the safest with a baby in a stroller - but we managed. The metro is only about 15 minutes from the first major stop (Colesseum). A taxi into the city from here will probably run you at least 10-20 euros. The breakfast buffet was good. It doesn't change every morning but it was included with our rate so we definitely took advantage of it. Not quite "local" cuisine, but then again, it's a simple way to grab a bite before heading into town for sightseeing. Staff was very friendly for the most part and we didn't have any issues with our room. Sure, it's a little dated and the wallpaper was cracked in places but it was still a very decent room - especially if you're there for business. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it if you're there for a romantic getaway though. Also, the shuttle from the airport only runs every hour or so, so we took a cab to the hotel (40 euros, yikes!). There's also a free shuttle from the hotel to the Capitol Hill so that's a good option as well. Without traffic, it's only a 20 minute ride. And if you want to take the shuttle back to the airport, make sure you let them know before you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a mixed bag really - you can do better”
Reviews.Author: Chilldoubt
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay for a long weekend in Rome mainly because we wanted somewhere with a pool - perhaps not the most important thing, with hindsight. It's a fair way out of Rome, about 20 minute drive. There is a shuttle bus for 3 euros (return is free) provided by the hotel but a) It does get booked up for busy times (e.g. During mornings at weekends - probably the most likely time you'll need it) and b) It's really not that frequent or convenient - it drops you at a non descript street a fair walk from the nearest tourist attraction, taxi rank or metro station. About 25% of the rooms at this hotel will have a serious noise problem - a quarter of the cross-shaped hotel faces the "Gay Village" which is a sort of permanant festival/nightclub thing 400 yards away. It get seriously loud with booming bass music at about 10:30pm and just gets louder and louder from that point. We spoke to the Sheraton about this and apparantly there's nothing they can do. Eventually we had to demand a room change at about 1am on the second night - the noise is pretty ridiculous. The front desk were fine about it, surprisingly, but it's not nice to have to drag yourself out of bed at that time and pack all your things. The second room, facing the other side was fine - but about a quarter of all rooms would be affected. Do you feel lucky? The concierge staff were on the whole quite abrupt and a little rude when we spoke to them on several occasions. It's not a job I'd enjoy and clearly they don't either, but since they did at some point fill out an application form for it, they could at least smile or be courteous - I'd like to think it's not a typical Italian characteristic. Food was so-so. Pool is a bit dated and the few sunbeds are taken quite early in the mornings - best of luck! Overall the hotel is dated and maintained to just about a reasonable standard - they're not investing too much into it anyway. Shower was great but all the fittings were old, falling apart and grubby. Didn't feel very clean. We were in a Club Room, which you'd expect a little more from. There's a Club Lounge with free internet if you can get on one of the two terminals. Free soft drinks and wine, but nothing to write home about and when they do bring any hot food to it, it's feeding time at the zoo. Another gripe was being sent by staff at the completely empty front desk, bup to the Club Floor to check-in. When I got there, there was a big queue. Stupid system. Overall it was okay - only major complaint was the noise. They let us have a 4pm check-out for which I'm giving them big credit. And they let us move from the noisy room. But next time I'd stay closer to Rome - the local metro station is a horrible walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A typical conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tipoukoitos
Reviews.Content: Booked there for 2 nights for a conference. Shuttle service to the hotel offered opposite terminal T3 of FCO, running every hour and a half. Cost is 5euro charged on the room bill. Excellent conferencing facilities offered. Rooms - well I should say that they need some maintenance work. You'll see scratched furniture and fixings, some rust on bath, stains on carpets. They should really invest in that. Tried the restaurant. Nothing particularly fancy to write home about and somewhat overpriced. On the whole the rooms are close to 3+ star, but the conference facilities are tops. I would not recommend this hotel to a tourist. It is 30' by taxi to the center of rome, a fare which typically costs 20 euros one way + taxi call. I did not use public transport, although I know that 1 bus stop away there was the Magliana metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: titaniumair
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times and always had a pleasurable experience. The shuttle bus to/from the airport (5 euro) is great and far cheaper than a taxi. The hotel is about a 20-25 minute bus ride from the center of the city. We usually take the metro into the city and take the bus back to the hotel. The bus is free from the city but costs 3 euro if you take it into the city. Don't pay attention to some of the reviews on here about the metro being too far and/or a dangerous walk.....ridiculous! We've timed ourselves and it takes about 7-10 minutes depending on your energy level. It's an easy walk. The hotel location just outside of the city makes it a nice place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. It's pretty quiet and the facilities are fairly nice. Free internet in the lobby on the hotel computers. Rooms are decent...not as nice as many of the Sheraton rooms in the states but nicer than many rooms in Europe. The Starwood Preferred floors are a little nicer with upgraded furnishings. All in all, it's a pretty nice place to stay especially given that the rates are usually much cheaper relative to a city center hotel of comparable quality.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: deirdrew
Reviews.Content: Hotel roma short distance (20 min courtesy bus) to city centre ,very comfortable rooms .No balconies ,got upgraded to a superior room with access to the club lounge fabolus outdoor swimming pool . Taxis a rip off but need a taxi to get to the centre where resturants etc located agree a price before taking the short journey. staff not over friendly but courtesy. sheraton roma shuttle to and from airport 5 euro each way

Reviews.Title: “ok for transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda9319
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night enroute to cruise that departed from Citavecchia. The hotel is okay, and offers free internet service which is a nice perk. The swimming pool and spa were closed and the hotel focus is on business meetings with many corporate types coming and going. We had a pleasant dinner at the buffet and all in all the property served it's purpose for our needs. It is about a half hour by taxi to get into town and about 45 min. by cab to get to the airport. The hotel is not big on atmosphere but is more than adequate for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast buffet, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Poodle16
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is not close to anything, it seems. The taxi from the airport was $40 euros. However, the rooms were very clean and beds comfortable. Get the rate with breakfast included- well worth the extra money. Vast array of choices from pastries to eggs, tea to expresso and beyond. Take the concierge's recommendation for dinner at this little pizza restaurant. We shared 2 margerita pizzas between 4 people and it was plenty. Try the lemoncillo as an after dinner liqueor.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in August”
Reviews.Author: gypsyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for visit to Rome with my thirteen year old son. Pool was large and a life saver after full days of sightseeing in the heat. Breakfast buffet was fabulous. We booked the concierge level to have access to snacks- not worth it for the food. They did however upgrade our room when they originally gave us a standard double. Big plus was the bus to city center although it did not run frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Like being back in the USA”
Reviews.Author: karw
Reviews.Content: After 10 days of mostly local hotels with no amenities such as ice buckets, tissues, thick towels, it was a reminder of home in the U.S.. Guess we are spoiled but this was a great way to end of trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SMarshall_001
Reviews.Content: Considering how expensive everything in Rome is, if you want a very nice hotel without paying an arm and a leg, this is the perfect choice. It is not located in the touristy part of Rome, but then again you will get more for your money by being a little further from the hectic parts of ancient Rome. Transportation is not a problem: scheduled shuttle buses (not free but inexpensive, 3 euros for a return ticket) leave for downtown and return to the hotel every hour and a half starting at 8 AM and last one returns at 10:30 PM or so. Also, bus and metro service are handy- you can easily walk to the bus stop, and the metro stop is a 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel will arrange a shuttle but to take you to the airport if needed for maybe 5 euros- a steal considering taxis are unbelievably expensive and charge per km, per minute, and per bag. The hotel rooms are large, clean, beds comfy, hotel location quiet. The AC works 24 hours a day, year round (some hotels AC do not run 24 hours a day and only certain times of the year). Breakfast is a large variety of hot and cold foods, drinks, a lovely buffet to start out your day. If I ever have the pleasure to return to Rome, I will definitely stay here and highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accomodation & price for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NicolaJA
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Roma does offer a bus service (€5.00 one way) to and from Fiumicino airport (30-45 mins) - but watch out, the last one from the airport to the hotel leaves 10:45 and the next one is not until 14:15. This isn't made clear on the web site or until you get to the hotel and pick up a timetable. If you do get stuck - buy train tickets from Tabac kiosk in the airport - saves queuing in station - you need a train ticket for the 'Leonardo Express' (€14) to Roma Termini (there are no stops inbetween it will take you straight there) and one Metro ticket (€1) for Line B - EUR Magliana. From Metro station it is a 10 minute walk to hotel (if you have heavy luggage get a taxi - check directions on map before you arrive or use your iphone). You are right in the heart of Mussolini's EUR creation - admire or disapprove!!!! The hotel is defintely more focused on business travellers, so staff are functional rather than fussy - also I think this is the Roman way! When checked in there were a couple of minor glitches to sort out and I was less than impressed by the phone ringing out both for the reception and room service. However, having laughed that off, we booked ourselves onto the Hotel's city bus service (€3.00 into town, no fee coming back). The bus service was very handy and was always on time. From the drop off point you can walk (5-7 mins) into Trastevere (recommended) which is very picturesque and has some great restaurants. Also Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palantino are walkable from drop off point. The Metro goes round the centre of Rome so take this when you want to go to Vatican City & Spanish Steps. Metro is very cheap - €1 for each journey, check Metro tickets types on machines in station and buy best option depending on your agenda. Overall I would say Sheraton Roma is a good base for a reasonable price (we just had a standard room) - it was not a noisy hotel and we slept well. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. It has a pleasant bar and lounge area. Cost of food in Hotel is shocking due to exchange rate and of course Rome is one of the most expensive cities in Europe. We had a great time - just be prepared to do lots of walking, there is a something to see around every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Miles from anywhere but busy, busy, busy”
Reviews.Author: Paradise_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at the hotel. The hotel was very busy. Pretty standard business hotel with small but effective free Internet area and good gym. Rooms are standard US hotel type. My room was perfectly OK. The gym was also well provided with cardio and weight machines. Service in the hotel is pretty much non-existent. Unfortunately, there is nothing around the hotel. My colleague and I walked to the metro station to get into the city, which was problematic for the first time (get a printout from Google maps before you go) but then very straightforward. We came back late at night on several evenings and the walk back is relatively safe, if a little dark. We did not have a breakfast rate so went to the coffee shop at the metro station for a typical local breakfast. Cappucino and chocolate croissant for two euros. What a deal. The metro also goes out to the sea for Ostia Antica -- highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza_Turkey
Reviews.Content: There was a promotion at Sheraton Cesme, Turkey, as a result we got a free holiday of 2 nights at Sheraton, Rome, Italy including airline tickets with Allitalia. We didn't need to think which hotel to stay in when we were in Rome. The shuttle bus from the hotel was good. We arrived early at the hotel, so they couldn't give us a room at the time of arrival, which wasn't their fault. The hotel room was OK for us, enough space, very very comfortable bed, nice bathroom with a tube. Only when we entered the room I felt some sort of smell, seemed to come from the carpets, which didn't bother me after wards. We had breakfast at the hotel which was included in our package, and it wasn't as good as the breakfast you can have at a hotel like Sheraton in Turkey, but there was almost everything you need for a breakfast. The distance from the city might be a problem for some people, because if you prefer to take the bus, which passes through the street just in front of the hotel it takes almost 45 minutes. And if you want to take the metro, which takes less, but you need to walk like 15 minutes, and I don't know how that sounds if you come back at night, because we always got tired of walking around the city and came back to rest before it was dark. If you get a good deal at this hotel I would recommend you to take it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovating; Not close to Public Transport; Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Putting aside that the building seems like it is right out of the 1970s or early 1980s, this is not a hotel I would have chosen to stay at on my own (I was here for a conference that was held here). In hindsight, I would have booked a nice hotel in the central part of Rome and taken the metro out to the closest station (EUR Magliana) which is about a kilometer away by walking on back streets to the hotel. The rooms are more on the traditional side, and they could use some updating/modernization. They still have old style bulky TVs - not flat ones. Come on guys, in this day an age even cheaper hotels have flat LCD TVs. Bathrooms are tiny. I was on the Club Level - nothing better in terms of amenities that I could tell. Cheap thin towels in the bath. No Air conditioning at this time of year - the hotel turns off the central AC system and does not start it up until Summer, even though it was warm and humid here in April. Club Level lounge had an ok breakfast and evening food assortment. Fitness center is fairly well stocked as well. PROS: decent light food and drinks in Club Level lounge. Good fitness center. WiFi is 12 Euro a day which is cheaper than other hotels (although it should also be free). CONS: Inconvenient public transport. Small bathrooms. No Air Conditioning except in summer. Outdated building and room style. Outdated TVs. SMALL in room safe - cannot fit small laptops even. I think there are better options for your stay in Rome - especially if you are here for a vacation. For a conference at this hotel, I would still recommend you commute from a downtown nicer hotel. This was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “fine for what i paid”
Reviews.Author: douai86
Reviews.Content: fair hotel in a poor location. Our room was disappointing - smelled very damp, wet patch on carpet. they told us the AC was leaking but it could not be fixed and we could not move room. found reception staff quite unhelpful the hotel itself is fine - breakfasts are good, public areas pleasant, lovely pool. serious lack of sunloungers!!! restaurant quite expensive. the hotel bus into rome is a must for tourists, cheap and fairly regular but beware - it gets very full in the evening and you risk being stuck in the city!!! you're quite restricted by the location of this hotel and we found that because of the heat we couldn't spend as much time exploring as we would have if we'd had a city centre hotel which we could just pop back to. Also be careful when wandering around outside grounds as we came upon used needles - flipflops and walking in dark = no no. we got a good deal so it was fine for what we paid but not the usual sheraton standard.

Reviews.Title: “I love it (comfartable beds and excellent breakfast and peaceful)”
Reviews.Author: tacozgur519
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed 4 nights. after an exhaustive day sleep at sheraton bed is perfect. the hotel is out side of Rome but nearest metro statıon is 7-8 minutes by walk. by metro you can see all of the famous sightseeing places of Rome. after a quıet and peaceful night, thr breakfast was beautiful. fruıts are so delicious. capuccıno is tasty. wifi and sheraton link place are helpful. we took our Vatican tickets from Vatican internet site and not waited for line. the museum was wonderful. thanks for sheraton ROME.

Reviews.Title: “Fair, but not up to the Sheraton usual standard”
Reviews.Author: vituzzo
Reviews.Content: I sspent one night at the Sheraton in Rome. The staff at Reception was prompt and efficient, the room was fine while the bath room left something to be desidered. Quite old fixtures, a little worn out, for sure not up to other Sheratons in Europe. One major problem was the lack of of free parking space in an hotel located outside the City of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not bad hotel - not good location”
Reviews.Author: Kestral120
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just OK. But not for the price. The service was poor. You can see that the staff was either over worked or some of the wait staff just did not care. The rooms were clean, but small. Again for the price you paid - not worth it. The food in the restaurant was good. The main downside of the restaurant was the location. Quite out of town - hard to get to by public transport. About E15 by cab into town. E30 from the airport. The plus side, the ferry bus service to and from town was a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you require”
Reviews.Author: forestforever1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 3 nights. I booked this hotel having researched the area and previous reviews and of course the price. I paid approx £80GBP per night for a standard room including breakfast which is a very good price for the Rome vicinity. The breakfast was the usual European selection although not too sure about the broccoli and cauliflower for breakfast which looked as if it was pre heated left over food from the previous night buffet. The other cooked food looked like food poisoning on a plate so opted for some toast, fruit and pastries. The hotel is about 6km out of the centre. There is a shuttle bus which is 3 euro per person (beats taxi price). This drops you off to the south of the city and picks you up at the same place. As the service is limited you might find getting back on a popular service a problem and having to get a taxi. The walk from the stop is approx 15 minutes to the Colosseum and further to other sights. The service at the hotel as is luke warm at best. Concierge is... putting it politely a bit sketchy, they don't really seem to care but if you do your own research this shouldn't be a problem for you. The reception staff are mostly overworked and don't actually care about you as a guest. Having spent a lot of time in Italy this is not uncommon in cheaper properties and just accept this as the way Italy sometimes is (for the price). If I was paying £150 - £200 per night I would be annoyed but I feel I got what I paid for. The rooms at the hotel are clean and a good size, the beds are extremely comfortable, especially after a long day walking around the city. Food and snacks are expensive but as out in Rome all day you shouldn't really need to use this service. There are many great restaurants in Rome that you will enjoy so much more. In conclusion, this hotel is a perfectly good hotel for the price. Don't stay there with high expectations of service or a luxury hotel. You pay the cheap price and you get what you pay for. This is good value if you plan your trip and don't mind a bit of inconvenience in terms of getting into Rome. If you want a great hotel in the centre of Rome expect to pay over double their rate and get the better service and more intimate hotel if not just visit Rome and sleep here. At the end of the day Rome is an amazing city so spend your time there enjoying all it has to offer and go back the Sheraton for a comfy nights sleep ready for the next day!

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: world73
Reviews.Content: Generally good. Not much shops nearby though. Nearest shopping is about 25 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel, but too far from the main sights”
Reviews.Author: stylesjsp
Reviews.Content: Where to start with this hotel..... Pros: 1) Clean room. 2) Reception are friendly and helpful. 3) Cleaners are nice. Cons: 1) The hotel is close to the airport but in the middle of no where, with nothing around. 2) Don't be fooled by the allure of the shuttle bus to the city centre, as it actually dumps you no where near, meaning you either have to walk miles or get a taxi, which is fine in the day when you are travelling to the sights as walking around can be pleasant (if you like that kind of thing), but not very good when you want to go back out in the evening. 3) You don't need a ticket to get back on the shuttle bus to the hotel, but as there is mostly only one an hour you virtually have to fight for a seat as all the other hotel occupants are waiting for the same bus and won't hestiate to literally push and barge you out of the way to get on! 4) Sometimes the bus gets cancelled without notice or leaves earlier than scheduled (which happened to us and you don't get your money back), so you either have to wait for another hour or spend money on a taxi which can be expensive. 4) There is only one restaurant (and one bar which sells snacks) in the hotel, which given the location means you find yourself there of an evening and the food is extremely overpriced, service is slow and the waiters border on rude. If you are staying for business then it is probably fine, but it is definitely not suitable for leisure trips. Although it is quite well priced, we stayed for 5 days and in one day (as the bus left 10mins early) we spent 85 euros on taxis and averaged between 30-50 euros every other day, so we could of used some of that money to pay a bit more for a hotel in the centre saving all that hassle and inevitably saving money on meals as food is much cheaper than in the hotel and you get a MUCH friendler service.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head while visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: SylviaQt
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a safe place to lay your head while you venture into the city and get to know Rome. The hotel has the feel of a convention hotel, and there is high traffic - people are coming and going at all hours. They have transportation to & from the city; a schedule is provided to you at check-in. There was a light missing that I noticed when I checked into my room. An engineer was sent up immediately to remedy the situation. Be aware that the hotel's lcoation is far from the city center. Be mindful of the shuttle service - a taxi is very expensive after hours! Give yourself ample time to get to your destination if relying on the public transportation. I noticed that the hotel would host activites at the hotel bar & restaurant. I myself didn't partake, but it's nice to have options if you didn't want to head into the city. The food in the restaurant was good. I was addicted to their "ciocolata calda". It was the best hot chocolate I have *ever* had. Thick, rich, foamy, creamy... liquid chocolate heaven!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Chezpupa
Reviews.Content: Ok Hotel, Small rooms, staff Ok. Location fine. It did the job for two days. Bathrooms needs a make over.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: atrevida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Roma for about 5 days for a conference last month, and found it to be a reasonable choice for Rome--the rooms were decently sized, meticulously cleaned each day (particularly the bathrooms), and comfortable, and the price was quite reasonable. The maids replaced the toiletries daily, even when they weren't completely consumed, and the quality of the toiletries was quite good--they even provided conditioner, which is often not the case for most hotels. The staff was universally quite friendly and helpful. They even included daily breakfast in the rate, and there was a fairly large selection of food, with a variety of cooked meats and eggs, pastries, yogurts, fruits, and juices. They have free internet in the lobby (I believe an hour per day per guest), which was convenient for printing boarding passes, etc. I also got the wifi service for my laptop--it was a standard Rome telecom service, and found some slowness with connecting at times, but no problems once connected to the network. The location is a bit far from most tourist sites, as the hotel lies on the southern outskirts of Rome, but the metro is not far away, and it takes about 10-15 minutes to get into the center of the city. The hotel also has a shuttle bus service to the city and to the airport--they run only at specifically scheduled times, and we ended up taking the metro or a taxi much of the time because this schedule was not convenient for us. Overall, a reasonably good hotel for conferences; if I was traveling for leisure, I might stay closer to the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Large corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newton978
Reviews.Content: Good for business conferences. I would not recommend for leisure as it is too far from any of the sights. There is a hotel bus and the Metro is nearby however. My main complaint is that the guest rooms are very hot, thermostats do not work and windows do not open (2 rooms tried)

Reviews.Title: “Very good price....”
Reviews.Author: OKUR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located out of the city, but hotel provides shuttle service to the city center and back every hour latest till 23:00 pm. İt takes 15 minutes to the center....Stuff was very friendly and hotel rooms are in good condition....

Reviews.Title: “Far from the sites but the price was good.”
Reviews.Author: 206jazz
Reviews.Content: What can I say, we used travel points and for $60/night nothing compares. It is far from the sights and restaurants but not too far. They have a hotel bus service (3 euros) that brings you into town and have regular pickups to get you back as late as 11:30 PM. There is a Metro stop within walking distance but the sidewalks are narrow getting there. It's one bus stop from the Metro Station if you come back after dark. The bus stops is in front of the hotel. There is a public bus that takes you to the Vatican too. There is a store off the lobby that sells daily bus/metro passes for 4 euros and once you figure out the bus stops in town you can get around quite easily without needing a cab. For most of the sites the Metro is a bit far so taking the bus saves on walking. The room is USA style and is much larger that the european hotels. There are free internet computers in the lobby along with a bar and restaurant. We never ate at the hotel as we planned to eat in town. The staff were nice and helpful. The hotel sells the ROMA Pass that includes 2 museum admissions and a 3 day public transportation pass. Although there is time savings with being located closer to the sightseeing and restaurants we seemed to do just fine using the hotel bus service or the Metro. Not being close you just can't make a pit stop back to the hotel between sightseeing. With jet lag we seemed to get out just before noon and returned by 10 PM in between doing lunch, sightseeing, dinner, sightseeing, and back using the Metro or the in town pickup hotel bus. The hotel bus back was free. Without convenient transportation I would have stayed in town but using points on this vacation made the choice as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “far from city, no restaurants around.”
Reviews.Author: vvnvvn
Reviews.Content: i was there for the last 2 days of my italy trip i travelled to rome from florence. there was no clear instruction on how to travel from rome city to the hotel( except for taxi) shuttle stop in the city does not have a sign at all and it is very far away from the train station and it is not any close to piaza venezia. it will be very hard to find the way to get to the shuttle stop if you havent traveled with the shuttle before. shuttle from hotel to city runs every hour and half and it has to be prepaid/booked. coz it could be full and you will have to wait for 1.5 hours for the next bus. shuttle bus from the city to hotel is free and its 1.5 hours wait for each bus. interent is free in the lobby but there are only a couple of coputers avaliable. room internet access is about 12 euro a day. required queen bed but 2 single bed was provided and the rooms are too full that you cant change it to a queen bed. 1 bottle of water is provided complementary for each guest but if you need hot water its 8 euro. the highlight for my stay is the buffet breakfast. the breakfast is 5 star hotel standard and it has a wide range of food to choose from. however you might have to go at the right time to avoid the queue and rush hours. and the door staff might reject your entry because your name or room number isnt on the list. while you actually paid for your breakfast when you book the hotel. last of all. when i did check out my name was totally wrong and address doenst make sense. it was a china address with australia in the end. so make sure you check your name and address are right.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: Standard Sheraton. Neither delighted or dissappointed. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Bizarre digital signature procedure on check in. Room very average, some broken furniture. Very good conference facilities and liberal smoking area outside the bar. Previous comments about location are about right, but in the summer you'll be pleased to be out the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a nights stay!!”
Reviews.Author: bestbaby1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night prior to our med cruise. We found the hotel to be clean and fine for a one night stay. We arrived early but the hotel accomodated us by checking us in early. We had a room on the first floor which was of ample size but possibly a little dated. I have heard that some of the other floors have been refurbished already. We found the gym to be updated with various pieces of equipment. It was very clean and there was a great water cooler by the entrance. The free internet in the lobby was great also. Transportation into Rome central was a little inconvenient. If staying in Rome for a few days I would recommend in town..but for one night the hotel was perfect and the pizza in the lounge was delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: BRSantos
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel amongst colleagues on a 3 days business trip to Rome. The location isn't the best, but there are free transfers/buses going to the center and to the airport, but If you are in a hurry, then you must use a taxi! The breakfast is a buffet with lots of choices, like fruits, juices, yogurts, etc. All included - very good. The rooms are good, too, with satellite tv and vault. The bathroom is also very nice. Everything was just shining and clean. 5*. Id' stay here again! Sheraton is always a Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel outside of the busy city center”
Reviews.Author: MissTarra
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Roma Hotel is beautiful, and should be for the price. We were upgraded to a deluxe room for our honeymoon, and the room was very nice and spotlessly clean (though smaller than I expected even for Europe). The staff was extremely helpful, and they even had sparkling wine waiting in our room each night we stayed, free of charge! The hotel is not close to any of Rome's site-seeing attractions. There is however a shuttle bus that goes to the city center (near the Colosseum) every 1.5 hours with a cost of 3 Euros. There is also an airport shuttle available for just 5 Euros (great deal). The restaurant in the hotel looked very nice, though we didn't actually eat lunch or dinner there. Prices were a bit high, which is expected in hotel restaurants. The breakfast was very good, but if it is not included in your room rate it is extremely expensive. Overall, a beautiful hotel with convenient shuttle service to the city center. We were very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Only the name says it's 5 star”
Reviews.Author: FernandoLisboa
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff, old furniture, nothing makes you feel like home... The bathroom was in poor shape, in the last night of my stay i even found water on the floor... they have a shuttle bus to city centre, for a fee of €3 per person. At one of the days, there were a demonstration in the city. So,they changed the bus stop,but forgot to let us know! Unreal. In the last day, the hotel let a bill information, saying they´ll process check-out during breakfast, almost pushing you out of the room...! Not all was bad, the buffet breakfast was very good, but this is too little for a 5 star hotel. If you go to Rome chose a hotel in the centre, we can access the all major attractions by foot. If you can chose one of the 5 star hotels at Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MOPS6
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere not to far from downtown Rome, at a sensible price, this is a good option. We found our rooms using hotwire and the $99+tax per night represented excellent value for money (for Rome). Advantages - good quality & value, shuttle service, metro close by Disadvantages - no "authentic" feeling of Rome, not within walking distance of decent restaurants & nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_tvl_agent
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd expect from a Sheraton. Shuttle service is great and if it doesn't run frequently enough, there are city buses outside the door, and the subway is a 10 minute walk. Hotel has free internet access in the lobby and rooms and bathrooms are comfortable and a good size. After a long flight or day of walking you'll be happy you have a Sheraton bed!

Reviews.Title: “The sort of hotel you want to return to after a heavy day sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: cymruambyth1
Reviews.Content: I last visited Rome in 1966 as part of a school party. I had always promised my wife we would go there and at last we had booked a special deal advertised by Travelzoo.com. Having booked the the trip I was concerned about reports on Trip advisor about the hotel that I had made a mistake. However my fears were not realised. While the hotel is outside the centre of rome there was an efficient shuttle service that was on time and the journey was in an air conditioned coach which was great as the temperature was 30c.There was also a metro station only a short walk away which although on a busy road did not concern us. The hotel was very good and our room was very clean and tidy so much so we did not ask for it to be cleaned everyday and took advantage of a 5euro voucher for not having it cleaned. The hotel staff were very helpful and able to make reccomendations. Although we had a room safe we were also able to have a safety deposit box. All the staff had sufficient english and many were fluent. They were also patient with our poor attempts to speak their language. The buffet breakfast was sufficient to last until the evening. We were also able to get access to the internet with a choice of six computers so there was no waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldGem
Reviews.Content: European Hotel rooms tend to be small, but this Sheraton hotel has fairly large rooms. The style is similar to American hotels. It is clean and the staff are helpful and courteous. They also have free Internet service at the Lobby provided by Microsoft Link. The hotel rooms are clean and the service is pretty good. We got turndown service in the evening and they even provide delicious chocolate by the bedside table. That said, the location is a little out of the way. It is not in the heart of Rome, and you need to take the Metro (Line B) to EUR Magliana and walk about 10 mins to the hotel. We got a little lost, but I am attaching a directions map for your benefit. Don't expect any nearby shops or restaurants to go to as there are none nearby. However, this forced us to explore other parts of Rome. I would not recommend this hotel to the elderly as the walk to and from the Metro station can be tiring; unless of course if you are part of a tour that picks you up at the hotel. Personally, I anticipated a lot of walking in Rome anyway, so it was not a problem for me. While I have provided a suggested route, you can also cut through the park, but I do not recommend it after dark.

Reviews.Title: “almost there but not quite”
Reviews.Author: val_destination
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a week for a conference. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. The room was also nicely appointed. We could not control air conditioning however and the rooms were very hot! There is a restaurant on site that is decent and this is helpful because this hotel is far from the center of Rome. From the point of view of a business traveler: you cannot iron your clothes inside your room. Instead of dedicating a room for this activity as in other European hotels, this hotel offers the service at a ridiculous fee. So you either pay 6.50 Euro to get a shirt ironed (in a 24-hour delay!) or be prepared to walk in wrinkled clothes! The internet access was problematic the entire time we were there and I never got access from my room. I had to use the lobby computers to get internet access. Very inconvenient when the hotel is hosting a conference and has about 400 business travelers! From the point of view of a tourist: this hotel is simply too far from the attractions of Rome. You have to take a shuttle or the metro. The walk to the metro and the metro station itself are sketchy - I would avoid it if alone at night. It is not worth staying here if you plan to visit Rome - at the same rate that this Sheraton charges, you can surely find a fabulous hotel in the center of Rome. I strongly recommend visiting Rome but don't stay at this hotel to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Bouwe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 28-30 August 2009. The hotel is very comfortable, spacious and clean rooms with all the amenities. The hotel offers a restaurant, business centre, swimming pool with bar, a shuttle to and from the Fiumicino Airport and the city centre. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast (buffet) was very good as well! Outside the hotel there is a bus stop for the direct bus service into the centre (Piazza Venezia near Colosseum and Forum Romanum). The subway stations is a 10-15 minute walk. Trains go directly to the Colosseum and Circus Maximus and Termini Railway Station (travel time approx. 15 minutes). Also, the trains to Ostia Antica (must see!) depart from this station (the Lido-service). All in all a very nice stay and I would certainly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmelo_infusino
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Stayed with my wife and daughter. Loved the room, location, breakfast and especially the staff. Mr. Grazio at the front desk was extremely helpful. Would definitely stay again. Grazie Grazio ! Carmelo Infusino

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience in Rome Suburbs”
Reviews.Author: BonneVoyager
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome as a birthday treat and were very disapointed by the Roma Sheraton. Firstly would be lovely if they had a shuttle to/from ciampino as well as Da Vinci Airport as we arrived late in the city centre on the airport bus only to be absolutely fleeced by a local taxi as we had missed the last hotel shuttle. We knew we were being overcharged, but were grateful to get out of the city and to our hotel. However it was only once we arrived at the hotel we discovered that the fare should have been no more than 20 euros and we had been asked for more that three times that amount. I had got a good rate with hotwire but was very disapointed to discover just how far outside Rome their "Central Rome" hotel was and basically feel rather ripped off by that also - prior to that I was a big hotwire fan. We then, due to flight time changes had to book an extra night that we had to do with another firm (booking.com). I then emailed the hotel asking them to combine our two bookings so we could stay in the same room. They emailed back saying this was all in hand and as it was a special birthday celebration they were giving us a specially nice room. When we arrived no provision had been made for combining our bookings. We were told we had to book in and out again. This however we were told wiould be done by the staff seemlessly andwithout our being even aware of it. We were then shown to a small, shabby room with footprints on the wall and a half eaten pot of honey in the mini bar. Peeling paint and general grubbyness and damaged furniture were also an unwelcome feature. Hardly the special room that the email promised. At 8am I fould a sheet saying that we had been checked out in our absence while we were "on our way to breakfast". The bill also seemed to say that charges to the room had been charged to a different credit ard than the one we had asked additional charges to be billed to. The 24 hour movie/intenet package we purchased was shut off and a female housekeeping staff member barged in despite the do not disturb sign on the door further making us most uncomfortable. When I complained that the internet access I purchased was not working a member of staff suggested I phoned the service provider - not exactly the assistance I was hoping for! When I complained the booking manager offered us an identical room which he said had been renovated on the 5th floor by way of apology which we declined. I then met the general manager who was very helpful and generous and upgraded us to a junior suite with club privileges which was lovely and also gave us a lovely bottle of proseccio in our new very beautiful room. We still had endless problems with the inhouse movie system so were refunded but after that we did have a lovely stay. The pool was lovely. The food overpriced and average but the we did expect Rome to be pricey. Generally we thought that staying outside the city centre with the shuttle bus was actually a good idea as I am sure for the price you could not get such great facilities in the city centre and it was a lovely quiet setting. However no shops within walking distance did make me feel rather isolated and I think 3 euros per person to catch the shuttle into Rome (free on th way back) was an annoying charge that despite only realy costing 1.50 each way just grated. Apart from the general manager and the staff at the club lounge I did find the staff a little condiscending at times but it was a very nice hotel with a lot to offer. Naturally being upgraded to junior suite (really lovely!) and enjoying all the many perks of the club lounge did make our stay very special but the let down of the initial shabby room and the annoyance of all the fuss made of booking us out and in due to the two bookings would make us wary of returning. So all in all, if you consider the inconvience of being outside the city being worth it to saty in a cool, airy, roomy hotel with outside pool in a leafy suburb and you are willing to risk getting a shabby room albeit at a very good price then I hope you will have a very nice stay at the Roma Sheritan. Most guests I spoke to did seem happy and indeed with the very welcome intervention of the general manager and his generous problem solving skills we too were very happy for 3 out of 4 of our days stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: MrTiggles
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was not great. It is still a distance from the main heart of Rome and is located on the outskirts in a deprived area. The food we ordered for room service is probably one of the worst meals that I, and my partner, have ever eaten; even more poor when you consider how expensive it is. The hotel's restaurant was mostly empty and this was no surprise as the food is way below a decent standard. The swimming pool is a bonus but the cost of drinks at the bar cost us 33 euros for two Martini's and a half a pint of beer; about £30! The room was very clean but overall, I found the stay here of poor quality. It seems a far cry from a 4* hotel. I have stayed at better chains of 2* hotels including the Ibis chain. Choose carefully.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel in room if you want one with an outdoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Irvinedoc
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in August 09. I had booked two double rooms; one for my wife and myself, and one for my daughter. I had paid for this online. When we arrived the hotel was overbooked and we were upgraded to the club floor level. initially we were given one proper room and a 'suite' . this turned out to be a sitting room with a poor fold out bed. we declined this and they gave us two proper rooms. the free upgrade meant we got a free breakfast every day, use of the internet and also a place to have a drink in the evenings. so quite a bonus. the pool is very good and there is a nice outdoors area which suited my daughter (18). the bus into town takes 30 minutes in the morning, but about 10 minutes returning in the evening. it does make you think of doing one trip per day, rather than a city centre hotel, where you can put your feet up in the middle of the day. but then they don't tend to have pools, or if the do, are ridiculously expensive. rooms and public rooms are of 4 star quality. the surrounding area is a bit of a dump however, with prostitutes hanging around the 'park' from the afternoon onwards. 10 minute walk from the metro, but poor walking - with narrow pavements/sidewalk and also few proper crossings. short 15 minute trip to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed out stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelangel777
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband and I from hotwire and got a great rate. It was a little far from the city (about 1/2 h) but we took the shuttle for 3 euro and found it perfect for sightseeing. It is a good hotel if you don't mind staying in the city all day and then going back to your room at night. Food- One night we ordered room service and found it very tasty. Another day we ate at the hotel and found it good. Yes it is expensive but you are in Italy and it is a Sheraton so we expected that. Room- Our room was huge for European standards! The bed was really comfy. The maid turned down our rooms everynight and left Baci chocolates on our pillow- a nice touch! Internet- I used the free lobby internet to book another hotel for our travels in Italy. The only complaint I had was they only have a few stations and some kids were using a few of them to play games on. I waited and got my turn. Subway- We did the 10min walk twice- once to go to the vatican and again with our suitcases to go to the subway. The front desk explained how to get there. It was a little challenging crossing the streets but worth the money saved over a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: chef1391
Reviews.Content: Why I say It was the worst. The first reason, the hotel lies, they say its close to the city center, thats a lie, its closer to the airport. The second reason the bus schedule, the bus schedule is awful it does not give you enough time to enjoy Rome. People in Rome go out to diner at ten or eleven o'clock, if you follow the bus schedule you must eat by eight, so you can run back to the bus, let me tell you, that it's not easy to do. Rome is very big and very busy with traffic congestion. The third reason, every time you want to take the bus you have to pay 3 euro's which is about 5 dollars green back, when you pay the money you go one way, and free return from the city on the same money. But you have to understand that if there five hundred people staying at the hotel and they all go to the city center, they all want to go back to the hotel. The hotel bus holds 53 people, do the math, when I was there people got in fist fights trying to get back on the bus, the reson they were so determined to get back on the bus and not take a taxi is because it cost around 50 euro to go back to the hotel thats about 75 green back. The hotel said to me from city center to hotel 20 euro, they lied. The hotel tells you what you want to hear. The workers are so rude, but I did feel bad for the cleaning crew, they work the hell out of them. They say they have internet, they do, 12 euro from your room, they do have computers, they have six for 500 hundred people. I made a complaint about the bus and its service, the manger who is very week came to talk to me and did nothing, the shearaton was going to close the hotel, they should have. Don't eat or drink there, example bud beer 12 green back, pizza 16 green back, hambuger 22 green back , mixed drink 13 green back. If you want more information call the manger he gave me his card Silver Carpanese +390654537005 but he is week and a liar. There are 800 hotel in Rome look around, there are much better and closer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: hippiehege
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Rome, and before we travelled we were thinking about how the heat would affect my son (6 years) - and we wanted to have a nice hotel with pool. This hotel was perfect, nice pool, nice &clean room, very nice staff - we were in the city every morning and evening. We were in the poolarea every afternoon, and even though it was not so many sunbeds, we got one every day! :) The shuttle bus was very dependable, and made it easy to go to the centre of Rome. We would come back anythime! We would love to come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but...”
Reviews.Author: Lucette1
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because we wanted a nice pool, a comfortable hotel out of the city center, breakfast and a place to chill out in the warm italian evenings. We got what we looked for and as stated in other reviews the rooms are indeed in need av refurbishing but it was very clean and that made out for it. I would have given this hotel a higher score if it were not for the very rude waiter Fabrizio at the piano bar, he was really mean. We are five ladies who travel together once a year and i can honnestly say that we were never ever anywhere been treated that way when trying to order drinks in a foreign language.

Reviews.Title: “bit out of the way but still easy to get around if adventurous!”
Reviews.Author: dunnyboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. It was my first time to Rome and my fiance's 3rd (I think!). The hotel was great..cozy bed, nice shower, air conditioning (it wasn't overly cold but kept the room cozy). If you stay here, you can cross over the motor way and walk to the subway in about 5-10 minutes. Otherwise, their shuttle was cheap and dependable. I wouldn't recommend on hoping to get a cab from the subway station...we walked and never saw a taxi!. Secret: if you walk to the left of the station on the main road, and follow it around, oyu will come to a local park that is usually open (on the left hand side of the road). You can cut stright through to the Sheraton's parking lot and avoid walking the motorway! I would definitely stay here again. It is a bit out, but it is very clean, quiet, spacious compared to other places I have seen. Breakfast is seriously overpriced, so I would recommend getting snaks to keep in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good!”
Reviews.Author: Bless1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Roma before and seems there is a slight improvements. The breakfast was quite rich with varieties. The room was on the small size but very comfortable bed. Would definitelt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not the place to stay if you want a true Roman experience..”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2400
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel rooms, but the bathrooms are a little out-dated. I wouldn't encourage people to stay here if they are looking to experience a true Roman experience. I lived in Rome for a short time and would suggest finding the smaller hotels in the heart of the city. Anything near the Vatican, Spanish Steps, or Pantheon will be a great location. The Sheraton does not offer the beauty of the Italian culture, instead it seems to try to be as American as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinit2811
Reviews.Content: ROma Sheraton hotel is a superb hotel in the country side,great breakfast ,superb rooms and most important very very peaceful.they have a great shuttle service to the panaroma shopping mall,which means your transportation for shopping saved,got a great travel desk.All in all a great hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: IWannaGoAgain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in May. The room was great and our room service pizza was pretty good. Yes, this isn't in the center of Rome but they do have a dependable shuttle. Even better, walk five minutes to the Metro station and you can get anywhere, on your schedule, for less $. The 'path' is along a road that didn't have much of a sidewalk but we even walked it with luggage and it was ok. Negatives - the concierge wasn't overly friendly and you do have to pay for Internet access in the lobby. But the beds were comfortable and the shower was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miyagiMumbai
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Roma is a beautiful hotel and is a little distance from the city centre. The free shuttle in and out of the city was somthing good. The live music played in the evenings was good. The hotel was fun overall....although a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Ksullivan1259
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. I have been to Rome several times and made a mistake staying at this hotel. Far away from the main area of Rome. Very overpriced. The concierge and staff are not overtly rude - I basically felt like the prescence of the guests was a huge inconvenience and a little beneath them. I got a great rate for the room from Hotwire. I told myself this would make up for the minor inconvenience of being outside of Rome. It didn't. Some days the bus didn't run. The pick up spot - in Rome-is WAY out of the way. One night it rained and the bus still hadn't come for 45 minutes past the schedule time. I grabbed a cab with some other hotel guests. You also have to pay for the shuttle every day. The food was ridiculously priced and just average. I am from the East Coast and used to expensive hotels and meals but this was too much.I used room service a few times and the staff was very nice and efficien Overall the hotel was a detriment to the enjoyment of my trip, not a plus.

Reviews.Title: “sheratoirn rome”
Reviews.Author: PRES09ICHEAP9
Reviews.Content: Not bad just a little disappointment for this level of a hotel; Room little shaby - in my room on the Executive floor water leakage stains on the celing and some wall paper in bad needs of redecorating. A second half of May very hot, but the hotel pool not operating - to life saving guard has got the contract from June only Seem little like in the former SU

Reviews.Title: “great experience - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SandyFromCary
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 5 nights at the Sheraton Roma for her retirement celebration. We were very impressed with the hotel and the staff. The rooms were spacious, very clean, and quite. The bathroom was large and very nice. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional. They made us feel very welcome. We were on the Club Level and enjoyed the Club Lounge and the adjoining outside patio. It was so relaxing to return to the hotel after a busy day of sightseeing. Other reviews mention the hotel’s location. I liked being away from the city center and the peacefulness of the surrounding. The shuttle bus takes you to the city and the airport for a couple of euros. We took several Apian Way tours while staying at the Roma and they picked us up at the hotel which made things very convenient. Overall, it was a great vacation and we felt that the staff really stepped up their hospitality to make this a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the poolside”
Reviews.Author: DanielLuroso
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Roma is a beautifully crafted hotel. The location is at the business centre of the city. The Hotel & Conference Centre too was well equippent and the overall experience was good!!

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoverNice
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing this review, I know. The hotel is a very busy conference hotel, no charme, but very convenient as not far from Fiumicino airport. I would recomend this hotel for the location. The service is nothing special, particularly in the breakfast restaurant. If you want to have troubles, ask for a cappucino.... The waiter will look at you like if you are coming from a different planet !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what expected, Sheraton value”
Reviews.Author: VenS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton Roma for 5 days in April 2009. We found a good deal through www.booking.com and so chose this hotel even though it is not in the historical centre. We were very pleased. Excellent rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, clean, great breakfast, quiet, free internent access at the hotel lobby, great fitness centre (not that we will need it if you walk all day in Rome!). As for the distance to the town centre, there is of course the hotel Shuttle Bus (every one and half hour, at 3 euro per person, two ways) but there is also Bus No 780 which runs every half hour and takes you to Piazza Venezia in 30 minutes. The bus stop is RIGHT OUTSIDE the hotel and the ticket costs 1 euro. So, the distance to the city centre didn't inconvenience us at all. You can also take a taxi to the city centre for approx 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location with plenty of fees! comfy rooms though”
Reviews.Author: iheart2travel18
Reviews.Content: stayed with my boyfriend over easter...rooms were great but in a really really AWFUL location! really far from all the amenities! you'd think with the rates your paying and their crappy location that they would give you the shuttle services for free...NOPE! 3 EUR everytime you want to head downtown! its so inconvenient...you must book everyday fast because it gets sold out and you gotta wait another hour...its very limiting! it forces u to stay downtown for the entire day! u don't have the luxury of going back to your hotel for an afternoon nap. also the bus ride is awful...literally 20-30 mins looong bus rides! its fine in the morning but at night when you're exhausted, all u wanna do is get to your room fast....terribly overpriced breakfast and dinner...go to a supermarket or have take out with u to the hotel. NOT WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: sb0137
Reviews.Content: The Club rooms on the 5th and 6th floor are lovely; the club lounge is a perfect place to relax; the shuttle service is very efficient; the Staff are very friendly; the gym is well equipped; dinner menu is of very high quality , breakfast is ok but not reflecting the standard of the hotel; breakfast buffet s differs when hotel is busy and additional rooms are used for breakfast; the service can be rushed and approximate. All in all a great experience. Will go back again. Watch your handbag near Magliana tube station: we were nearly mugged twice.

Reviews.Title: “superb if location is not of great importance”
Reviews.Author: ginoupierre
Reviews.Content: a very good hotel.. very professional service ..very clean nice housecleaning great breakfast nice swimming pool (rare in Rome) i have 3 things to add to other reviews 1.i read some complaints about cold reception by the hotel staff...i think it's quite unfair but you have to remember that in italy appearance is very important and they are not too happy to see people (unfortunately most ly americans)coming dressed as if they were going to fix their car asking "hey what's there to see in Rome anyway ?"without even trying to speak neutral english 2.Bus Shuttle costs 3 euros to the center (near la Bocca de la Verita) but the return trip is free .. you can take the quite fast metro from EUR Magliana station but you'd much better take the bus which stops just in front of the hotel....there are 2 interesting lines bus 780 which goes to piazza venezia right in the middle of the city and bus 31 which goes to the Vatican (you'll have then to walk a mere 15 minutes to reach San Pietro)..on the way back thoses buses stop 75 meters after the hotel but then you'll have to cross the main road....they run 7 days a week and also in the evening 3.Romans love to stay late in the evening in the restaurants ..therefore they must use their car and as it's quite difficult to park in downtown Rome they choose restaurants outside the city usually out of range for the average tourist....that's where the good restaurants are...most of those of Rome are reserved for tourists and are of poor quality except if you're ready to pay for hugely expensive restaurants of the 5 stars hotels...i think then that the Sheraton restaurant is a very good alternative...it's succulent not cheap but not very expensive (you pay 35 euros for the mediterranean buffet which is gorgeous)..you can also dine in the sheraton bar where which has a good singer and even a dancing party on the saturday night and it will cost you only 12-15 euros for a good pizza

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and service in a poor location”
Reviews.Author: Simba40
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children with youngest being 20 months old. We choose this hotel because of the swimming pool but unfortunately it is not open yet. The hotel is far from the city centre and although the hotel runs a shuttle service for 3 euros its is still inconvenient. The booking service on the outward journey is fine if you book early enough but the return is everyone pushing to make sure they get even if that means that the family with the young children don't! The shuttle service from the airport to the hotel is quite a sparse service and the cost is 5 euros one way each. If you miss one you may have to wait 90 mins for the next so I suggest you ask the hotel for the timetable. The room was ok, dated and dark but plenty of room for a sofabed and a cot. The cot for the baby took 7 hours to arrive to the room which was a long time to wait with a little one. I had to make a few phone calls before it arrived. On the second night the cot collasped with the baby inside and it was a very frightening experience. The hotel's adittude was unreal, they sent a handyman to tie it together with plastic clips. I never sleeped again as everytime the baby moved I was awake. I suggest that you take your own travel cot to this hotel. I did complain to the Duty Manager and she assured me she would have the problem dealt with but as we said at check out this cot is a real health and safety issue and needs addressing urgently. I am send a letter to the head office on this matter. The hotel has 3 areas for breakfast which offer different levels of choice and service. 1 room is pleasant with fresh food and choice with a range of coffee, tea etc. The second room is also pleasant with less choice and luke warm weak coffee flasks sit on the table. The third room is a shame to the Sheraton with little choice and large function tables were guests are forced to sit together. Really not acceptable. I think it would be better to stay more central next time as the shuttle service is not good enough and April is not high season.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Peter061
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Roma is a slightly dated North American style hotel located outside of the City center. The rooms are more than adequate and provide a good alternative to higher priced lower quality properties in Rome itself. Caution: in April the hotel air conditioning was not yet turned on (public areas were air conditioned). Housekeeping provided a fan and the windows open, but these were no match for the heat and humidity of Rome. Staff were helpful and polite. The complementary breakfast included with our room was very good- many varieties of fresh fruit, juices, cold meats, breads, yogurts and cheeses. There were several hot selections available, but describing them as horrible would be kind. Room service is available but like the hotel bar it is prohibitively expensive The hotels location is its main drawback for the tourist visitor to Rome. The hotel compensates for this with a bus to take visitor into Rome. (about 8 departures per day- 3 euro return). The city center bus stop is not particularly well located (not at a metro station) but is ok. The cost of your ticket to the city center is charged to your room while the return trip is free you have no guarantee of space on the bus. We were one of five guests turned away from one of the return trips. It was not a major problem most of the time, but April is a shoulder season. I cannot speculate on how problematic this service would be during peak tourist seasons. We walked to the metro on several occasions and it provided excellent city center access. As other reviewers suggest, the walk takes only 5-10 minutes but it is along an off ramp from a major road. Still it was reasonably safe (from traffic) and I would not hesitate to walk to the metro during daylight hours. Mostly the traffic was sparse and not nearly as threatening as crossing a busy street in downtown Rome. There are also free shuttles from the hotel to a local shopping center and a cab to the brand new EURO center was only 15 euros. We extended our stay by one night- after getting on the internet to get a price, I asked for a quote from the front desk. The hotel itself was about 50 euro higher than the rate I could book on a number of sites. The hotel clerk acknowledged this and simply pointed me back to the internet terminal so I could book it myself. I am impressed with the actual prices available from Trip Advisor, Hotels.com and Expedia.com ect. I had never used these online services in Europe and was a little hesitant but it worked like a charm. On the 8 night stay, I saved about $500 vs. the prices available at the hotel or the Sheraton Website itself. All and all, we had a good stay and an enjoyable trip. If you don’t mind the city center shuttle or the short walk to the metro, the Sheraton Roma is good value. Rome is unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as it first looked”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: garish/tired decor, tired bathroom - difficult to clean but not too bad apart from alarming stains on floor - and a very unclean whiff in the room were the first impressions. Grubby windows did at least open (built up the biceps quite nicely: seriously some people would not be able to open them) to let in air from the motorway type junction outside. The bed was ok. Cooked breakfast was tepid. Secure overnight parking was €23. Other guests seemed to be quite happy and it was bearable but I'd rather not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Sheraton Roma”
Reviews.Author: bobbyStockport
Reviews.Content: 1st March 2009. Just home to England after staying at the Sheraton Roma. Stayed on the club floor and everything was just lovely especially as we were not expecting breakfast in the restaurant to be included. So nice to relax with comp wine/coffee/snacks in the lounge after a day sightseeing in Rome. Would like to stay again in late summer when the outdoor pool would be open as it looked impressive. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the shuttles were brilliant. The restaurant was lovely and not expensive. The room was perfect. No complaints whatsoever. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gail_wilson
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Diamond member with Sheraton. We received excellent service. Access to the Club Lounge was great. It was also nice to sleep on the Sheraton sleeper bed.
