The hotel shuttle is also an excellent amenity. We took the shuttle to/from FCO airport. (5 euros per person, each way). We also utilized to shuttle to travel to and from city center. I believe they charge a shuttle fee now (3 euros round trip, per person). However, if you only use the shuttle to return to the hotel from city center, it is free of charge. We were there during low season (February), so we did not experience overcrowding on the shuttle. We also walked to the metro station on a couple of occaisions. The metro station is a short walk from the hotel (Magliana station). Not the most ideal walking situation (Narrow or non-existent sidewalk part of the way. A small section of the route might be scary at night, due to low visibility). The hotel shuttle also stops at this metro station. I believe you must request it. The metro is very convenient to travel around Rome. I would take some time to research the public transportation. It would have been great if we'd had more info on the bus system. It does save a bit of walking when you're tired. Public transportation is very convenient and cost-effective. We used to metro to view most of the ancient sites. We also took the metro to Ostia Antica and further down to the coast. We took the metro blue line to the northern end (Rebibbia), then got on a Cotral bus (9 euros round trip, per person) to Tivoli. A word of warning: public transportation can be quite crowded during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel outside the city”
Reviews.Author: Svestka
Reviews.Content: We spend a nice euroweekend in this hotel. I have no comments to hotel itself, its little bit older building but still in ok. Breakfast was sufficient, just dont be surprised by huge lunchroom for hundreds of people from different travel agencies. The only minus is distance from city centre, hotel offers the shuttle bus which is frequently full so I recommend to book in advance (before breakfest). Same problem could be on the way back to hotel, I was witness of almost fight when a few people tried to get in to the bus over other people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside of the city”
Reviews.Author: travLer2009
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Rome felt like an above-average American hotel plopped about 15 minutes south of Rome's city center. The location isn't great but the hotel offers a free shuttle service that runs every hour and a half until 11:30pm, so it turned out to be a relatively minor inconvenience, although paying more to be inside the city certainly has its benefits if you're a full-day type of traveler. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-equipped. The lobby has a bank of computers where you can use the Internet for an hour free of charge. The restaurant and bar were good, as was the service. Overall, this is a nice, clean hotel that will have everything you need for a good trip. The only downsides are the somewhat inconvenient location and the lack of an authentic Italian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelenjeff
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October. It was great - we booked on points so it was free. The hotel was clean, very nice with more than enough room and comfortable beds. Because my husband has platnum status we had access to the club lounge where we had breakfast every day and even had enough to eat for dinner one night. The club lounge had pop, wine, coffee, water etc and more than enough food to get by. We also had access to the internet in the club lounge. THe shuttle worked well to and from the city centre and the shuttle to the airport was good as well. I would definetly recomend

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: gjpac
Reviews.Content: Very westernized for a hotel in Europe. Big and clean. Nice big shower and bathroom. One mistake we did,,,we took everything out of the fridge to put our water bottles,,,not realizing that they have sensors. Any items taken out of the fridge will be automatically charged to your bill. But we put everything back and the check out girl just cancelled all items. (i'm sure we weren;t the only one who did that) they also had great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wendiv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third stay in Rome at the Sheraton Roma and it was absolutely amazing! The staff are like family to us, and the hotel itself rivals any hotel in Rome (including those that are triple the price). This hotel offers very spacious, well appointed rooms, fantastic beds and showers, a wonderful fitness centre and pool area (one of the only pools in Rome) and complimentary shuttle service to downtown, a shopping mall and to and from the airport (small charge of 5 euros for airport shuttle). Unlike other higher end hotels, the food here is excellent and very reasonably priced and the service is superb. Perhaps the most wonderful perk of staying here is the Club Lounge, which is open from 6:30am until 11pm. It resembles the First Class lounge at an airport, only much better. The breakfast is more than you'll need to start your day, and snacks are offered after 11am as well as fine Italian wines in the evening. Said, the lounge manager and his fabulous team will also make you the "world's best cappuccino" upon request. The only drawback for some people may be the location, but the shuttle is only 15 minutes from downtown, and travels on the hour all day long. The wonderful staff, food and many other extras make it more than worthwhile to be a bit off the beaten path. We rate this hotel a perfect 10/10. Doug and Wendi Varley

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay outside of Rome City”
Reviews.Author: Loeane
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you prefer to be away from the buzz of Rome City. There is a free hotel shuttle bus to the city, so there's no worries at all!

Reviews.Title: “Is this the pits?”
Reviews.Author: nickcambridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference but..... Dark, gloomy corridors and rooms. Few lounge areas. Room very old fashioned an despite being a Few facilities - i.e no dressing gown and sheets not changed with a note claiming this was due to my request! Phones have no phone number on and aircon made constant hissing only mutable with a box of Kleenex. And of course it is on a spaghetti junction a E20 ride from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Service Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: srounis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days before we headed to Greece. It was great! I know it's not in th hear of Rome but it was relaxing and easy to get downtown to see all the sights with the free shuttle. Our room was good with a King size bed and a fold out coach which was perfect for our 1yr old to sleep on. The shuttle took about 10 mins to get into Rome where we were able to see all the sights. Best thing to do is get a pass on the Green Hop on Hop off tourist bus it was 18euro per person for 24hrs and you could get on and off all day. They had two stops very close to where the shuttle drops you off. The tour bus has a great route to all the major sights or very close to them so you can see everything and more without spending too many hours hiking around the city. Make sure you use the green bus as the come to the stops about every 15mins. The staff at the hotel were great especially with a little one. The wait staff in the restaurant were so accomodating and helpful. We never got to use the pool but it look great. We took the shuttle to the airport on our departure and it was only 5euros compared to the 55euros we paid for a cab on arrival. We will definately stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Rob77Milan
Reviews.Content: this isa a good hotel if you are on business travel. rooms are big, clean and comfortable. breakfast is good. I don't advice the hotel if you are on holiday because is far from the city center. the car park is a bit expensive. close to this car park there is another one free but the car s often are stolen or damaged

Reviews.Title: “too far from town”
Reviews.Author: chacha46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton Rome 4 nights in August. The hotel itself is very nice except for the fact it's too far from central Rome. There is nothing walking distance which forces you to either eat at the hotel restaurant which is extremely expensive and not worth the money or take the shuttle into the center of Rome and walk afterwards to find somewhere to eat. One day we decided to walk and after about a mile and a very dirty and dangerous thin sidewalk we found a McDonalds. Not my idea of the food I wanted to eat in Italy. I don't recommend staying here unless you don't mind taking the shuttle everytime you want to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SENIORSOFTBALLFREAK
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Roma was a great hotel with a wonderful, friendly staff and was very accommodating. We had no issues whatsoever with A/C or anything else - it was great! There was a small glitch we had with the shuttle one day, but the manager was overwhemingly generous and apologetic. There is one huge drawback to the hotel, though... The hotel is located on the outskirts from city center. The shuttle they provide is good, but you're on their timetable. When they say they are close to the Metro, it's true. However, you take your life in your hands getting there. The walk to the Metro stop is along a very busy road. The sidewalks are so overgrown with weeds that you literally have to walk IN THE STREET! and they DO NOT drive slowly in Italy! There is a street that you have to cross walking back to the hotel from the metro that has a stop sign. However, as we learned the hard way...no one stops! and the bushes are so huge and overgrown that you cannot see the cars that are coming around. So...if you're a daredevil, use the metro. If not, use the shuttle or the bus system (which is a whole nother entitiy itself!) They do have a car rental office at the hotel which worked out wonderfully for us. Also- we stayed in a Club Room and took advantage of the lounge. We wish they had a bigger variety of snacks, but overall, it was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Just like in US”
Reviews.Author: incognito2007
Reviews.Content: I am starwood member and used my points to stay there. Our stay at Sheraton was mixed. The hotel itself is nice, spacious and clean, the staff are nice and helpful. Unlike many other people I did not have any problem with the AC or any other utility, everything worked great. Transportation: Since this is probably the biggest drawback about this hotel I will elaborate on this. Hotel provides a shuttle service to the center of rome and picks up from there. That is nice of them but it does eat into your time. Basically, shuttle itself takes 30 mins and you need to be present at the stop at least 15 mins in advance and do it both the ways, you end up spending 1.5 hours for shuttle. When you are vacationing time is a premium. And the shuttle stop in the city is a 15-20 min walk from the Roman forum. The other option is to take the Metro, Metro station is 10 mins walk from the hotel, there is not a good paved walkway for pedestrians, it is a little challenging but if you missed your shuttle, Metro is very convenient, and there is a Metro station right opposite the Colosseum. For 15-20 euros you can also take cabs to the city center. We did a day trip to Florence, we took the Metro to Termini and from there Eurostart to Florence, it took 1 hour 30 mins to one way. Worth the effort if you would like to do it. Food: I would not recommend you to eat at hotel, not only is it overpriced but also not that great. You can find much better food in the city. There are no small shops around, so buy your water bottles in the city itself. We carried a water bottle with us and refilled it at one of the various tap water spots.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at Sheraton Roma”
Reviews.Author: its-me4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Roma from May 27-June 5, 2008. We used the hotel as a home base. The shuttle to Rome was convenient and operated on a regular schedule. We had no problems with the shuttle or the times. The hotel restaurant served great food and the restaurant staff were very nice. The pool opened for the season on May 31, but the water was ice cold. The pool area is lovely and once the weather warms the pool up, it will be great for guests. The beds and bed linens were very nice and comfortable and the bathroom was also quite nice. There is also some shopping/town/parks within a 15 minute walk of the hotel if you are up for a nice stroll. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a hotel....”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: This was our starting point for our Trafalgar tour and as our tour director said it is very "Americanized". The room was large and so was the bath. The breakfast bar was large and had a great selection. The staff was very helpful with maps and working with the airline to get out luggage that was lost. We caught the free shuttle back after walking around Rome all day. There is also a subway stop and a bus stop close by if you want to take that route. As other people have noted, this is not close to downtown, but is in the EUR section. You get what you pay for and the free suttle makes up for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, Awful service”
Reviews.Author: Whenthesungoesdown21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a long way from downtown Rome and all the sights. You can take a 30 minute complimentary shuttle from the hotel, but it does not run that frequently and drops you off at a somewhat inconvenient location. In addition, during busy times they do not guarantee you a spot on the bus, ie. it is first come, first serve. The rooms were nice and large with comfortable beds and a big bathroom. The staff were the RUDEST staff I have encountered at any hotel I have ever stayed at, including some awful American chains back in the day. On the surface they were polite, but the moment you needed anything they became impolite. For example, one night I called down for a wake up call (since there are no clocks in the room). The phone rang at the front desk for 10 minutes without anyone answering. Assuming they were busy, my wife went downstairs only to find the two front desk clerks sitting down doing nothing, while the phone was ringing right next to them. They also programmed our keys for only one night and so we were temporarily locked out of our room the second night. They made us wait to get the key changed and were not all apologetic. We asked the concierge to book us a meal at an authentic restaurant, and when we went it was one of the more touristy places in rome. They had only 3 different menu touristicos that you could order. Also, beware that they often tell you breakfast is included when you check in. However, this is only for preferred Starwoods members. We went to eat and luckily asked before sitting down, because breakfast is 25 euros per person. They were very rude when we asked about the complimentary breakfast and again made us wait and were unhelpful. We ran into another couple who had this same problem. It is now clear to me why this Sheraton has such great rates- it is an awful hotel. The rooms cannot make up for the horrendous staff, long waits and poor location. Stay at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Find something closer”
Reviews.Author: adoraoo7
Reviews.Content: Far from the main points of interest. We used a shuttle to get to and from the hotel. Arrive to the shuttle stop early when you want to get back to the hotel bc once its full you have to wait for the next scheduled pick up time or take a taxi. Room was nice and clean. Our a/c was not working and I found the room to be too warm for me in mid-april. They sent someone to repair the a/c but he was not able to understand me or fix it so he brought a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Ok business hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterboy
Reviews.Content: Great beds, clean rooms, efficient check-in staff. Restaurant dinner was ok, not really grand but not too bad. Good breakfast buffet. Hotel restaurant and bar need refurbishing though and the same is true for some of the rooms. Location is a bit off the beaten track as you can only take the taxi or shuttle bus to get to places. Overall an ok hotel but budget permitting would stay closer to the city at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Would look for a better choice”
Reviews.Author: jorgemb
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent beds and very clean rooms and bathrooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Shuttle takes you to ancient sights for free. Cons: Climate control was difficult to manage. Staff unable to resolve issue. We were advised to sleep with the windows open which we did. Difficult to access public transportation other than shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Earth”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this was one of the most horrible hotel stays I have ever had. I am a Platinum SPG member, and I stay at a lotta Starwood Properties. This one offers very little besides a nice club room... I was given a smoking room that was so small you could hardly pass the bed without walking sideways, and I am a small person! Exhausted and hungry, I went to eat in the hotel lounge and had honestly the worst pizza by far that I had on my 8 day trip, and by 3 Euro, the most expensive! The sauce tasted like it was straight out of a can of plain Jane tomato sauce! At nite, the room was so hot it was unbearable. I see that others have mentioned this as well. I have never experienced anything like it at a hotel anywhere! Luckily a fan was brought, and I put it directly on myself in order to sleep. Now the kicker: I knew that from reviews, there was not much in the hotel's vicinity. But people had mentioned there were some restaurants nearby...etc. BEWARE folks, there is NADA...Nothing...Zilch! The hotel is literally in the middle of the loop of multiple ways to gain access to highways and busy streets. There is nowhere to walk off property. There is nothing to do near this hotel whatsoever, and it is a good 25 minutes from the Center of Rome. Needless to say, I immediately booked another hotel in the center of Rome for the rest of my stay, b/c it would have been very impractical to just use the shuttle service. If you are going to try and just rely on it, it is not worth it. Although it was very efficient timewise, you may want to go back and rest for a bit after a long day of walking, and you will want to head back out to eat. I do not think you will want to eat in the overpriced, substandard restaurant every nite. So you would have to make 2 trips on the shuttle, which would take 2 hours out of your day, plus you would then have to spend travel time getting to your respective destination once you arrive in the Center. Do not do this to yourself! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably adequate stay”
Reviews.Author: z4ki
Reviews.Content: Although this was my fifth trip to Italy, this was the first time I am going to Italy on holiday. All the previous trips were on business. Business like atmosphere which was aptly described on the hotel website. Okay, so the location was in the outskirts of Rome. But this was made up by the very efficient shuttle bus service into Rome. Sheraton Roma has never failed me. This will remain as my choice hotel whenever I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected but in the middle of nowhere...”
Reviews.Author: hmamsterdam
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a two night stay at the Sheraton Roma. I was there for a conference held at the hotel itself. Unfortunately, the hotel is located quite a distance from the center of Rome. Normally, this wouldn't be an issue; you'd just grab a cab during your few hours off. This time, however, there was a taxi strike. No fault of the hotel, of course, but at moments like that you do realize you're in the middle of nowhere. There is a hotel shuttle into the center; it leaves every hour and a half. We decided not to wait and take the metro, which we were told was just a few minutes away. It wasn't. After a 20 minute walk through the rain and in the street (no sidewalks), we reached the metro. About an hour later we were at the Vatican. Additional minus points: the hotel rooms are unbearably hot and the window only opens a few inches, the tea water (both at breakfast and in the conference rooms) was barely lukewarm Plus points: friendly hotel staff, great espresso, good breakfast I would definitely not stay at this hotel for a holiday or weekend break but would head for the center. It is, however, an efficient hotel for conferences and forums.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Adryan
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel, we were wary about booking our stay here, but were pleasantly suprised upon arrival. This hotel is located a few miles outside the main tourist areas of Rome, just so you know....and it looks like a well-maintained business hotel from the outside. The hotel staff were polite and helpful, the room and bathroom were in excellent shape and beautiful, and the restaurant food was affordable and delicious. The elevators could be a little slow and could use some renovating, but were only a minor inconvenience at times. The shuttle into Rome was actually a full sized touring bus. It was on time every morning, and we never had problems getting tickets for it. The bus has multiple runs over the course of the day, but we only used it in the morning to get into the city. It dropped us in a central location in Rome, and was only about a 10 minute ride. We chose to take a taxi back to the hotel in the evenings rather than go back to the pickup location and wait...and possibly not get on if it was too full. The taxi fare from various tourist locations in Rome averaged about 15 euros or so back to the hotel. We may have gotten lucky and gotten a renovated room; however, we would recommend this hotel to anyone based upon our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “rude service”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Large corporate hotel for a conference. Room perfectly fine though no iron or coffee making facilities which was a bit of a pain. there were a few scantily clad girls in the bar on the Friday night who disappeared with men at regular intervals - a great source of entertainment to us but not necessarily a good point. Most annoyingly they tried to charge me for a bar bill which wasn't mine. I had to insist they got the docket which they did with very bad grace. I pointed out that the name and signature were not mine. More shrugging of shoulders and sighs of exasperation. When I saw the time and realised that it was 5 hours before I checked in (I was actually still in London at that time) I asked them to check their record of my check-in. Again this was done with very bad grace and eventually the man on reception just said 'you can go'. No apology or anything. If you are there with a conference you will probably have an OK time but I would not choose to stay there if I was booking it myself. My family and I stayed at the Best Western Canada near Termini last year and we found it to be much more friendly. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: travelbugbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on September 1st, 2nd and 3rd. When we arrived, we ended up taking the Metro to Magliana station and went up the hill to the main road to wait for the shuttle. You do have to wave the shuttle down at this stop because there are other buses that stop here that also have to be waved down. There are two other public buses that go to the Sheraton in case you get stuck at least you know you have other options. The shuttle leave every 1.5 hours from the hotel starting at 8am to 11pm and leaves the city centre location every 1.5 hours starting at 8:30am to 11:30pm so this was very convenient for us. There is also a shuttle to / from the airport for 5 euros one way. There are a number of restaurants to choose from but we loved eating at the pool side bar for both lunch and dinner – they had amazing salads and entrees to choose from! Overall this was a good hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you have a great deal, stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 60kmiles
Reviews.Content: Nice business hotel with large rooms. Clean, great beds and sheets, strong shower. If you are just a tourist, this is an inconvenient location, even with the free downtown shuttle bus (they fill up quickly-get tickets from the concierge early). Shuttles to the hotel from the airport stop running after 6:30 pm, and reservations are needed. The cost is 6 Euro. Otherwise, cab fare costs about 40 Euro (two people, at night, luggage surcharge). Staff here could have been better educated about the hotel’s offerings (such as wireless). When asked (both the concierge and the business center staff) they thought that they maybe had wireless, but had no clue as to how much it was per hour. The club level floors (5 and 6) are good choices, because they allow access for a continental breakfast each morning (complete with self-service espresso machine) and snacks and wine from 11 am-11pm. There are also two free internet terminals here for use, although you can’t plug in your laptop. There are thousands of hotels in Rome. If you are a tourist and have no special deal for the Sheraton Roma (we paid $45 USD/night with Starwood points), stay elsewhere—it is just too far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “More good news than bad”
Reviews.Author: traveljones
Reviews.Content: Good news: Sheraton Roma is an Americanized hotel. Lobby, bar, restaurant and pool area are open and airy. All staff we encountered spoke english and were accomodating of our lack of italian language skills. Rooms were large by European standards and not overly tight for Americans. We have had smaller rooms in Paris and London for much more money. Handicap accessible rooms have a full 2nd bathroom, wider entry and wood floors. We stuck to pizza /pasta in the restaurant and were not disappointed. Buffet is a good option. Prices are higher than a comparable restaurant in the States. The pool is a great place to unwind and has a good, varied food service. The airport is 20 minutes away. Bad news: Check in was horrendously slow and for no apparent reason. We stayed 1 night before a cruise which I paid for and 3 after which were included in a prepaid package. Groups seem to be treated more poorly than individuals. My SPG Gold card had no power whatsoever in getting me checked in the right room or reducing the 2 hr delay in getting any room. The concierge was a bit surly. On the return, our group of 165 had banquet breakfast and dinners. Pasta course was very good but the rest of the dinners were barely palatable. Again, groups (and this is a tour group hotel) are not given the best treatment. Overall: All things considered, this is a good place for the untrained American to ease into Rome. The immediate neighborhood is ugly but the hotel is insulated from it by trees, at least from the lower floors. We didn't use the hotel shuttle to city center but did use many cabs which will have you at the Colosseum in 20 minutes for 12 Euros. (Make sure the meter is on. The first cab we took used a "flat" rate of 20 Euros. Live and learn.) We might stay here on our next trip. After a full day of slogging through the hyperactivity and crowds of city center, we enjoyed the ride out of town to the quiet of the suburb.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Location iffy but can be overcome.”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Rome was just fine for our 4-day stay in Rome in June. It is modern and spotless, with wonderful air conditioning during a heat wave, a great swimming pool, terriific restaurants and generally pleasant staff. We liked the room...exactly the quality we have come to expect at Sheratons with those great beds and nice bathrooms. The food was a big hit, from the enormous and delicious breakfast buffet to the poolside restaurant. Service was great inside, spotty at the pool. (Is there any pool in Italy that has good service?) A tasty pinot grigio helped us get over that. The location of the Sheraton Roma is the only hesitation you should have about staying here. I would not recommend it for a one-night stay. You will want to be closer to the main attractions in that case. But, having said that, there are good options that make it less of a challenge. Contrary to one reviewer, the hotel shuttle DOES, in fact, stop at the Eur Magliana train/metro station. You simply need to wait at the city bus stop and wave it down. Maybe the person who said it did not stop simply did not make their presence known. With people always waiting at the city bus stop for city buses, how is the hotel shuttle driver to know to stop? He will obviously assume you are waiting for a city bus unless you wave him down. It's a big blue bus and you can easily spot it coming. Another option is to take a taxi, because, as we found out, they are VERY cheap in Rome. One morning we had to get up super early to get to the Vatican so a taxi was our only option. We were very pleasantly surprised at how cheap it was. Here's a tip: Don't take those expensive tours on tour buses to see Rome, take a taxi! A taxi ride will also free you from the hotel shuttle schedule. To correct a different reviewer here, there are more than just "a couple" shuttle departures from the hotel every day; there are about 6 if I remember correctly. Anyway, 6 will be closer to reality than 2. The shuttle's downtown stop is at the north end of the Circus Maximus. Without a map, you will be lost, and the drivers (at least the ones we had) don't speak English well enough to direct you clearly. Carry a good street map. The closest attraction is the Palatine Hill whose entrance is, unfortunately, on the opposite side of the hill. The Coliseum and Forum are just beyond that. The nearest metro stop is a good hike at the opposite corner of the Circus Maximus. But if you plan on taking the metro, take the hotel shuttle only as far as the Eur Magliana station. The hotel shuttle will stop there if (and only if) you tell the driver you want to stop there. Even though the metro station is within easy walking distance of the hotel, you have to know where you are going and even then some sidewalks are missing, so we never walked there. Again, keep in mind that a taxi here is never a bad idea. Sheraton Roma is a fine place to stay and its location is not bad once you have the right info.

Reviews.Title: “We did not belong...”
Reviews.Author: KasiaiNate
Reviews.Content: We work in a 5 star hotel environment in the Middle East so we have come to know and understand 5 Star luxury where the guest is made to feel welcome, appreciated and treated special. After all, guests are there to relax, unwind and pay good money for well deserved rest and relaxation. Firstly we arriving alone after 5 hours walking and buses and trains because no one from the hotel bothered to get in contact with us about there being no shuttle bus to the hotel, we were left to find our own room. Our check in was marred by inflexible management because our staff booking form was the incorrect format. The room was ok, although old and not a very sweet sleeper...the bathroom was ok although unsightly plumbing and empty roof space greeted us each morning. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room and ordering a jug of boiling water for 7 euro's is way over the top. Access to the Business Centre was rediculous - 50 young kids playing instant messenger when legitimate business people need to undertake business activities in the BUSINESS CENTRE and waiting until after midnight is silly practice. The food was about the best of the stay. The waiters in the buffett loved their job and this was evident by atleast two or three singing, smiling and joking with both staff and guests. They were prompt and careful for guest needs which is what is expected from a Starwood property. Bell and Concierge staff couldnt get their facts right and most times we relied on external sources for informtation and assistance on getting in and around Rome. In all, we loved Rome and the Italian people but not very impressed with this hotel - we certainly did not feel like we "Belonged".

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: JulietteM
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sheraton Roma was a huge disappointment on this brand. I contacted the hotel asking about transportation from the airport and they advised us to take the train. Bad, bad advice, I did not appreciate our 1st impression of Rome to be on a dirty and old train. When we finally arrived at the nearest train station, we had to call them and ask for a taxi since there was not a taxi stand in that particular station. The check-in and check-out process and the room decoration were great. However, the A/C was not working (although the hotel insisted it was on high) well and we had to request a fan to avoid roasting in the room. Finally, this hotel is far from every attraction in Rome. However, they provide a free shuttle to the center of the city a couple of tmes a day.

Reviews.Title: “OK with Qualifications”
Reviews.Author: TravelproVirginia
Reviews.Content: Agree with most recent reviews of this hotel, especially Artemus, who provides some good details. If you can get a good rate, especially using Starwood points or "Cash ($45/night) and Points", the hotel is acceptable, if somewhat in need of a renovation. Rooms are of adequate size. Staff is not overly friendly or helpful. No special recognition or upgrade for SPG Elite members. If you are a tourist, planning your day around the hotel shuttle is somewhat inconvenient (wouldn't want to have to make two trips a day into Rome center on the shuttle). You must secure a ticket for the shuttle the morning/day of the trip - no advance reservations. And, as mentioned previously, no reservations for the return trip. If there are more than 50 people ahead of you, you won't get on. The shuttle was punctual. About 30 minutes into Rome center and less, returning to the hotel. We did take the Metro into Rome and back one day. About a 15 minute walk - be very careful crossing a few busy streets and ask the hotel for details/directions. The shuttle will also drop you at the Metro stop upon request (but not pick up). Sheraton bus to/from the airport (FCO) is convient and only 5 euros if it meets your schedule. Takes only 20 minutes, a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, A Little Far From the Centre ”
Reviews.Author: rosapa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. Good bed, good room w.c., clean and corect breakfast. Around 25 minutes to the center with a free shutle from the hotel. There is one every 1'30 h. and the last one from Rome center (Piazza Venezzia) is at 23:00. Staff ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gill
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay here. Yes it's in not in central Rome and your decision to stay here depends on the rate you can secure. We got an amazing rate of 79 euros per room per night so did not mind having to take the free reliable, regular shuttle into Central Rome, in fact I enjoyed the journey. The hotel had a nice, spacious lobby with bar area and plenty of seating. I can imagine this hotel being perfect in the summer with it's outside swimming pool. I would stay here again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “starwood copay is good value at this location”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: Travelling solo, I used the starwood copay for 2 nights and it ended up 45$/night which was pretty great for rome. But glad I didn't stay there the whole time however. Pluses: 5 Euro airport shuttle, Free shuttle to Plaza Venezia, good business center for interent connection 3 euros of 30 minutes. I was in room 2117 and it was very quiet. Close to airport. Nice washcloths and towels, sheets. Felt fresh and updated. Didn't see any gypsies, which others have noted on this site. Minuses: A lot of large tour groups book this place. Far from city center. Metro stop not really walkable or practical for couples or families--don't plan on using it. I did but I travelled solo with a backpack. (you will see iItalian streetwalkers if you walk to the metro at night which, I suppose, could be a plus if you are into that kind of thing) When I left this hotel, I stayed in the noisy city center and did not sleep much but experienced italy and it was great living in the old city where the good food/good shopping is..... Bottom line: This is a great comfortable place to crash if you have a late flight coming in or an early flight going out -- or if you need to count every penny and are travelling alone. Or if you are there on business. Otherwise, why stay at a Sheraton in Italy? I used this site to get a sense of where to stay so and was happy with my choices. For tourists/couples -- I would stay at the San Carlo at the spanish steps. I will write my impression of that place as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_canada
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel experience I have ever had. First off I was staying as a starwood hotel employee. On arrival we were treated well and let into our room early, thats where our luck ended. The room was circa 1973 with hanging exposed power sockets shabby bathroom and that overall stale feel, its only bonus was the bed. Feeling tired after a over night train trip, I confined myself to my room and ordered room service. I ordered a cheese and tomato pizza and a side salad. What arrived was a burnt pizza base with just cheese, a bowl of chopped iceburg lettece ( no dressing) and dry stale bread. After complaining to a guest service agent I was confronted by a rude little man who pretended he knew little english. He told me because I was not itallian I did not know that a Tomato and cheese pizza came with no tomato! he left slamming the door and cursing me. The next night we tried the lounge bar, even more of a disgrace, it seemed because we were not wearing dead animal fur that we were not important enough to be served, we had to go and find a waiter for any attention. My club sandwich was okay but the pre used ketchup pottle with an old french fry in it was so revolting. After feeling very much uninvited we left happy to be leaving the next day. On check out we asked to talk to a manager, we meet with the duty manager that was on at the time, she basically said because I worked for starwood hotels I should not expect as good a service as regular guests she basically told us to get lost! in a very typical itallian way. My advice is do not even bother with this place I do not know how it servives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a stay”
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night as part of a layover on my way back to the US. The location was not a problem for me since I was visiting friends who live near the hotel and it was only 20 minutes (40 Euro) from the airport. However, it might not be the most convenient for people wishing to be near "historic Rome", although they do offer a shuttle. The hotel was nice, a bit aged, but not badly. The doors creaked a bit and the closet was sticky, but the bed was amazing (typical SPG sweet sleeper) and the room had a small sofa and nice view. The TV was part of the awful SPG system in Europe that thinks we only watch news. The reality, at least my reality, is that business guests do watch movies and are probably the best entertainment when jet lag sets in. Why they don't offer some form of HBO or something entertaining other than the endless repeats of Leonardo DiCaprio explaing why he wanted to star in "Blood Diamonds" is beyond me. Anyway, the room was comfy, room service was prompt (quite prompt considering this is Italy). The Club Room has great service, Illy espresso, and a nice terrace where you can sit and watch the trees blow in the Roman wind. The bar is nice with a lounge singer and bad disco music in the evening. Overall, service was very good and I liked the hotel, but can see how some might find it to be less than stellar.

Reviews.Title: “100% for business users- but thats OK!”
Reviews.Author: MarionMontgomery
Reviews.Content: You arrive at the Sheraton via an elevated section of poorly maintained roadway, having passed numerous scrap car yards and a "gypsy" encampment . First thoughts are it’s a large tin shed, but on entry the atmosphere changes and the reception staff, who all speak excellent English, are helpful and efficient. There are plenty of elevators and the corridors are well maintained. The room was slightly smaller than most American owned sleep factories, and sadly it was showing its age. Nothing sinister, no mildew or peeling wallpaper, just tired! The bedding clean and the bed comfortable...the bathroom also well maintained and the towels new clean. The bar were very polite and helpful , bar food acceptable though as with all USA owned hotels. expensive - they know who their customers are and who actually pays the expenses!! I didn't eat formally in the hotel- I used the transport into Rome city and enjoyed marvellous restaurants and cafes; all at lower prices than say Paris or London. This hotel is for business travellers and if anyone decides to use it for any other purpose then more fool them...there are many hotels in the city for tourists and lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Bad Location for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Jones
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel where many many tour bus groups and airline folks stay. The hotel itself is fine, a basic big chain hotel located in the EUR district near Rome. They have a shuttle that will take you downtown, but if you want to see Rome this is not the place to stay. This hotel is fine for someone looking for a hotel near the airport, but other than that stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “A Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGHC
Reviews.Content: When, I planned to stay at this hotel due to Sheraton trusted name, 3 weeks ago, my friend has warned me that this hotel would not be as good as American or Asian standard of Sheraton. The fact is the hotel is mediocre, indeed. Here is what the mediocre means: The front guys doesnt pay attention to detail such as our on line request "best view available". He should have told me if there was any room with good view available. He put me at the SPG preferred floor, but, I reckond that floor has no better than other floor. Its marketing gimmick of SPG. (?). In fact, he gave me smooking room, without asking me which room I preferred. The bath room smelled like cigarette. Surprising me, a week before, the manager send me an standard email " what kind I do for you to make your stay more enjoyable" wow... I replay my request, but, it could not be replied. The system reject the replay. Its another marketing gimmick of SPG The Location is far from "Rome". You dont feel you are in Rome. Eventhough the hotel provides shuttle services, it was still a hussle to be back and forth to and from the city centre. The concierge is not too helpful. I would not recommend this hotel to any body who demands an excellent service and wants to enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: hhowell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was TERRIBLE. I was given a smoking room after asking for non-smoking; moved to a room next to an elevator shaft with no hot water; then moved to another room that FINALLY had hot water but I had to share the bed with my friend instead of the two beds that we needed. What a nightmare. The only good thing was the AWESOME breakfest!!! Nice wide selection.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, not too good”
Reviews.Author: tomandlorna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2006, most of the hotel staff was really nice, the rooms were clean, and like most European hotels the rooms were smaller than in the US. The concierge was really helpful in that he recommended places to eat and they were great . The hotel is located about 5 miles outside of town and it takes you approx 20 minutes to get to the city center but the hotel does provide free shuttle service on a scheduled basis to go back and forth. I thought the buffet food was good but pricey, it is alot cheaper but less convienent to go outside of the hotel to eat. The hotel does not offer pickup service from the airport but for a fee they will take you to the airport when you are leaving. We had great weather the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Location was a bit further from City Central than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ritesdfred
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Four Points Roma West. The hotel was much further away from Central Rome than I exprected. The shuttle bus certainly was helpful. Not sure what its like during high season but there was a full size bus that never had more than about 10 people on it when I was there and it ran about every 90 minutes or so. Would have preferred perhaps a smaller van that ran a little more frequently. There is very little around the hotel so get everything you need before you head back for the night. The room was a nice size as was the bathroom and both clean and comfortable. I never found the staff rude or unfriendly as other reviews have mentioned. The breakfast was very nice. One thing I caution is that irons are apparently a violation of some safety law there. We had looked for a self service laundry ( and never saw one anywhere in Rome). The hotel laundry was extremely expensive at 7.30 Euro to launder a t-shirt. It was cheaper to buy souvenir shirts than to get laundry done. If I couldnt find a hotel in City Central though, I would not be opposed to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but hotel security could be better”
Reviews.Author: Genevivo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October with an Insight Tour. After a day out, came back to find my room door open. Had security check the room, but they seemed unconcerned, and indicated that maybe the maid left the room open. Some items were missing, though not evident to start with, mainly items of clothing and makeup, shampoo and hair products. The room had no safe, which surprised me, since all the hotels we had stayed in along the way had been equiped with a safe. The room however was very clean and comfortable, the bathroom was large and had plenty of light. A bit out of the way, but was ok when touring with a group that had their own coach. Included Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Roma Hotel is not the best travel choice”
Reviews.Author: beltbuckle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you expect from the Sheraton chain and the beds were comfortable. However, the Staff was unpleasant , surly, and most unhelpful. Out tour company had prepaid the hotel, but they insisted on charging my Visa anyway, even after shown paperwork from this Mobile 5 Star rated Tour Company. They did not have my room reservation, even though I emailed them in advance, their reservations staff confirmed my reservation by return email, and the Tour Company had given them a "Guaranteed Late Arrival" and also use them routinely. (our actual arrival was 5:45 PM Rome Time). The Front desk staff add an extra travel stress that both business and tourist just don't need. The shuttle service from the Hotel and to the downtown is a nice feature, but there are better hotels in more convenient locations to choose as alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even think about staying here”
Reviews.Author: Gervaise
Reviews.Content: Middle of nowhere Room smelly Bag stolen from room - staff seemed indifferent Staff off-hand....Concierge Angelo could not be bothered to book a taxi for 6 people for us. There are better places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: joshy
Reviews.Content: great hotel - good to get away from the centre - a bit expensive but I would say its worth it! Overall I enjoyed the Sheraton experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A good clean hotel, certainly not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: M247
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly because we booked very last minute and there were no hotels available in the centre of Rome. Overall the hotel is clean, has good facilities, the rooms certainly won't disappoint and the staff were very helpful. Ok, so its not in the centre of town but it runs a shuttle every 1.5 hrs to and from the city, which takes about 25-30 mins. This was comfortable and efficient. It did not bother us too much as when you are touring a city you are pretty much out all day. The only downside was the 1hr round trip in the late afternoon/evening when getting freshened up to go out to dinner in the City. This certainly did not detract too much from what was a very pleasant stay. One night we had some hassle with a bunch of US college kids partying at 4am but the hotel sent security immediately and got the situation sorted. The hotel seems a very business / conference orientated place but nonetheless was a good place to stay if you are visiting Rome and either can't get a hotel in the City centre or just want to stay away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “A big dissapointment - Lets the Sheraton Brand down”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Frau
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all. I stayed here several times across May/ June 2006 for business (as it was close to my client site). The check in took almost an hour every stay and the staff were extremely rude. Check-out was worse. The rooms were average. During dinner, some lights exploded above our heads and the glass fell all ove the walking path. Terrified we asked fo help and the staff laughed and said "don't worry - it happens all the time". Not impressed at all and I now stay at the Hilton when in Rome. Final major problem is that the lobby area is super loud and chaotic. In the evening they have live music which is deafening and therefore it is not possible to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: epong
Reviews.Content: Typical American hotel with ample space, unlike most European hotels. The big bath tub allows a good rest after a long day of sightseeing (and walking!). While its location is a little out of the way, the frequent (free) coach rides ensures easy and quick access to the city, dropping off at Campidoglio, just 10 minutes from the Forum and Colosseum. Try to avoid the last ride which can get a little violent, based on our personal experience and the driver will not allow a single addition if the seats are filled. I had to catch a public bus ride (45mins) back to the hotel while my fiance took the last coach seat. At the hotel, try to avoid the first 2-3 levels as the music from the bar can be pretty annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Crisp but EXPENSIVE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights as part of a trafalgar tour and found the hotel to be extreemly clean, neat and tidy. Service was great. Dinner for two in the hotel became a little expensive. For 2 Hamburgers, Mineral Water, Bread and a Coffee we paid 43 odd Euro which was around $80 odd Australian Dollars... Pretty expensive dont you think?? The taxi ride up to the hotel being only 15min from the Airport was a shok to the system. 50 EURO which compares to $100AUD but dont be fooled. These drives know how to screw you. the min. you turn your head the meter changes and really you cant do much about it! The shuttle bus ran on funny times and did not run all day/night. The outdoor dining area was just amazing. I guess the weather topped it off also. I would stay there again if thats anything to go by. Just pack the wallet a little better next time!

Reviews.Title: “Do not even try walking from Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: charliebrownsnoopy
Reviews.Content: On the advice of their staff, we decided to walk from the nearest Metro station (EUR Magliana) to the hotel (original email was an inquiry about shuttle bus -- no longer runs to Termini as mentioned by another reviewer) There is a metro station that's 500-600 meters away; but there are no paved sidewalks for most parts, and you're literally walking besides a main thoroughfare, then have to walk through a highway underpass before you reach the hotel. Check-in staff did not apologize for the wrong advice; obviously the check-in lady has never walked the 600m trip. Rooms is a typical sheraton room. If you're looking for a unique italian experience, LOOK ELSEWHERE This hotel is definitely not worth the suggested price of USD250+. We stayed at a hotel (granted, it doesnt have a pool, room service, fitness centre) in central rome for EUR 220 a night. It was directly above the Spagna metro station, and we had a view of the square besides Spanish Steps (a room for EUR 230 has windows that open onto the steps)

Reviews.Title: “It's not so much the distance, but the isolation”
Reviews.Author: ualsu
Reviews.Content: For future travlers, please note that the Sheraton shuttle does NOT pick up at the train station any longer. The shuttle only picks up and drops off near Pta Venetia. This is important if you are traveling by train. You will need to take a cab over to the shuttle drop. Do not wait at the train station at the place mentioned by past reviews, or you will be waiting for a long time to no avail. The shuttle pickup/drop off point in town does not have a covered area to wait, so when it rains or is cold, it can be unpleasant. The good thing about the hotel is that the rooms at the Sheraton are standard Sheraton rooms. They had the best beds of our 10 days in Italy. As others have mentioned, there are several negatives about this hotel. Food and beverages are very overpriced. This would not be a problem if the hotel was not so isolated. The 25 - 40 minute shuttle ride (depending on traffic) is not the problem. The problem is that the hotel is not near anything. You can not reasonably walk to buy water, soft drinks or snacks. If you want to go to dinner outside the hotel, it is a cab ride to anywhere. It appeared that the hotel was very understaffed. It took a very long time to check into our rooms. On the way back through Rome, we stayed in a hotel in the center. It was worth the extra money to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: doris3
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend break from London with my husband. We got cheap flights with Ryanair to Ciampino, and got ripped off by the airport Taxi driver who charged us 60EUR to the hotel. We could have prebooked the hotel's limosine service for 40EUR, which we took for the return trip to the airport and I highly recommed it. Sheraton is a clean and modern hotel. We booked a junior suite which was a complete waste of money. The standard rooms are large enough, the added sitting room in the junior suite had no windows, virtually no furniture and was a very bleak space which we did not use at all - it would only be of use to families wanting a room for the kids to sleep in. Note there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room which was irritating. The shuttle bus service to the city was prompt and very good. The breakfast was a standard, good buffet. We liked the restaurant for evening meal very much and it was cheap compared to good restaurants in the city. Staff and service were very good. Had a good weekend but would probably not stay at the West Roma again.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Lobby is mostly marble and very spacious. Rooms are comfortable and clean; staff friendly. Good pool but not as large as it looks on-line. No hotel in Italy provides wash cloths. Bring your own!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel.. I'd like to go here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went this hotel last year. It was very happy time, because of their kindness, and cleaness. I'd like to go this hotel again, not because of Rome's ancient heritage but because of this hotel.. ^^

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Roma Hotel & Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Del Pattinaggio 100, 00144 Rome, Italy
